The wide angle to extreme zoom is fantastic in theory.  I absolutely loved the quick and intuitive menu set-up and feature access.  I also loved the push button access for video, and both shooting video and playing it back are faster and easier than any of my Canons.  Indoor flash tests showed the flash to be exceptionally strong compared to what you tend to see on these small type cameras.  Flash could light up a moderate very dark room quite evenly and well.  Shooting outside in good, even light produced generally good, sharp photos, although the color didn't "pop" as much as with other cameras, and in some cases tended to look a bit washed out.  Photos shot indoors without flash and in fairly modest light came out surprisingly well exposed.  I liked the flash setup in which you flick a little switch on the side to pop up the flash before shooting, and I preferred this to Canon's pop-up light on the S95, something most users seem to complain about.What I didn't like was the overall photo quality, and the problems arose when zooming in even a bit.  I was initially intrigued with this camera precisely because of the zoom range (and wider wide angle of 24mm), two things I've missed having on my previous small digital cameras (which tend to be limited to a range of about 28 to 100 or so).  However,  when zooming in it was almost impossible to get a good, sharp photo unless using a tripod or bracing the camera on something, and even braced or tripod shots weren't all that good.  Most of the zoomed photos I shot were completely unacceptable.  Why have such a great zoom range if you can't even get good photos with it?This also seems to be a camera one would probably shoot mostly in Auto, and overall, there weren't a lot of creative choices in the menus.  I guess I'd characterize this camera as an automatic with an extended zoom.  Photos shot at the widest angle (a nice 24mm) were always the best in terms of sharpness.  Zoom in even a little and the blur problems start.  It became clear that if out and about shooting things quickly, one would end up with mostly bad, out of focus photos.I was deciding between the Nikon S9100 to the Canon S95.  Yes, I know they are very different animals.  I've been interested in the S90/S95 for a couple of years mainly because I wanted the degree of manual control it offered and because of the high image quality it supposedly had.  I decided to compare the two cameras in terms of which tradeoffs I wanted to go with, so I brought both the S9100 and the S95 home to try out.  My choice was between the functional ease of use and wider wide angle (24mm)  plus extreme telephoto capabilities of the Nikon S9100, or give that up to get the manual controls and low light capabilities of the Canon, with its more typical 28-105 zoom. I also wasn't sure if the Canon's capabilities would turn out to be mostly hype or not, and I wasn't sure if the Nikon's photo quality would be good by comparison.I took identical photos with both cameras, and the differences became starkly obvious:  the Nikon simply couldn't compare to the Canon in terms of photo quality, color rendition and sharpness.  In every pair of photos I took, the Canon was superior in every way.  I quickly lost interest in the Nikon as a result, despite the many operating features on it which I actually liked a lot more than on the Canon.  However,  it had to come down to photo quality, and having done a side by side comparison with both cameras shooting the same scenes in the same light, the Canon's photos were without exception beautiful and sharp with rich vibrant color while the Nikon's shots were mostly just so-so at best to downright bad, and far too often they were noticeably out of focus and with fairly bland color, a tendency towards looking washed out, and occasionally with an obvious off-color cast.Interestingly, I got sharp, crisp photos from the Canon taken without tripod at the highest digital zoom of 15x (that was a huge surprise to me, I would have expected some fuzziness) while the Nikon couldn't seem to shoot very sharply even at a modest optical level zoom.  Full zoom was impossibly out of focus.  Very very disappointing and a definite deal breaker.  I have the feeling that the image stabilization capabilities of the Canon S95 must be far superior to Nikon's system, which didn't seem to work all that well from what I could see. In all my test photos, the Canon focus was perfect on virtually all of them, but the Nikon produced more bad photos than good ones.  The Nikon photos were considerably inferior to even what I get from my older Canon 800IS and 960IS, both of which take very good photos most of the time.So I returned the Nikon and kept the Canon S95.  I'll add that I've used and been very dedicated to Nikons since the F4's I bought in 1980 ( both still working perfectly), plus I have two other Nikon DSLR's that are wonderful.  However, it does seem that in the realm of the pocket sized digital cameras, Canon is still superior, I'm sad to say.  I'd love to find a Nikon pocket digital that measures up to the quality of its larger cameras, but Nikon just isn't there yet with the pocket digitals, and I'm actually surprised they would release a camera such as the S9100 as it seems like the obvious failures of this camera would  diminish Nikon's legendary reputation.  There also appear to be a lot of reliability issues judging from what I've read in reviews, although in the short time I had the Nikon, I didn't see any of that, everything performed without a hitch.  Rather for me, it was entirely an issue of poor photo quality and very weak focusing capabilities.  I didn't test the video very much on the 9100 because that isn't a feature I'm especially interested in.  The video quality seemed fine, and as I noted earlier, it was very easy to use the video functions quickly.  But overall, I was extremely disappointed in this camera's performance and found its photo quality unacceptable on any level.  I hate to give this camera 2 stars, but that's being generous.

Reviews.Title: Once I read the manual, it is a gem!
Reviews.Author: Jaime B. Cadegan "Avid Shopper!"
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about this camera based on some of the poor reviews about blurry photos, and I took quite a few myself until I read the directions.  If you are focusing on something, and there is a red box, the camera CANNOT focus at that distance and you need to change it (this usually meant backing off the zoom).  I was really disappointed at first, because why HAVE an 18x optical zoom if you can't USE it, but it focuses exceptionally at highest zoom on objects that are far enough away!  Also when doing extreme closeups, you have to remember to turn on the macro mode.  I really can't go into the whole manual here, but suffice it to say that although this is a point and shoot camera, it is VERY feature rich, and it isn't necessarily an out of the box positive experience.  Now, I actually dislike reading, but I found a Nikon app for my IPhone4 that had tutorials on the Coolpix Cameras.  I am in the first 30 days of the camera as I bought it for graduation, so I still might return it if I can't get the hang of it.  I will update later once I really know how to use the camera!  Oh, one reason I bought it was to take still photos while recording (graduation) and the still photo was a big disappointment - that being said - I have not yet read the MANUAL about how to do that effectively!!  I agree also with the reviewer who said to trust the professionals over users in general.  I like to see what people think about stuff, too, but when it comes to high-end electronics, I like to know what CNET thinks.  I do also think it is lame that the battery charges in the camera only.  I did not pay very much for a wall charger, but it was the principle of the thing!  I bought EN-EL12 BATTERY CHARGER FOR Nikon Coolpix S620 S630 S70 because eforcity is an excellent seller of low-cost electronics.  I also bought PNY Professional 16 GB Class 10 Hi-Speed SDHC 20MB/s 133x Flash Memory Card P-SDHC16G10-EF (Black), rooCASE Med Nylon Hard Shell (Red) Case for Canon PowerShot SX210IS 14.1MP Digital Camera Purple, Nikon EN-EL12 Rechargeable Li-Ion Battery for Coolpix S1000pj, S1100pj, S6000, S610, S620, S630, S640, S70, S710, S8000, and S8100 (Retail Packaging), and Sony VCT-R100 Lightweight Compact Tripod with 3-Way Pan/Tilt Head.  Please read my review on the tripod on that page - it is nice, but not perfect for everything!

Reviews.Title: Keeps Exceeding My Expectations
Reviews.Author: Leah C. Fry
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3 digital cameras prior to purchasing this one. At first I thought I wanted a dSLR and almost bought the Nikon 1 V1 10.1 MP HD Digital Camera System with 10-30mm VR 1 NIKKOR Lens. When I really thought about how I take photos, I decided a P&S; is the best option for me. But I wanted something more: quicker response time, more zoom, better macro, and the new feature that promises better performance even in low light. I carry my camera everywhere, so it must be small and light.I did online research and then actually went out and put my hands on a bunch of them. Once I decided on the S9100, I came back online to find the best deal, which was right here at Amazon. I got mine a couple weeks before Christmas 2011, but now it's even cheaper.I LOVE this camera. The only negative I have is like someone else mentioned in his review, you have to charge the dang battery in the camera, which sucks. But it's small, light, fast, and the photos are GREAT. I'd almost call this a hybrid between a traditional P&S; and an entry level dSLR. You can program it as little or as much as you want.I've owned a digital Kodak, Sony and Canon. This little Nikon is head and shoulders above the rest.

Reviews.Title: Night and day worse than S8100
Reviews.Author: Josef Torkelsen
Reviews.Content: I love the Nikon S8100 and was so excited about its successor the S9100.  After playing around in the store taking side by side pictures between the two, it begs the question... why did they release this camera?  No matter how still I hold my hand, the S8100 photos are crisp and lack blurriness compared to the new camera.  Please fix the camera Nikon as I was really excited about some of its features.  Now it takes photos the same as any other camera.  Plus, is it just me or did the camera add some more undesired girth compared to the S8100?

Reviews.Title: Update with my Nikon Coolpix S9100 since Christmas of 2011...
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: FIRST..I WANT TO POINT OUT TO THE FOLKS WITH THE FOCUS ISSUES..I FOUND A SETTING IN THE CAMERA FOR HAND HELD OR TRIPOD...PUT YOUR CAMERA ON THE HAND HELD SETTING...IT MAY HELP OUT WITH THE FOCUS ISSUES!SECOND...A CON...THE SHUTTER BUTTON IS TOO FAR OFF TOWARDS THE CENTER OF THE CAMERA. It should be where the menu dial is.  Who thought of that switch?Ok...I bought this ( as a refurb ) for a Christmas Present for me from my husband ( smile ) and as soon as I got the camera, I did some test shots and put it away for Dec 25th.  So, being that I only took a few test shots,  my current view on this coolpix S9100 is.... pretty good, so far.  I bought it from Adorama and it was a wonderful transaction.  Great price and fast shipping..for free..Two days!  The price I paid for this refurb was about 186.00!  The camera came to me looking brand new and works just fine, so far.  The reason I put four stars is the focusing issue.  I found it had a focus issue with the red eye reduction on, for some reason.  I was trying to get up close photos of me with my dogs by the Christmas tree, holding it in crazy ways so most came out blurry, but it could be me... not handling the camera properly. I could be too quick to judge.  More than several shots were blurry..not one here and there....so that is why I say there could be a foucs issue...still too early to tell just yet. I tried macro mode, auto mode pet portrait and portrait...?  There were some clear shots...I will post a few samples to the review page.  Look for denbink.However, there was no lens lock up or camera lock up like I read from other reviews.. but it is still too early to tell.I do have up to Jan ....? to return the camera...Christmas time allowance. I own other point and shoot Nikon Coolpix's, but I have to say...Nikon's point and shoot cameras are not thier strong ( product ) points.  The DSLR family from Nikon is the most awesome line of DSLR's out there.. I own 3 Nikon DSLR's.  But..can't carry them everywhere, you know.I also own a Nikon coolpix S8000...it's ok.  I keep trying to find the best Nikon point and shoot...not having a lot of luck.  I am constantly reading all sorts of comments, good and bad, so all I can say is...it's all based on opinions.  You really need to try them yourself.  Check all return policies before you buy your new...or REFURBS, but I am sure all of you know to do this..right?  BUY NIKON MANUFACTURED REFURBISHED!  MAINLY BECAUSE.. Most bugs are already out of the refurbs..THEY WORK GREAT!July 26th 2012 Update: I Find I am having some lens issues.  One time It had a lens error but that was just it .... one time.  Then...If I change my zoom or settings, it blurrs.  I turn off the camera and turn it on at the setting I changed it to and its ok then.  It still takes good pictures but I don't like the focusing issue I have with it now.  I feel like sending it in to Nikon for a fix.  But..it's not that bad of an issue to do that, just yet.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great support
Reviews.Author: J. Mursuli "gadget_man"
Reviews.Content: My background: I was a professional wedding photographer for over 20 years. Also did some work as a sports photographer.I was looking for a good small camera with a long zoom  range so I can take along with my SLR's.I bought the camera in April and have used it on 2 trips. The pictures that is camera takes are very good. The zoom lens is great. I was choosing between this camera and the Canon SX230HS and I chose the Nikon because I didn't like the pop-up flash situation on the Canon. This is my 2nd Nikon camera in my 30 plus years of shooting pictures (I've always used Canon; pocket and SLR's).The only problem so far has been the locking up (freezing) situation that most have experienced. I talked to Nikon support on the phone and they were great. I sent the camera in for repair and they fixed the freezing situation at no charge to me. Great service and support. I understand that electronics are not perfect and when problems do arise you want a company that stands behind their product and fixes it quickly at no charge to you.To summarize: great little camera. It's not a camera you would buy if you want MANUAL controls because it is all automatic. Had 1 problem  but Nikon repaired the problem quickly and at no charge.Didn't elaborate too much on features because it's all shown on this website and at the Nikon website.Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera - I've no idea why people run so warm and cold on it
Reviews.Author: ZTT Fan
Reviews.Content: In short, this is a wonderful camera that has allowed me to take photos I never could have otherwise.I've read lots of reports of "blurry photos" with this camera, but I suspect at least some of those people don't realize that at maximum zoom you need to be nearly rock stable with this camera, even with VR turned on; I suspect at least some of the others have had defective units.The zoom lens is the best part of this camera, allowing for amazing concert photos in a variety of lighting conditions, great landscapes and just all-around awesome photos at times I don't feel like lugging or can't use my DSLR.I take a fair amount of concert photos, and this camera unobtrusively fits into a pocket and is great for photos at venues that allow "point and shoot" or "personal use" cameras but not "professional cameras." When comparing photos taken with the S9100 and those taken with my DSLR, many people can't tell the difference, and in fact I've printed numerous enlargements from images taken with the S9100 and absolutely love the quality.My two biggest gripes with the camera are the lack of full manual controls - you have to more or less pick a camera mode that "comes close" and adjust the photo as possible using the exposure controls - and the fact that it doesn't shoot in RAW mode. Also note that the auto mode does tend to overexpose slightly; I almost always set exposure to -0.3 stop and then don't need to overcorrect the results in Photoshop.If you want to investigate other cameras, that's fine, but few other cameras of this size have such a powerful zoom lens, and that's why I purchased and LOVE my S9100.

Reviews.Title: Freezing on Vacation
Reviews.Author: P. C. Knedler "PCK"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for vacation based on reviews and its features.  I really liked the effects on this camera.  I also thought that the picture quality was good.  A few days into the vacation I started experiencing the freezing that people have written about.  You had to take the battery out of the camera to get it to reset.  This happened between 5 and 10 times on my vacation.  I called Nikon while on vacation and they claimed ignorance and told me to return it.  After reading the reviews on their website there were plenty of people with the same problem, even though they claimed they've never heard of this problem.  Luckily I was still within the 14 days when I got back and returned it for another.  I became wary of the new camera based on my experience and have since returned it too despite not having problems with it when I returned it.  So I would not recommend this camera.  I wish that it did work because it is a cool camera.  I have since bought a lumix zs8 and love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Purchase a Nikon S8100 or any other cam
Reviews.Author: Brausche "brausche"
Reviews.Content: This camara is a complete mess. I've had a Nikon S8100, did change it, cause I was keen of having the 18x tele. But while using the tele it is not possible to take a good photo, the tele is searching for the sharpness, never will find it.And all the other features: Forget using them, you will never shoot a good picture. No comparison to the S8100. The only way to take a picture: Take the factory settings, reduce the quality down to 5 MPs and wait for a sunny day. I did open a request at Nikon's support due to the problems I have with that camera. I will keep you updated on their answer to the very poor quality of this Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!!
Reviews.Author: JKai
Reviews.Content: I have the Nikon S9100 and it's not worth buying. I read the reviews on Amazon but gave the Nikon the benefit of the doubt because of its name recognition but to my horror the negative review on fuzziness is TRUE! I have Nikons but to have the S9100 and see how there's fuzziness and even warping on the edges is shocking to me that Nikon would release a camera with so many flaws makes me sad. I will try and send Nikon some of my bad pics and have them explain to me how this is possible from a brand name like Nikon. DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!! The Canons have been my best purchases. My old point and shoot Canon from four years ago at 8 megapixels is better than the S9100. I am sure this will be the last time I purchase a Nikon point and shoot camera. I have worked in a photo lab for four years and always used the old Nikon 35's, but now I am sad to see Nikon release a product like this...

Reviews.Title: Camera turns non-operational at photo #349
Reviews.Author: Carsten A. Holz
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera in mid-July. It stopped working on 4th of August, after my 349th photo ("Lens Error!"). I did not drop the camera or mishandle it in any way. It simply stopped working. --- I was on a trek through Tibet...It started with the camera having trouble autofocusing. In focusing, it would overshoot and not find its way to focus. I would then take an out-of-focus picture, close the camera, and when I started the camera again, would get the message "Lens Error!" The first time this occurred, I restarted the camera about fifty times in the course of two days, every time getting "Lens error!" The lens would move out, close up again, open up a second time, and then close up for good. The monitor was black all the time until the final message "Lens Error!" Around the fiftieth attempt, the camera did start up again and it worked for about another fifty pictures (until photo 349), before it again could not autofocus (on a very simple landscape motive), and the monitor showed the message "Lens Error!" In attempting to restart the camera, this time, it would not even move the lens out any more. The lens remained closed, there was a bit of noise, and then "Lens Error!" would appear. The camera has since remained non-functional, despite about one hundred attempts to restart it over ten days.My most fundamental requirement of a camera is reliability. This one gets a straight F on reliability.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but you need to use care with super zoom
Reviews.Author: Albert "DrAlAlDr"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before traveling to South Africa in May after considering the Canon SX 230 HS, the Panasonic DMC-ZS10, the Sony HX9V and the Samsung WB210.  I have a Panasonic ZS3 and it has served me well, but I wanted a longer zoom.  While there were a fair number of reviews of the Panasonic and Canon, there weren't as many of the other cameras, including the Nikon.  The Canon had pretty good reviews, but the image quality seems to be worse in the recent Panasonic cameras, and the ZS10 was panned by several sites for this reason.  One review highly recommended the Nikon:[...]So I bought the camera and took it to South Africa.  It was my backup camera and the one I used when I didn't want to carry around my DSLR camera.  I got some very good photos and learned some things in the process.  First, 18x is a heckuva zoom in a compact camera.  When you go to full zoom, it is hard to keep from shaking the camera when you press the shutter.  So for low light shots at full zoom, use the 2 sec timer to separate the pressing of the shutter button from the actual exposure.  This really reduces blurring in this situation.  Second, I found the auto scene select feature frustrating, and did better using the auto mode or selecting the scene mode myself.  Third, yeah, at high iso values there is some noise in low light photos, but no worse than the competition and better in some cases.  And I got decent shots even up to 1600 iso as long as I didn't try and blow them up too big (5x7 would be ok).  Fourth, there may be a little softness in some shots, but many shots are very sharp, especially when you consider the 18x lens in this compact camera.Of course, several reviews came out after I bought the camera and returned from my trip.  But those seem to confirm that this really is an excellent camera and under-rated by many of the reviewers on Amazon.  Recommend checking out the photographyblog.com review above and the following:[...][...][...][...][...]

Reviews.Title: COOLEST OF COOLPIXS I'VE OWNED
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL RAMBO
Reviews.Content: I own three Nikon full-size Nikon DSLRs.  The Nikon Coolpix S9100 is the third such Nikon I've bought and used.It's definitely a step up from the S8000 and S8100.  The camera filla a niche in that it's so portable, compactand fast to grab and use.  Extended telephoto range a major improvement over earlier models.  Many user-friendlyfeatures.  You get a lot of quality for a very reasonable price.  Small enough to keep with you at all times.

Reviews.Title: Unpredictable image/video quality
Reviews.Author: quaz59
Reviews.Content: For some reasons my indoor photos came out 60% blurry. I tried various settings flash non-flash, but no luck. The video quality was also very blurry in either modes AF or Full AF.

Reviews.Title: Takes Terrible Pictures & Breaks Easily.
Reviews.Author: J.J. Money
Reviews.Content: 1-  Camera has always taken terrible pictures.  a- They are slightly blurry and fuzzy.  b- Even to get it to that point, you have to hold your breath and hold *perfectly* still for three seconds.  c- Lighting has to be absolutely perfect (rare).  d- On auto mode the pics are crap.  e- Even if you mess with all the settings for each individual shot (who wants to waste time with that??), they are still bad.  f- Back lighting or low light are huge problems. Unless you are in a studio with a bright spot light in your face, you will not see your friends or subject of your photos well.2- Camera also broke for no reason.  a- Early on, the zoom stopped working.  b- That's the whole reason you buy this camera, because it has x18 zoom.  c- You must slap it on the side like a new-born baby to get the zoom to move.  d- And when it does zoom in a bit, the camera freezes (it will not respond. Pushing the shutter button will not take a picture).  e- You have to slap it again to "wake it up".  f- Then, just last week, it COMPLETELY STOPPED WORKING at all, saying it had a lens error.  g- I have always kept it in a nice foam case and never dropped it or had it in the rain.  h- There is no excuse for this camera's faults.I will NEVER buy a Nikon again.My last Kodak digital camera was cheaper and 5 years older and took much better photos.STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nothing but problems
Reviews.Author: CarefulShopper
Reviews.Content: I seem to have had nothing but problems with this camera, which is a shame since I'd done so much research to find the perfect solution for my needs, before purchasing it. Doesn't focus, cannot take macro zoom pics, no longer focuses when zoom, back display panel goes black when you turn vertically, lens error upon zoom, washed out images when take interior photos with flash, and more. I sent the camera in for repair after a year; now another year has passed and all these other problems have cropped up. A shame.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Features Despite Design Flaw Repair Potential
Reviews.Author: Andrew Johnson
Reviews.Content: This item arrived on time and in working condition.PREAMBLE & RELIABILITY:  I purchased this camera knowing full well the 50/50 chance that I was plunking down nearly $200 on a very good pocket megazoom or a paper weight.  The review I found at PCWorld.com of the top 10 pocket megazooms was glowing by virtue of the features packed into it for the price.  I took the time to read the reviews and opinions here as well as other sites, including the Nikon forums, which led to the reason for the low price:  a significant pattern of malfunction, appearing to be design or firmware related that the manufacturer has chosen to address through repair service.  Despite this, I decided to take stock in Nikon's supposed history of quality and the one year manufacturer warranty.Out of the box everything worked very well.  Two months later the notorious "lens error" rendered the camera inoperable.  I shipped it to the Nikon service center in El Segundo, California (at my own expense since the warranty only covers return shipping).  They replaced the lens unit and "upgraded the bios" and shipped it back (Note:  Nikon's service center work is guaranteed for 180 days after repair).  It has performed flawlessly since (nearly two months as of this posting), and I've been stress testing it with long sessions of shooting and filming until the battery is exhausted.FEATURES AND FUNCTION:  I must disclose that this is my first digital camera purchase.  I spent many hours pouring over online reviews and walking through stores examining the different models.The features of the camera are quite good in my opinion.  The stills produced are of good quality for something beneath a SLR with a good array of color modifying modes and after effects, whether in-camera or included PC software.  Autofocus can be temperamental at times but not much trouble.  The video function does very well for what is ostensibly a camera primarily designed for taking stills and the audio is of decent quality, though the lens noise from autofocus and especially zooming are quite noticeable.  Portrait mode works nicely since it will auto-detect faces and track them in motion (also in Pet mode).  I enjoy the "close up" setting very much, as it allows for adjusting the focal point to places other than dead center of the field of view (e.g., far lower left).  The Panorama feature (180° & 360°) produces pleasing results, whether using the "easy" mode or the "assisted" tripod mode.SUM UP:  The features and options are solidly good for the money.  But, be prepared to send it in for repair at least once.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera 9100
Reviews.Author: C. Knisley "CDK"
Reviews.Content: This is my second 9100. I gave my first one to my wife because of the quality of pictures and ease of use.  As for Amazon it is by far the best to order items on line.  My only complaint is that some of the companies linked to Amazon charge a fairly high handling charge for very small items.  Amazon the main company is outstanding.Carl

Reviews.Title: requires basic photo knowledge for good results
Reviews.Author: Statman "Statman"
Reviews.Content: I just picked up on of these beauties and am very impressed. The reviews have been mixed and here is what I make of them.Poor reviews are caused by three factors out of synch with each other, each user caused. 1. shutter speed. You cannot expect a 1/30 sec picture no matter how steady your hand is not to have some sharpness loss due to jitter. Stablilization helps but it is not a panacea. 2. Jitter becomes more exaggerated the more you zoom long. The zoom goes out to approx 450mm in 35mm terms. It is virtually  impossible to hand hold for sharpness at shutter speeds under 1/1000 sec and 3. premature shutter release...you need to wait for the green square to show and then gently press the shutter release past the halfway point. one more point....autofocus performance decreases with lower light, lack of contrast in the subject and very long focal lengths. That causes failure to lock on. Setting the AF to center priority does help somewhat.I shot about 75 test shots yesterday, controlling for these factors and all but 10 were more than acceptable.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Julie A. Russell "Chase Russell"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's not too much bigger than other amateur cameras, and the image quality is far superior. You get surprisingly focused pictures at the 18x optical zoom, and you also have a more clearly defined field of focus (if you focus on a person, the background will be out of focus in a good way).

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpicx s9100
Reviews.Author: jewelee2000
Reviews.Content: I am setting up a store front on Etsy.com under TreasuringthePast and am allowed 5 pictures per item. The pictures I use on this site can make or break me, which is why I choose to upgrade my camera to the 9100. There's alot to learn, but still easy to use right out of the box. The images are sharp and close-ups are easier than ever before. The only thing I recommend is to get a tripod to help keep your shots consistent and clear.

Reviews.Title: Nice very compact camera, let alone for a 18x zoom, big issues hooking camera to TV though
Reviews.Author: jjeff
Reviews.Content: Note I'm not a professional photographer, just a average Joe who likes nice pictures but doesn't want to spend the money(or lug around) a DSLR. Don't get me wrong, I had a decent Contax 159 35mm in my day, along with several nice Zeiss lenses but I no longer want to lug such a device around. Just give me something easy to carry and the ability to manually control basic camera functions, oh and a wide and long range zoom and I'm happy!I really like the extended zoom of this camera. Note the top mm isn't actually a lot more than my 10x Panasonic because the Nikon is a fair amount wider at the low end but even with the added low end(which I really like and would trade off for a little less top end) it still gave more top end zoom than my TZ1 Panny.The image stabilization works quite well when in the higher X's but only after you push the shutter 1/2 way and you hear some motor type of noise, maybe it uses some kind of mechanical type of stabilization?The picture quality is just fine IMO, I don't know that I'd call it night and day better than my Panny but then I never had a issue with the Panny either.I haven't really played around with the movie option of this camera but on paper it sounds nice. I just got a class 10 micro SD card(which I must use with a adapter to bring it up to a regular SD to use in this camera) so I'll probably be playing with that in the future.Likes:Very compact, especially if you consider the very wide range zoom.Wide range zoom.Ability to use lower priced non OEM batteries. Panasonic is #*&% and installs a chip in their OEM batteries disallowing one to purchase aftermarket batteries! The gall that you have to pay more for their batteries because they install a chip not letting you use lower priced batteries.Dislikes:No supplied manual, took me several hours to print out and assemble a pocket sized manual(8 pages per sheet of paper 4 back to back). I know some people use a smart phone but NOT me, I like to look at a paper manual.Popup flash is a + and -. The plus is it's easy to turn OFF the flash, simply don't raise it. The negative is it's right where my finger tends to hold the camera. I can work around it but I'd call it somewhat a negative.NO way to turn off battery icon either on the LCD screen or WORSE yet when displaying on your TV via HDMI or composite output! I can almost see being on all the time for LCD but cannot fathom why someone would ALWAYS want to look at a battery icon when viewing movies on a large LCD, just stupid IMO! Yes I read the whole manual and called Nikon, they confirmed no way to ever turn off the battery icon(note HDMI is NOT active when the camera is charging, tried that too).I'll try and add more +'s and -'s as I run across them.A couple accessories I purchased at Amazon for use with this camera:HDMI to mini HDMI conversion cable to allow camera to hook to my HDTV:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00104XCVO/ref=oh_o04_s00_i00_detailsSD micro card along with adapter, class 10 for shooting HD:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00698ZUHK/ref=oh_o06_s00_i00_details2 replacement batteries and AC/DC charger which allow you to charge batteries outside of camera:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003D8M4DM/ref=oh_o00_s00_i00_detailsDecent horizontal neoprene case holds camera quite well although being soft it doesn't provide a ton of protection:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003NXUMGI/ref=oh_o01_s01_i00_detailsVery protective case(I had before I purchased camera)and the 9100 just fits in perfect. Note my case does NOT have a clear lid which is good. My Pelican 1010 Micro Case Series has a black lid with black rubber not only on the bottom but also TOP for total all sides protection. While the clear might be nice to see whats inside it doesn't allow the top to have rubber to protect whats inside. I also glued a belt loop to the back of mine(PL400) so I can hook it to my belt as a very protective horizontal case. Note the belt loop should be attached so when on your belt the hinge is on the bottom which lets it gently swing down and your camera doesn't fall out. Anyway this is a similar case to what I'm using with great success:http://www.amazon.com/Pelican-Watertight-Micro-Rubber-Liner/dp/B000KNNPGI/ref=sr_1_40?ie=UTF8&qid;=1327193777&sr;=8-406 month update, mostly adding to the - column:When playing back anything from the camera to my TV(via HDMI or composite video) the battery condition icon(upper right corner of screen) stays ON!!! No way to turn it OFF. I'd love to shot the idiot engineer who that that was a good idea. Why would I want a battery icon on my screen when watching movies(or pictures) is beyond me, it's totally STUPID. I scoured the manual and finally called Canon and after 30 minutes was told it was not possible to disable this icon. Apparently older Canon cameras had the option to disable the icon but not this camera???Another major - is everything out of the composite video output is letterboxed!! Event though my video is shot wide screen when it comes out from the composite it has black bars top, bottom, left and right, simply STUPID! HDMI is full screen but I have a older wide screen HDTV with only component(HD) and composite inputs, no HDMI inputs. Hooking this camera up to that TV via composite I only get a postage stamp picture which I can then ZOOM to fill my screen but the picture quality really lacks. Unlike some devices(DVD players for example) this Canon has no settings for full screen composite, MAJOR flaw IMO.Another - is you cannot keep the AC power hooked to the camera when playing back (pictures or videos) to your TV. Hooking up the charging cable disables all A/V output!! Another STUPID feature. Besides having the icon on the screen all the time my battery dies after ~20 minutes of playback and I have to turn the camera OFF to charge it!Basically Canon doesn't want you to use the camera as a playback device, they probably want you to put your card in your PC and watch things that way. Personally I'd prefer to use the camera but that way has some major drawbacks IMO.

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary Helton
Reviews.Content: Simply said.. I love this camera.  I love the effects and the picture quality.  I think for those reviews that claim the photos come out blurry, their settings are probably not set properly because I've never had any photos come out blurry or unsatisfactory.  My favorite option is the color effects. I love it!  Beats having to edit them in photoshop or picnik!  :D  I would recommend this camera to anyone who asked me about cameras.  *LOL*  5*'s

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100
Reviews.Author: Wade
Reviews.Content: This is a great pocket camera.  Pictures are fabulous and the zoom is just what I wanted in a small camera.  Make sure you get an LCD protector because the case or pocket will rub on the screen, and if you lay it down on its back, the screen will get scratched.Update as of 5-6-13.  Still using this camera.  It has worked flawlessly.  Batteries last a long time.  I put a 4GB memory card in it and it holds thousands of pictures.  Have not had a single problem with this camera and it gets a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: Geat camera
Reviews.Author: Yuancheng Liu "Mark T"
Reviews.Content: Crispy pictures and high quality videos, good pictures even in the dark. Many features to discovory and to play around. Zoom could get blury easily, other than that, I like this camera.

Reviews.Title: I would have to agree that it takes blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I read some good reviews from magazines and other websites, but I didn't check the Amazon reviews. I was also in a hurry to buy it, which was a mistake.I agree with the 1-2 star reviews.It does handle lighting and exposure well.It is also very fast, does back lighting very well.but none of this matters if it is out of focus.So I am returning it today.I buy most everything from Amazon now because of their no hassle return policy.

Reviews.Title: AAAA+++++++++++
Reviews.Author: yackyquacky
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with the underdog, with some not so good reviews, I was willing to take a chance.  BOY, am I glad I did.The macro is fantastic, whether you are taking photos of flowers or jewelry, you wont be disappointed.  You will however need to be patient  & you really should read the manual CD.I have taken photos of the kids, flowers, pets, berries, water, ducks, landscapes - using the presets and have gone from camera to computer without even using Photoshop!  A big plus when you are limited with time due to a busy life and family.All in all, I am a happy S9100 owner.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Brooke Butler
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is easy to use, great in low light with or without a flash, and I am thoroughly impressed with the 18x optical zoom which gives you pictures of a higher quality than cameras with digital zoom. The display is large enough to see the pictures and to see the quality. I researched this before buying and I think it is one of the best compact cameras on the market, but it is a bit larger than some others, but the quality is worth the little extra bulk. The quality of the images is comparable to a lower level Digital SLR, and the ease of use was impressive.

Reviews.Title: Multiple problems
Reviews.Author: BBlongisland
Reviews.Content: I have had multiple problems with the S9100 since I bought it in 8/2011. These problems include difficulty focusing, freezing up, and the lens shutter not opening/closing all the way. PLEASE READ UPDATES AT END OF THIS REVIEWI used the camera for about a week after I bought it and noticed that many of the images were blurry, despite my taking great care to press the button down halfway before shooting. About 2 weeks after purchase, the camera started freezing up and could only be turned off by removing the battery. I contacted Nikon and the problem was covered under warranty. I sent the camera in (at my expense) and they fixed the freezing problem, but I was without a camera for over one month while it was in the shop.It is now Thanksgiving weekend, the shutter is not opening all (or closing) all the way, and the camera is not usable.I just remailed Nikon product support about the shutter problem as well as the focusing issue and the autoresponse said they will get back to me in one business day.I really regret buying this camera. At first I thought it was just a lemon but have since read about many other people having the same problems. I think the whole series has problems. I strongly advise against buying the S9100.PLEASE READ THE NUMEROUS NEGATIVE USER REVIEWS ON NIKON'S OWN WEBSITE - THEY REPORT EXACT SAME PROBLEMS I HAVE.* Update - It is now Christmas Eve day and I still dont have my camera back. It looks like they might be waiting for a replacement part. Unbelievable.** Update 2 - NIKON refunded my entire purchase price after New Years. They did the right thing but I had to buy a replacement camera (Canon) for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100 focus
Reviews.Author: L_Mor
Reviews.Content: I have had the S9100 for about a month, taken a few hundred pictures and, if it was a car, it would have been a "Monday" car.The exposure, even in bright daylight, is off: the camera overexposes and the autofocus does not work, period.I have taken the SAME pictures with an old Nikon P50 and the S9100 and there is no doubt: the S9100 autofocus and autoexposure are inaccurate.  This is on more than one picture and in in varied light environment, so it isn't a specific environment that causes this behavior.As a result the zoom is worthless: talk about out-of-focus pictures!It may very well be that a batch of these cameras came out wrong, it can happen.I'll see what Nikon fesses up to....In the meantime, I do not recommend this camera, unless you like the crapshoot.

Reviews.Title: Final Straw
Reviews.Author: G. S. Even
Reviews.Content: After having this camera for several years, and having nothing but trouble with it, I am through! My hubby keeps telling me the reason I get blurry, grainy pictures is that I don't know how to manage the settings, but of the 450+ pictures he took at my brother's wedding last week, only about 20 are worth keeping. If my tech-savvy husband can't get good pictures out of this, how am I supposed to? Whatever camera we buy to replace it, it will NOT be a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Controls locked up
Reviews.Author: scott greenwell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera June 2012.  I love the zoom, and mostly it works for what I need.  Image are clear, zoomed images are a little less so.  Video works pretty well.The purpose of the review is a problem I had with the controls not responding, similar to others  complaint.  The display comes on, but no controls would work, and I would have to pull the battery to turn it off.  It would link with the computer and I could view my pictures, but I could not work the camera.  I called cust support and they said to send it in.  I turned it on while on the phone with them, and did not bother pulling the battery when I hung up.  After a few minutes the camera turned itself off, and rest set itself.  I can now turn it on and use it as normal. I could not find this advise in my search, so hopefully it helps someone else.  If it locks up, it can't hurt to leave it on until it auto shuts off.  It worked for me, for now.I like the camera but put one star as a warning for this issue.

Reviews.Title: I loved this camera...
Reviews.Author: Jerry Neely
Reviews.Content: I loved it right up to the point that it randomly became a $300 paper weight.  Like so many others, it simply became unresponsive one day.  It would power on and the video screen would become active, but it would not respond to any buttons.  To power it off, I had to pull the battery.  Of course the warranty period was expired and despite this being an apparently common design defect, Nikon wants $115 to repair it.  I'd been a loyal Nikon customer since 1980, but I've bought my last Nikon if this is how they stand behind their products and treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: blurry
Reviews.Author: riverrat
Reviews.Content: I hate to write a negitive review, but we are defintly unhappy with this camera.  We bought it after reading many glowing reviews.  However, we have been plagued by blurry and out of focus pictures.  After doing some searcing online we have found that many others have expirenced the exact same problems.  We've tried the factory reset recomended by Nikon and did not notice any change.  For the money we spent on the camera we are not pleased by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: Hate thidls camera.  Hate it.
Reviews.Author: supermiller "jdm"
Reviews.Content: Christmas 2011 my husband and I asked for a "nice but simple" camera with video capabilities that we could use for taking pics of our one year old son.  We received this as a gift.  I hate it.  Aside from the lens locking up as so many other users have experienced it's just far too complex for everyday use.  The settings have to be changed for the slightest change in environment.  By the time you figure out what you need the moment has passed.  We spent half of a Jason Mraz concert trying to figure out how to take a great shot while zooming in on a dimly lit stage (auto mode.)  I still can't get a good shot of my toddler in action.  They all end up blurry and look like they were taken on a 35 mm and developed at the local pharmacy.  I see gorgeous pics on flicker but they're all nature stills.  Basically for a normal, everyday family this camera is too advanced.  Go with something much more simple.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: T. Rupp "Golf Anyone?"
Reviews.Content: This camera does a credible job with a few exceptions. Autofocus for one is sub par and would definitely make for a better camera if it would only focus on what is said it is focussed on. Second, the menu structure is just abysmal. For a pocket camera there should be a much better integration of features; instead I find the options all over the map. The Auto mode works for less than half of all normal situations I encounter. In short, not terrible but not wonderful either...just okay.

Reviews.Title: zoom motor problems
Reviews.Author: kokana "kokana"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera long enough for it to be out of warranty but it hasn't been used very much nor mishandled but I started experiencing some locking up issues.  Some of the pictures I took were good, others were just okay.  But the final straw is that the camera would just quit working, the lcd screen still worked but none of the buttons would wake the camera up or turn it off.  I found that I had to pop out the battery to make it turn off and start back up.  I think that the zoom motor is the problem, the problem started getting worse and I found that if I fiddled with the zoom mechanism that the sometimes the camera would unlock.  Finally, I am just going to replace the camera because I need a point and shoot camera to be ready to work when I need it.  Disappointed, I'll be trying a Canon next time.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera EVER
Reviews.Author: Sarah Hollingsworth
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon coolpix s9100 back when it was $350 or so last year. This is by far the worst camera I have ever owned, and I have only had point and shoots before this- nikons as well but so much better. The major flaw with this piece is the shutter speed- it is just plain slow, too slow to catch any moving object in focus. Putting the camera in sports mode solves the problem for subjects that are not moving, but it is literally impossible to capture anything that is moving even a little bit. I will never buy another Nikon again. I wasted so much money!!

Reviews.Title: disappointed with my Nikon camera & Nikon customer service
Reviews.Author: Virginia L. Arana "ginnie lou"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Nikon camera at the end of February 2012 and took it on vacation in mid May 2012.  The camera stopped working in the first week of my vacation.  I returned the camera to Nikon on June1 2012.  It is now July 23, 2012 and the camera remains at Nikon waiting for parts.  Numerous phone calls to Nikon have not solved the problem.  They are "waiting for parts".  I believe by this time they should have sent me a new camera.  I will NEVER buy another Nikon product.  Fortunately I had brought my old Cannon camera on the vacation and it worked well.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THE S9100
Reviews.Author: robin kirkorian
Reviews.Content: I gave nikon a try after owning several Canons.  Big mistake.  This camera was being fixed after one month of use, approximately the 6th time the lens wouldn't shut.  I got it back after SIX MONTHS and it was as if they never touched it.  I sent it back for the second time and they had it for another 6 weeks - they wouldn't replace it, it was supposedly "fixed".  The company is completely horrible with customer service, so good luck if you need repairs.  I've used the camera about 10 times since and now suddenly after charging my camera all day I turn it on and after ONE SECOND it says "battery exhausted".  This camera is nothing but problems and was a waste of money.  I don't even think the picture quality even compares to my Canons that I've had.  Disappointment is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Wagner L. Dona
Reviews.Content: I've purchased this camera 3 months ago and after using only twice, I got an error message and the lens would not open. I contacted Nikon and was instructed to ship the camera to their repair center in N.Y. Every time I check the status online it shows on hold waiting for parts. I've contacted them a number of times and they keep giving me the run around. Since then I did an online search and found out that this is a common problem on these cameras - a manufacturing defect - and to make matters worse, the Nikon technical support will give you anything BUT support. Don't waste your money - for the same price you have better options.Wagner

Reviews.Title: Too many focusing irregularities
Reviews.Author: Rower
Reviews.Content: I wound up returnng this camera and bought a Nikon P7000 (an older model for $80 more from Amazon).  The S9100's focusing just seemed too erratic, even with the work arounds.  If you purchase a P7000, be sure to get the lattest firmware upgrade; mine shipped with 1.1 while you can download 1.2.  The original review for the S9100 follows:This camera was purchased to photograph print; which actually requires excellent resolution and low light capability.  We've been using a far less expensive Nikon Koolpix that has preformed remarkably well in all areas except low-light, so we had great hopes for this camera.  The only general use it has had was to photograph a dog, which came out beautifully.I've had reservations about the camera from the moment it was turned on, the barrel operation was not smooth.  A co-worker felt that wasn't a big deal, I'm less certain.  Getting consistent results in low light is tricky, I'd advise using the flash.  Also, the focus, as reported by others, is problematic in low-light.  No wonder even local stores are offering this camera at $130 off the original price.However, the technical specs. are remarkable for a camera that cost around $200: 18 X optical zoon, reportedly special features for low light use etc.  It may also take some time to learn the workarounds for some of the many problems listed by other reviewers, but there probably are workarounds.  Our limited use of QuickTime "movie making" has yielded impressive results, especially considering how long a shot one can record.I'm keeping the camera but went back to the store and purchased a 2 year warranty (for $17), I'm hoping to learn more workarounds and that the lower-than-normal use will make this $200 purchase last.  I'd probably not keep the camera if it weren't for the match between our particular needs and it's reported special features.

Reviews.Title: Read menu and practise
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Some review are very negative but if you know how to use a SLR 20 years ago or read the literature or at least try to practice by using different setting, it isn't hard to figure it out that it is indeed a great product. Setting in auto mode will get good picture.  It has better picture quality than a lot of camera in this price.  The value exceed price! Get it and play!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: mreynolds
Reviews.Content: Bought this for Christmas and have only used it for a couple of days. Appears to a very good camera with a million great features. Trusted reviews on amazon for this product and I am very happy. The only thing I had to Google to solve was I kept getting blurred pictures. Apparently if you leave the camera set in auto mode and try to take pictures inside the sensor is so good on the camera it slows the shutter speed down to get more light. This causes the camera to blur. If you use the flash all the time inside you eliminate this problem and have beautiful pictures. You can also read the manual and learn how to use the millions of unique settings to become a very good photographer.  For the price this is a very good camera with the capability to rival some very expensive cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great as an almost pocketable extra camera
Reviews.Author: Desert Rat
Reviews.Content: I am a photo enthusiast and almost exclusively use DSLR's and an SLT. I bought this camera knowing its limitations and so far have not been disappointed. I have not experienced any of the problems that other users mentioned but in fairness I don't use it a lot. It would be nice to have RAW capability and PSAM settings but that's not what this camera was designed for. Sometimes it's nice to sit back and let the camera do the work and it does that very nicely especially in lower light situations.

Reviews.Title: Nice but not good enough
Reviews.Author: RIK
Reviews.Content: Pros1. 18x optical zoom in a compact body2. Image stabilization seems to work well even with optical zoom extended3. Flash is in a place where you'd like to keep your finger but I like the fact that unlike other cameras (ex. Sony Cybershot DSC HX9v) it doesn't popup automaticallyCons1. Focus in low light situations with optical zoom extended wasn't great. Even though focus locked the images didn't turn out to sharp. There was no blur due to shaking so I don't think it was stabilization problems - just that the focus wasn't good enough. This was a deal breaker.2. With optical zoom extended can't focus on close by objects. Sony Cybershot DSC HX9V has the same problem. Casio Exilim series can handle this scenario well.3. USB cable cover is so flimsy that it bends semi permanently just after a few minutes of keeping it connected to the computer and then you have to keep the camera in such a position that it can become flat again.4. Panorama mode is hidden as a special scene, many folks who don't read the detailed manual off the CD Rom or the internet won't discover it (its not even mentioned in the printed quick start guide).5. No GPS. Even though I don't care much for GeoTagging but GPS based apps providing info without cellular data would be great for remote touristy spots.6. Sound customization is also hidden (would have to read their detailed manual to locate it) and limited compared to other cameras (ex. Exilim series).

Reviews.Title: CoolPix S6000 "upgrade"
Reviews.Author: Tim C.
Reviews.Content: This purchase was an "upgrade" from the S6000.  The photos from this camera are great.  I am still learning what this camera can do.  It is not as easy as the S6000 or maybe I have simply become accustom to the older model but I have missed a few photos for not being fully versed in the use of the S9100.  I am pleased with this camera thus far and have produced some awesome pictures.  I know that once I master it, I will love it even more.  It fits nicely in my shirt pocket and I seldom go anywhere without my new CoolPix S9100.  I give this camera a 4 star rating due to the 'not so simple' learning curve of it's operation and functions.  This camera does a lot for such a small package.

Reviews.Title: A Sleek, Professional-Looking Camera (with features to back it up!)
Reviews.Author: aggie4life
Reviews.Content: This camera continually impresses me.  Perhaps the coolest feature is its ability to take amazing pictures in extremely low light situations.  I don't like the look of pics with flash and with this camera I almost never need it!  I've amazed friends with this feature.  When they find out I took the picture without the flash (on purpose) they are blown away every time.  There are some situations that I don't want the camera to compensate for the low light, artistic photos for instance, but it can be adjusted.The design of the camera is very sleek (this was the main selling point for me).  Before I even turn it on, people say, "Wow, that's a really nice camera."  The matte finish makes it look like a professional's tool, instead of looking like a shiny, plastic, point-and-shoot party cam.  It's nice that the flash is hidden until you decide you need it; it adds to the cameras clean appearance.  Unlike the S8200, with the S9100 you can control (manually) when the flash pops up and when it closes.  A major gripe that I've seen with the S8200 is the annoying flash that you cannot control.I'm still learning the features of this camera, but as I said, it continues to surprise me.  As I have explored more of the features/functions, I have found that the buttons and menus are quite intuitively designed.  I'm very happy I purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for about 45 days
Reviews.Author: Fisherme99
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera before trip to Alaska as an upgrade from a previous Coolpix model which still works and we are pleased with.  We wanted this camera for the added zoom, quality and added features.  The Alaska pictures turned out great!  180 degree panaramic feature is easy to use and pictures turned out awesome!  Never got the 360 feature to work, even used it on a tripod to no avail.  Here's the kicker....got home from the trip took a coouple random shots and then went on another trip.  Went to take our first photo of the trip and the camera did not work, at all.  Turned on and then nothing, no buttons worked.  Disappointed to say the least.  I'm also 110% it was never damaged, not dropped or bumped or anything as I'm super anal about keeping the camera in a super padded case.  Just sent it back to Nikon, hoping they'll just replace it since it's less than 45 days old.

Reviews.Title: freezes up in zoom and takes blurry shots (UPDATED with info on how to send back to Nikon)
Reviews.Author: J. Rich
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera in the BLACK style in April (before most of the bad reviews) and THREE weeks later this camera started freezing when I zoom in for a shot. Not every time, but enough to not "trust" this camera. Yes, removing the battery puts it back in operation, like a "ctrl-alt-delete" type of restart. Funny enough, this whole time I have been thinking I must have done something to make this happen, to "break" this camera so to speak, so I've been sitting here sad and feeling guilty about it, I'm so glad I came here to read the updated reviews to find that low and behold I'm not the only one this is happening to!I also thought my photos were coming out blurry because of who I am taking photos of...my kids, often times in low light (and they can't be still), but even in still shots with everything set to auto it's blurry.Not sure what I should do now about this camera, what a huge waste of money. We work hard for our money to buy special items like this and Nikon seems to disregard that completely by taking no responsibility for it yet. I feel burned since obviously they know about this problem and didn't remove camera from the market. I'm trying to figure out what to do now, not really wanting to return it for another 9100 that has the same problems...UPDATE #1We are sending this camera back to Nikon for repairs. Considering other reviewers experience with having the same problem even after repairs, I asked Amazon for advice during my initial call to them (the representative was very helpful), if we are unable to resolve the issue on our own, they will step in (and perhaps give us a refund).For those having the same problem, here is the Nikon Contact info:"Repairs resulting from defects in material or workmanship will be performed at no-charge by Nikon Inc.."Phone: 800-645-6678How to reach a live person:Press 1 for USPress 4Press 1I had no problems reaching a live person who was helpful and said the camera should definitely be sent in for repairs.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jenvy
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty decent buy for the price. My only complaint is that it takes a little too long for the camera to process the image once you have taken it, depending on the setting (this is usually only an issue in settings with low light). The continuous picture setting (the setting that takes multiple pictures within about a second) isn't the greatest. It takes forever to process the pictures, and they don't even turn out that well. Other than that, I love my camera! The video camera is EXCELLENT! The HD image looks great and the picture is better than any other digital camera's video that I've seen so far. Just make sure that you purchase a large memory card to go with it because HD videos and 12 megapixel photos take up a lot of space. I purchased a 16 GB, which works well. It stores about 2400 photos on the highest megapixel setting. I'm not so sure about the space it takes for a video though.

Reviews.Title: Worst Nikon Cool Pix model I have ever owned - and I have owned several
Reviews.Author: J. Reisman "midnitdr"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera but I think that in trying to add some very high end features Nikon has sacrificed durability and ease of use.  The addition of the 18X lens in this little package may just be the stick that has broken the camels back.  I bought this camera in April 2011 after trying out the S8100.  I really liked the feature that the flash has a separate pop up lens.  I also figured the 18x zoom would be nice - although I was aware that there would be a lot of blur at full zoom hand-held, it was still nice to have that feature.  With only one month of shooting the camera froze up and wouldn't work.  I got it replaced from Costco where I bought it even though I was worried this was a very bad sign - I still like the features better then the 8100 model.  I did have trouble with mixed results on the pictures - some were excellent and some were blurry but I was willing to work with that and assumed over time I would be able to find what settings would work best.  Then my main trip of the year - I am out in the desert and even though this was the most dust free year for this area - the small amount of dust in the air was enough to put my camera out of commission after shooting only 5 or so photos.  The zoom stopped extending and retracting and the camera would not close unless I disconnected and reconnected the battery.  It wouldn't even take a simply picture unless I smacked it on the side.  There was a grinding whirring noise coming from it's little engine that I had never heard before.  I had not dropped it or done anything harsh with the camera.  In fact I am not even sure if the dust is the issue - but that is an educated guess since that might explain the problems with the extension and retraction of the lens.  Bottom line - this camera needed a strong engine to drive the lens and a better cover design that would allow it to open and retract even with some dust on the side of the lens and not allow the dust to get into the working mechanisms.  My old 3100 took a beating on a trip across Italy and worked beautifully without a hitch.  I have since had the 4100 and the 6100 series - the 6100 did require a good cleaning after a dusty shoot but actually continued to work and only stopped when I was trying to clean the lens and accidentally jammed it while it was retracting.  (I later learned that just a gentle twist would have freed it and never had that problem again.)  So the final verdict - if you don't need a camera right away, wait and see what the next generation cool-pix is like or maybe consider another brand, although I hate to say that after years of loving my cool pix cameras.  The 8100 might also be an option if you can't wait - but I really prefer the pop up flash so it isn't going off all the time when I don't want it to flash.

Reviews.Title: The camera I've always wanted---then I hated it.
Reviews.Author: Tom Cuillier
Reviews.Content: This S9100 is the camera I have always wanted---megazoom, great pictures, easy to use, but sophisticated enough to do creative projects.  Problem is---it was a train-wreck after just 3 days.  The camera would freeze-up, removing the batttery would fix it. The zoom lens would freeze and required a slight twist on the lens body to get it working.  These problems only got worse & harder to correct as time went on.In checking the Internet---these problems and others are VERY common with the S9100.  What has happened to Nikons' quality?I have asked Nikon Support when I can purchase a new S9100 that will be dependable.  All they will say is to try another Nikon product! No way!  I'm going to go back to Canon for a replacement.  Will be purchasing an SX230HS Canon within the next few days.I really wish I could write a 'glowing' positive report on the S9100, because it's an awesome, amazing camera---it just doesn't work!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PICTURES. . . . LOW QUALITY CONSTRUCTION/FIRMWARE?
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: I bought an s9100 a few months ago and was blown away by the quality of the low light pictures that the CMOS was capable of producing. After two weeks, the camera suddenly froze up. I thought it was a fluke so I exchanged it for a new one. Several weeks since then and now the NEW camera has suddenly froze up! What are the odds that you get two faulty cameras? Chances aren't that good. So I decided to browse the internet to see if anyone else was experiencing the same thing. Turns out there are quite a few complaints about it freezing up and auto-focus not working(which, the day before it froze up, I had focusing problems). I wish Nikon would address these issues, they would have a wonderful product if they would work out the bugs.Side note- Each time the camera locked up, I was in a position to photograph some great memories. Its a shame that I can't look back on these great times in a picture. Just sayin' ~W

Reviews.Title: Technologically Advanced AND Affordable
Reviews.Author: FleurDeLiss18
Reviews.Content: I bought my Nikon Coolpix S9100 about a month ago after comparing it to the Canon Powershot sx230hs.  (And I did a LOT of research!!!)  After being convinced that the cameras were practically the same (there were equal pros and cons to each), I went with this Nikon because of the greater zoom (18x vs. 14x) and the unique ability to take pictures WHILE filming video.After owning the camera for awhile, I find the picture quality to be "excellent."  The low-light technology seems to be excellent also; it helps because I take a lot of pictures at concerts.  This camera is a GREAT value for an intermediate photographer, who wants professional-quality photographs.The only negative thing I would say at this point is that it takes awhile to "get to know" all of the settings that make this camera so versatile.  It takes great photos without knowing how to use all of its features; however, to make the most out of the camera, it'll take some time.  Also, learning how to focus the camera takes a little practice, when doing artistic shots, but its easy to shoot "everyday" kinds of pictures (landscapes and portraits).Overall, this is a wonderful camera that I would recommend to anyone who wants one of the most technologically advanced (with low-light technology), most affordable cameras (try to get it on sale) on the market!Again, I did a lot of comparison research when deciding on which camera to purchase, so comment if you have any questions about this product!

Reviews.Title: Depends on what your looking for.
Reviews.Author: babyx
Reviews.Content: Bought one a little over one month ago with the full understanding that some people had found the camera to freeze up from time to time.A neat audio video recorder, however, with this camera, everything must be viewed under the light of the extreme zoom feature.  If you are a stickier about photo quality being 100% consistent, this one is not for you.  I have found the auto focus to be fussy, and it's the only one you've got.  This is a camera in which everything is OK and you get a great zoom.As for the freeze issue.  I had thought before the purchase that the freeze issue was a result of this zoom feature.  For me at least this seems to be true.  Yes it freezes all the time which could be really annoying, but, all one has to do is give the slightest assist to the largest lens ring as you turn it on, just the slightest tug to get it to full extension, and you will see the little green light around the power button go off, and the camera will be ready to use.Some may have a different set of circumstances, but for me, this is the only ill behavior this camera produces that I have found.  Nikon needs to give this model a little more motor power, or more lubricity and more accurate dirt seals om the lens bits that are rubbing against each other and sliding back and forth when the camera is first turned on.

Reviews.Title: BLURRY PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Nick 4The Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Disapointed =(It takes such blurry pictures for a point and shoot! I am looking forward to buying a Canon s95 now....I've had many friends with camera experience saying it should not be blurry as it is. We tried comparing many settings with it and also with the Canon s95. Canon s95 wins by far!

Reviews.Title: Poor warranty support too!
Reviews.Author: J. Galeano "galejai_hou"
Reviews.Content: Same problem reported by other users, elevation freezes after 2 months of use. The worse part is the warranty support, it took the company a month to get parts to repair my camera. I am really disappointed with this company. This was my first and last buy with them.

Reviews.Title: Very Bad Customer Service
Reviews.Author: wanabe photoman
Reviews.Content: Nikon coolpix s9100I bought this camera in early July 2011.I loved the pictures and the videos that I was getting .By mid September 2011. I started having problems with the telephoto motor and focus .I mailed the camera in for repairs on October 13,2011.After receiving the camera they informed me it was in parts hold .I finally got the camera back November 17, 2011.It took too long to repair and return.Not to mention the 12 month warranty is now only good for 11 months.I missed shooting Halloween and the Veterans Day Parade.My thoughts are for the price I paid for this camera they should have just sent me a new one. I had only used it for 10 weeks when it started turning into a huge heap.The old camera could have been fixed and sold as refurbished.Lets face it over seas products have a good profit margin.The choice they made was to neglect the needs of the customer and go for the bottom line.How unfortunate for Nikon .If you're concerned about the customer service you might get think twice before buying Nikon products.SincerelyWanabe Photoman

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M. HUGHES
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why some of the reviewers of this camera are having such a diffcult time producing clear photos. Well I really do know why they cannot....it is because they are not following directions or vey experienced with digital photography. All digital cameras that auto focus need a second or two to catch the image and focus the camera to produce the best results. Once the camera has the image focused, most cameras will continue the same shot over and over. This camera is no different. Don't buy a high quality Nikon digital camera if you do not know how to use one. Buy a Kodak or a lower end model from Nikon as they are usually designed for the novice photographer. All of the web sites that reviewed this camera, rate it very high and I agree with those ratings thus far.Yes it will produce some blurr in some photos depending on light. Other then that it will produce great photos. You will get a red square if the photo does not focus correctly and this seeme to be related soley on light conditions and/or the settings. You can compensate for light conditions. I am still playing with the ISO vs auto settings and this seems to help with blurr on some photos. this is an advanced camera not for the novice or better than novice. You need to be an advanced user to take great shots with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disaster!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: joedunn26
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!  Have owned for just under 1 month.  After a few hundred shots, thee lens no longer works.  Check the Internet.  Nikon c/s wait times now exceed 30 min due to the troubles they are experiencing with this camera. I bought it for a vacation in yellowstone park but it failed before I even arrived. When I asked Nikon to replace it to save the trip, they said I needed to ship it back to them even though they are fully aware that these cameras are experiencing widespread failures. They said that they were extremely sorry but that I could buy postcards to compensate for the lost pics. Nikon has really changed. My friends have all switched to Canon due to Nikon's lack of interest in providing customer service. The lens failure message is accompanied by a grinding sound emanating from the telescoping lens.  Oh, I almost forgot. They said that I could remove the battery after each picture to reset the lens and repeat this process for each picture.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100
Reviews.Author: chief
Reviews.Content: A little hard to use for a novice.  The owners manual is pitiful.  But when you download the complete factory manual and spend some time working with it, it's great.  Only buy it if you have time to practice with it.

Reviews.Title: Best compact digital camera of the year?
Reviews.Author: shishigeo
Reviews.Content: Have been a Canon user for over 30 years but after doing on-line and hands-on demo reviews for an in-between digital camera for my Rebel digital SLR of many years,I decided to settle on the Nikon Coolpix S9100 over 2 comparable Canons, Panasonic Lumix and Sony models. The features that influenced my decision were the powerful optical zoom, ability to take snapshots while taking videos, using the wide to telephoto feature while videoing, as well as decent lag time delays between shots, and a tolerable shutter lag-time.Having had the Nikon for only about 2 weeks, I am quite satisfied with this camera but am realizing that this Nikon has many more features that is comparable or even superior to the bulkier digital SLRs.The negative attributes for this camera applies to most all compact(small) digitals, i.e. shakiness at telephoto ranges, slow shutter lag times, lag time between shots, limited ranges of apertures in wide to telephoto shots. Although this camera offers more features and applications than what I wanted, I am quite disappointed by the absence of a soft cover instruction book that should have been included for the $329.00 cost.I believe this model of Nikon Coolpix may be the benchmark for future small digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: I'm baffled by the rave reviews
Reviews.Author: Shannon Dandrea
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I did extensive research, read way too many reviews & compared this camera to many others.  This camera received enough praise  to convince me to buy it. I'm not an expert but I take my camera everywhere & use it daily.  I know what a good & bad photo looks like.I took about 100 photos with this camera ranging from stills, pets, kids, landscapes & action. I also took the same photos using different settings on the camera, yet just about EVERY PHOTO CAME OUT BLURRY!  Forget action shots all together, even in sport mode, a complete blurr. My simple, slow Canon A1200 can catch action shots better.I'm thinking there has to be something wrong with my camera so I called Nikon.  The rep was very nice & tried to help.  He had me take several simple photos of a person sitting on the couch using different settings on the camera.  Every shot came out terrible.  I even downloaded them to their web-site so they could see. I told the guy I feel like the camera is too fast for it's own good. Meaning, it takes the picture before it allows itself to fully focus. The speed of this camera was one of the selling points for me.This can't possibly be the same camera that other people are raving about.  Maybe it was damaged in shipping?Luckily Amazon has a fairly hassle free return process.I'm going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100 18X
Reviews.Author: Piyush
Reviews.Content: I purchased Nikon Coolpix S9100 18X camera from Precision Camera, L.P. via Amazon Fulfillment.I liked the camera and in general all its features. I was looking for a high zoom pocket camera and finally zeroed in on this. Nikon, the brand in itself speak volumes and there is no need to say why I chose this. Only thing which I found missing in this camera is a manual setting and exposure time control. But given that it is a compact camera, I'm ready to ignore that.All in all it is a very good camera and the picture quality is very good. I specially liked the image stabilization feature on high zooms. It makes life easier.Advice for all : Purchase an extra battery (original Nikon EN EL12 Li-Ion), you'll need it when you'll realize that you cannot keep the camera in your pocket / camera case. I purchased it from iOttie via Amazon Fulfillment.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality for so many good features
Reviews.Author: Eduardo
