Reviews.Content: I have a nikon s3 camera I bought in 2006, which made ''me decide to buy a new camera purchase the same brand (Nikon S9100).The surprise is that the image quality has not improved in almost anything, but with the difference that now each picture takes up more space. Well in the dark the best quality image is not what happened with my previous camera.I tried a thousand ways to use that great 18x zoom but the pictures are blurred, some more some less. With a tripod the pictures are better, indicating that if I use the zoom I have to walk to load the tripod, you can imagine what that means in terms of portability.When I take pictures to the computer, the first sensation is spectacular, but when I enlarge the disappointment comes, poor detail in the place of focus and the rest of the picture distortion.My cousin comes with a camera that cost a little more than half of what it cost me to me, I will not say it would be making the brand advertising and surprise again. The zoom is 10x and the photos are displayed with a unique detail unlike my camera into the computer.The question is, for Nikon camera brought to market with a unique zoom if you can not use it? Which is why the images do not show the same detail on the computer?Perhaps it will be F3.5, maybe it will be the system of stabilization (sensor shift) is very poor, it may be that the CMOS sensor has problems. I do not know really, but I am deeply disappointed in this purchase. Well my wife does not know anything about the decisions that I made in that case take pictures and I have unfortunately become a pain.

Reviews.Title: Very poor quality camera and customer service to support it
Reviews.Author: Mama to Boys "The mom"
Reviews.Content: Very poor quality camera and customer service to support it.  I got this camera for Christmas 2012 and had it less than six months before it began malfunctioning.  I never dropped the camera, although it was stored in my handbag out of a case.  I believe it is very sensitive to humidity.  The first time we received a "lens error" and the camera would no longer work (any time I turned it on the lens moved in and out and then the LCD would display "LENS ERROR") was when we were out at night around a fire, roasting marshmallows with the kids on a humid summer night.  I sent the camera in for repair, which was covered under warranty.  When I got the camera back the first place I took it was camping (my first time with the kids, so I needed to document the weekend!!!) and after the first night I woke up the next morning to the same "LENS ERROR" (within the month of getting it back). So, instead of documenting the weekend I got a few good daylight pictures with my phone camera and sent the camera in and missed getting to take any pics at thanksgiving.  I just received Nikon's report on the cost of my repair...$119, the camera is still under a year old, the repair was done around a month ago, I attempted to use the camera on one occasion, and now they won't cover it under warranty due to the casing being scratched...even though it was repaired under warranty one month ago in the very same condition.  Poor quality camera, poor customer service, I would recommend a Canon (I had that one for four years before it finally died).  This camera came highly recommended by Consumer Reports, I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Thomas L. Spalding "Bolero"
Reviews.Content: I bought Nikon because I thought Nikon made the best cameras, well aparently I was mislead.  With less than maybe two or three hundred pictures taken, the Coolpix s9100 started acting funny.  It started with not being able to use the optical zoom or snap a photo.  I could not turn it off, so I just had to wait for the camera to cycle down, then it would work again.  It started doing this often and I missed some great  pictures. The battery was fully charged.  Now the camera lens is stuck and will not retract at all.  It just plain won't work.  I called the local camera repair guy and he said it would cost at least one hundred fifty dollars to fix it.  That is if I didn't need parts.  The camera store advised that because the camera was eighteen months old, Nikon would not fix it and maybe I should just go buy another camera.Well, It will not be a Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: R. K. A. Phillips "Roy5051"
Reviews.Content: I just cannot understand why there are so many 1-star reviews of this camera - I have had mine for almost 2 years with no problems. I have taken some 1500 photos in that time and am delighted with the camera's performance.  The pictures are outstanding, the rear screen is just unbelievably good, and the ease of use is just fantastic.  So much so that I have ditched my DSLR and use this camera almost exclusively.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: AmeliaLeona
Reviews.Content: I received my camera a few days after i ordered it. It was in like-new condition. The flash sticks a bit, but that's my only concern.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100  mp purchased from Amazon Marketplace Is a Huge Disappointment!
Reviews.Author: Sylvia M.
Reviews.Content: This camera and the seller were big disappointments.  Camera came in a box that usually is the type that refurbished cameras are shipped in. Not an original box.  The camera seemed ok when I used it the first time, but when I used it the second time, the lens cover would not close.  I requested information instructing me on how to return it and shipping info.  I was first told that by Amazon that a shipping label would be sent to me, but when I called the number that Amazon had emailed to me, I was told that it was too late to return it.  My first message told me that I had until Sept. 12, 2013.  That message was sent in mid August.  I am very unhappy and I will probably never again purchase any electronics from Amazon, if anything.  .  I paid over $259.00 for this camera (including shipping) and it was not as described and it was Damaged.  S. Manning

Reviews.Title: Quite pleased with the photos and the operation
Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: So, I did hesitate a bit when I considered buying this camera, because it sounded like hit-or-miss...either I'd get one that worked great, or I'd get one that would freeze and never work again.  Well, maybe I got lucky, but mine has been an excellent camera.  I've had it for over a year now and it is a significant upgrade over my old Samsung 7mp camera and better than any other point and shoot that I've used (though I consider this a bit more than a point and shoot).  I liked it so much that I recommended my little sister to order one, which she did, in the red color.  Her's has had a few issues, but I blame that on her not taking care of it (sounds like there's sand in the lens unit, and it's scratched and banged to heck) and not reading the manual (so she doesn't get the best photos she could).  As for mine, it has given me thousands of crisp, clear, wide angle and high-zoom photos.  There have been times when it would freeze and I would need to take the battery out to get it to reset...this has happened maybe 2 or 3 times.  When the battery gets low, the screen turns off as the flash recharges, but I rarely use the flash so that's not much of an issue, and it's fixed by putting in a new battery.  And, when I zoom in more than about 10x, and if the subject I'm focusing on is against a light background (imagine focusing on the moon while it's in the daytime sky) then there is a circular artifact thing just off-center...it seems like the lenses may create some sort of halo thing as they zoom in on things.  If the background isn't a solid light color then you can't notice this, but at times it's a minor annoyance.  Other than that, I couldn't be happier with this camera; I use it a lot, I have a young daughter who is a common subject for me, and any time I go for a hike or visit someplace or anything like that, I use my camera, and it has yet to let me down.  And the images are really nice, and I use mostly the auto setting!  Though I do tweak the settings to my liking (exposure and color tint and all that...really though, the camera does everything).  The high zoom creates very crisp pictures, the autofocus works very well (except when you try to get too close to subjects while in "Macro" mode...), low light shooting is perfectly acceptable, the flash is powerful, the scene settings are good, the video is decent, the viewing screen is really nice, the controls are simple and useful, the camera itself looks nice, and I mean 18x optical zoom...that's hard to beat.  So yeah, I really like my S9100, and it has been a great camera for me for more than a year.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Pemble
Reviews.Content: This camera is awful. After owning it for 10 months, we had to send it to Nikon for repairs because it kept freezing up. The only way to get it to turn off was to take the battery out. The first time this happened we were on vacation. We took about two pictures before the camera froze and then totally stopped working. Shipped it off to Nikon and they repaired it.Fast forward 10 months, and here we are again. We were on vacation and again the camera freezes up. In addition, a new problem - the LCD screen goes black when I turn the camera vertically and reappears when then camera is horizontal.The warranty expired after a year. I do not want to pay for repairs on a camera that I hate! What a waste of money!!

Reviews.Title: Camera freezes; dust inside causes smudged photos
Reviews.Author: David Braun
Reviews.Content: I've persisted with this camera and have generally had some good results. Like many other owners, I found early on that the lens freezes and won't retract. Usually I get it to unfreeze by taking the battery out and inserting it again, or very gently turning the lens manually, which ultimately can't be good for the equipment. Most recently I noticed smudges on my photos when using the lens extended, and in a strong light I can see dust inside the lens. Apparently there is no way to clean this. The camera is pretty much useless to me like this, so I need to replace it. It won't be with another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: never buy a Nikon
Reviews.Author: Chris Surdi
Reviews.Content: My camera was just over 30 days old when the lens failed. Had to send for repair and now, 9 months later, the lens is going again. Customer svc won't help..tells me they ..." legally cannot change the terms of our warranty"! What BS!! Worst customer svc ever! They obviously don't care about their customers. If I decide to go for another repair, it will cost me about $100! No way will I pay for yet another defective lens!  I will never buy a Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for taking random shots.  I have a very expensive camera also & this one is my daily -- in my car in case I see a great pic shot!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't take clear pictures
Reviews.Author: Bryant
Reviews.Content: We've tried all kinds of settings.  I would say that 30% of the pictures are blurry/not clear.  Very disappointed.  Terrible.  Update:  SEnt to Nikon (got free exteded warranty) they "fixed" it, still is awful.

Reviews.Title: This Nikon still beats newer models!
Reviews.Author: Jason S Eagan
Reviews.Content: This camera is still rated at the top of its class (Consumer Reports 3/13) even beating out newer models of the same camera. I had purchased a newer model and was disappointed with the two things I was most looking for: zoom capability and night shots. Upon doing further research, this camera had higher ratings in both areas despite being an older model.I've just returned from a vacation where I used the camera in various settings day and night. Happy to report the photo quality and ease of use is terrific. I highly suggest this camera if you are looking for something fairly simple but with excellent features.One thing - after just one trip there are already a few scratches on the display screen. I suggest getting a protective shield (like you would for an iPhone) to help. I don't think this is specific to this camera though and certainly not a deterrent to buying it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100
Reviews.Author: photobug
Reviews.Content: I had nothing but problems with this camera from the time I got it. Luckily I bought the extended warranty, but had to send it in 3 times before they would give me credit for a new camera. I believe this camera was a "lemon." Pictures were overexposed & blurry. Flash pictures were terrible. I missed out on many photo opportunities because of this camera malfunctioning & for the times I had to send it back to the manufacturer. An independent camera repair person told me he has seen many problems with these "super zoom" smaller cameras. One little "speck" can get into the zoom & cause it to malfunction, among other problems. I'm going with a Canon Rebel T4i (one of the smaller SLR's) & realize in order to get a really good camera you need to get an SLR. Yes, you have to give up the convenience & lower price of a smaller camera for a larger one that takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: mobudico
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Is particularly good in low light situations.  Traveled around France taking pictures of inside cathedrals and churches.  The detail was far and away better than you could see with the naked eye...all without flash or tripod.  A tad bit on the heavy side compared with compacts you can slip into your pocket...but the features very well makeup for it.  So many features I probably will never use.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I have owned - Kodak was better
Reviews.Author: Jeff Colvin
Reviews.Content: I keep hoping for a firmware update. Seems the camera has the capabilities but the current version is full of shaky photos, dim lighting and nothing you can do to correct these issues. It is suppose to have this great built-in power to remove the movements, but the click of the button will blur most pictures. Lighting - where? Everything is overexposed or underexposed. Tried using other software as Nikon includes nothing but their messaging application which cannot find any updates!Look elsewhere and do not be fooled by - $100 offers. Stay Away!

Reviews.Title: Can't handle minimal use
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera becasue of the Zoom and full HD camera.  I am surprised that Nikon put out such a cheaply made product.  I use a snap camera like this 6 or 7 times a year.  Vacation, parties, concerts mostly.  The focus was poor on snapshots and the HD video was blurry when you zoomed in and out.  But my BIGGEST complaint was that 2 months into having it, the shutter would not open consistently.  I sent it to Nikon to have them do the warranty work and got it back.  Tried it out, and it seemed fixed.  Took it on my next vacation.  Again, the shutter wouldn't open.  At that point I got a Canon Powershot SX260.  It far exceeds this camera, quality and reliability.  Let them work out the bugs in this camera.  I give it 1 star because the warranty work did not fix the problem and it failed on me during a vacation.  Just too unreliable.  If I could get my money back, i would.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera ........... if the lens cover doesn't stick
Reviews.Author: vincent a. mcgrath
Reviews.Content: This is my second purchase of this camera. The camera took great pictures and was quite handy.  Battery life was pretty good too. The one draw back was the lens cover.  It would rub against the lens and periodically stick half open.  The lens was "smudged by the lens cover rubbing against it and eventually cause a small blur in the center of the picture.  Since I did love the camera, I went out and purchased a new one since the cost to fix the lens cover was slightly (very slightly) less than a new camera at discount.  I have to be a little bit more careful of where I catty the camera.  It was so handy I just used to toss it in my pocket with everything else.  My carelessness.It does take great shots with ease.

Reviews.Title: Worst $400+ I Ever Spent
Reviews.Author: Greta Dutcher
Reviews.Content: This camera was a HUGE waste of money. It's difficult to get a clear, non-blurry image in low light. The zoom feature is totally useless in ANY light, as all photos taken with it come out blurry no matter how steady one's hand is. Getting the photos from the camera onto the computer is very difficult with the editing program I use (ACDSee); the video feature works ok, but getting vidoes onto the computer is a huge ordeal (I ended up losing quite a few, including some of my beloved dog who died in January). It's labor-intensive, and usually takes many attempts to actually get it to work. There are too many features with confusing symbols, making it quite user-UNfriendly; all in all, this camera is an overpriced piece of junk. Nikon should take a cue from Kodak--their Easyshare digital point-&-shoot I got in 2004 was GREAT, and it puts this one to shame.

Reviews.Title: Focus problems
Reviews.Author: offtheback
Reviews.Content: I wanted a pocketable point n shoot of decent quality.The photos were not reasonably sharp.I have reasonable expectations for this type of camera but it didn't come close.A variety of shots in static settings-not good.Liked the zoom range+handling but no go.Returned to Amazon-customer service excellent.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: loustorm
Reviews.Content: My Sony camera, though it took very good pictures, was extremely battery hungry. I checked Consumer Reports for recommendations of cameras and found this Nikon to be highly recommended for my purposes, so I purchased it from Amazon. So far I'm quite pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy and GREAT Pics!!
Reviews.Author: pairofducks "pairofducks"
Reviews.Content: Love my camera!! Easy to use, no mind boggling settings to learn and convenient size to carry while traveling. Have taken some awesome pictures that rival my husbands expensive rig!!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Louise
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the camera, so was my granddaughter which is why I just ordered a second one. The price was right...though I paid more for the second camera than the first. For the price, great camera so far. I have a lot of learning to do on it yet.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100 18x
Reviews.Author: Pokahntis
Reviews.Content: This camera is really great, the only thing is the batteries last only 5 months had to buy new ones.

Reviews.Title: ~7 months later
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Camera worked as expected when received. However, at ~7 months, the lens would not extent all the way when turned on. This made it so you could do nothing but pull the battery to retract the lens. When sent in to Nikon, they said not under warranty and ~$120.0 to fix. They didn't say what was wrong or why not covered either. Not really happy with a product that is less than a year old isn't covered by the warranty and the fix is ~70% of the cost new.

Reviews.Title: Terrible indoor photo quality - don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: nwodnick
Reviews.Content: This camera takes decent video and outdoor photos, but completely awful indoor photos.  95% of the photos I have taken indoor have been unusable because they are so blurry... and the 5% that I kept weren't clear, either... they just weren't quite as bad as the rest.  I read through the manual and tried many different things: using the tripod, adjusting the ISO settings, using the flash and not using the flash, using different modes (auto, scene, etc.), zooming in and not zooming in, turning on the vibration reduction and turning it off, etc. ... and 100% of the time I pushed the button down halfway to let it focus before pressing it the rest of the way.  It doesn't seem to matter what I do, the result is the same: blurry photos.  I have another family member who purchased the same exact camera around the same time I purchased mine, and she has had the same problem.  Neither of us have ever had any problems like this with any other camera.  When I approached Nikon to try to find a solution to this problem, they did not respond.  I would highly recommend that you not purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: ps
Reviews.Content: very nice camera. takes great pics. fit great in purse zoom is great for small camera. moms will love it with a little practice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: quadssss
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  We are so pleased with it.  I particularly love the image control that keeps my pictures steady even though I shake. The pictures are fabulous and don't even require any correction. It's so easy to use and fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Good While It Lasted
Reviews.Author: RRWms
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S9100 did what I expected it to.  A nice little point and shoot.  Until, that is, it started producing nothing but black pictures.  I have to assume the sensor failed.  And a one year warranty doesn't do much good when it fails in month fourteen!  That makes it a very expensive disposable camera ... especially on a per-image basis.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic camera --- BUT!
Reviews.Author: ROBERT J SUSSMAN
Reviews.Content: I purchased the S9100 in 11/2011 and have taken close to 5000 pictures with it. The pictures have been amazing going anywhere from wide angle to 450mm zoom they have been sharp and properly exposed with few exceptions. We took it to Mexico on the ocean and it worked flawlessly and use it daily for pictures everywhere we go. The picture quality is great. The problem came a little over a month ago when I downloaded some pictures which were not as sharp as expected, within a week it hung up with the well known problem of the lens not retracting. I sent it to Nikon and they repaired it and had it back to me in about a month. It is again working great but for how long. Since I had it a friend of mine liked it so much he bought one and it hung up within 3 weeks! Hopefully the new parts that were put into mine are updated and will work for a long time. I have had Nikon cameras for many years and never had a problem before.

Reviews.Title: Quick Review of Nikon S9100
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought a used Nikon Coolpix S9100 from Amazon, and received it a few days ago. I bought it based on excellent reviews in Amazon and Nikon's reputation as camera manufacturer. I also owned a Nikon D5000 - bought it new from Amazon last year. It is an excellent camera to say the least. I bought S9100 because I need something small to take during my many business trips - if the destination is interesting of course.Several comments in Amazon were really negative about this camera. And I agree 100% with the other reviewers that the fault is usually with people who are not familiar operating the camera.In my first few tries under poor lighting and maximum zoom, I did get blurry (out of focus) pictures. I noticed the blurriness is due to movement, not out of focus. At first I thought the vibration-reduction was not activated, but it was. BTW I am not a pro in photography.After tinkering with the ISO setting, I was able to take very sharp pictures under poor lighting and maximum zoom. Voila, this is a really nice camera.For those who cannot get good focus, try to set the ISO to around 1600. This will take care of your problem with "blurry" pictures.Overall I am very happy with my purchase. It is slightly bigger than my old Canon (the battery cover just gave up only after 2 years), but the S9100 packs more features such as 18X zoom, 14mm wide angle, and 1080p HD video. This weekend I will go camping and I will do more exploring with my S9100. Another excellent product from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade from my DSLR
Reviews.Author: Media Machine
Reviews.Content: I'm a Nikon D3000 owner along with a Nikon 50mm f1.8G AF-S prime lens and kit lens which is all really great but at times a bit much to carry. Of course the S9100 solves that issue, it's a compact point & shoot. But I really enjoy using this little camera with all it's features and settings. They can be changed easily and quickly with the four way control wheel next to the 3 inch display. The 1-touch record button for HD video is great for me since the D3000 doesn't shoot video. The zoom feature is quiet and smooth while recording. The mode wheel is on the small side but isn't an issue and clicks into place nicely when turning with your thumb. It's located on top next to the shutter release button with wrap around zoom. Next to that is the power button, and next to that is the stereo mic. Macro and panorama features both work well and overall shots taken outside on a sunny day or indoors in dark setting come out really nice.

Reviews.Title: great investment
Reviews.Author: chad
Reviews.Content: this is my first travel camera i got it becuse its almost automatic the only manual control is ISO.The camera calls for a sd/sdhc/sdxc cards  i choose to get the sdhc card class6  it has work fine no lag or slow operation.Spoke to a camera professional about the use of a class10 he said if  i was going to shot video more then photos and edit them  then i would need one but a class 6 work great if  going to shoot photos more.If you are going to use it to shoot night shots i do recommond getting a small tripod like a grollia tripod to set it on so there will be no movement with the camera also recommend that if u your a camera clicker like me that takes lot of photos  pick up a extra battery what the specs says is about true u get around 270 shots but when u do video and flash  it does get drain quicky so it helps to have a spare handy  if you wont to see what type of photos this camera makes go to  [...] then find the s9100 click on it u will find real photos taking by real pepole on there vactions and trip so u can what a real picture looks like with being process by any photo edit software  thats what got me to buy this camera i have no regerts at all worth the investment indeed************ update january 2013 still going strong i have went to a faster sdhc card a class 10 400x speed it has help speeding up the process of doing HDR photos and vidoes  but no problems or issue still worth the investment.................................. UPDATE ......6/19/2013 still have got this camera  i  let me my mom use it on her road trip she did from portland down to las angels then to las vegas to flagstaff to new mexico to alabama she took over 800 photos with this camera so i did a  shutter count its close to 11,000 shutter actions and still no issue with the camera  my mom enjoy using this camera it was simple to use and made great photos and videos so this has been a great investment

Reviews.Title: A total waste of money
Reviews.Author: Jan E. Lorah "EcoMuser"
Reviews.Content: Beware of this Nikon Coolpix S9100 camera.  I purchased one not even 7 months ago, and it has been broken (unusable) for most of that time.  It freezes... w/ no response, at all.  I paid to have it shipped back to Nikon for evaluation; they then told me I would have to pay $87 for repair -- not covered by warranty. Total for shipping and repair:  $127, for a $200 camera.  Then, not 1.5 months later, the same exact problem reoccurred.  I called, and a different service rep assured me the repairs would be done free of charge, and a shipping label sent "before the day was over."  I have since then, over the space of almost a month now, talked w/ three other reps -- all promising that they were "in my case" and would resolve the issue.  Still nothing.  Four phone calls, shallow promises, $327 spent for a useless camera.  Do not purchase a Nikon Coolpix S9100.

Reviews.Title: Problems of design, reliability; Nikon support & repair awful; good pictures when it works
Reviews.Author: Pollack-Lagushenko
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera seven months ago.  The reviews were mixed, but I really like the vivid colors in pictures made by Nikon cameras.  The problem with the camera failing to focus properly on auto setting (as discussed by other reviewers) was there for me as well.  The focusing is especially poor in close ups, so you have to resign yourself to only a fraction of the shots being in proper focus.  Still, the shots that were in focus were great -- full of color and detail.  The stabilization system that is supposed to work in low light is a lot less efficient than its equivalent in cheaper and earlier models of Canons.  Almost all the shots that I made without a tripod were blurry, so the system can't really be relied on.Seven months into ownership dark spots appeared on photos and LCD screen.  Disappointed, I sent the camera to be repaired.  After two weeks, finally received an estimate for $100 and Nikon's refusal to cover it under warranty.  Two more weeks trying to get an explanation from someone in the repair department.  The customer service was outrageous.  Seriously, even the "supervisor" failed to honor the promises to respond in "24-48 hours."  Finally was informed that the problem -- never clearly identified -- was caused by an "impact."  The camera had light use, never suffered an impact, and was never exposed to strenuous environments.  The third time I had a problem with a Nikon product over the past five years; the second time I had an outrageous experience with their repair department.  None of the positive features of the camera are outweighed by the unreliability and the repair record and procedures.  Would rather put the repair costs toward a Canon product.  Had to carry a cheap, six-year-old Canon point-and-shoot as backup for the Nikon S9100 and was glad that I had it.  Sad demise of a company that used to have great products.  Design flaws mentioned by others are clearly present and the support is rude, inefficient, and expensive.  Why keep putting yourself through this?

Reviews.Title: Don't do it - out of focus and locks up
Reviews.Author: Slack
Reviews.Content: Having owned many point and shoot digital cameras going back the the Sony Mavica (took a 3.5 floppy)All my point and shoots have been good to great (Canons),, till I bought this POS.I purchased the Nikon S9100 for it's movie modes (60, 120, 240 FPS) and of course it's normal picture taking.I cary it to my 2 sons baseball games,, I have missed pictures and movies of #2 sons 4 home runs do to this POS locking up constantly!It worked for about 3 weeks then started locking up here and there, now it locks up every other picture.What pictures I do get are hit or mis as far as focus.You have to wonder about a company that puts out a product with a know flaw(s)????

Reviews.Title: Avoid Nikon Cameras
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in December over other similar cameras mainly because of the 18x zoom.  The pictures are ok at best - neither the 5 star glowing reviews nor the 1 star blurry picture reviews.  However taking non-blurry pictures of subjects in motion, i.e. sporting events, is difficult even in the "sport" mode.  At the end of March a "black" splotch appeared in the middle of the LCD display and also on the pictures taken.  I sent it back to Nikon for repair.  I should have known it was a bad omen when the UPS Store employee looked at JUST the address (and not the name of the place) and said "Oh, the Nikon Repair Center.  We send a LOT of things there".  He seemed to want to say more but didn't.  SO here I am over 7 weeks later waiting for my camera.  At first they said they were waiting on parts that would arrive on May 4 (The Nikon Repair Center does not stock Nikon parts???). Now they say the parts will arrive on May 30. Customer service personnel seem like they could care less and offer no options.  If you are choosing between a Nikon and another brand, i.e. Cannon, I would strongly recommend Canon.  I have always had good luck with Canon and Kodak (unfortunately no longer making cameras) and the picture quality was always excellent. This is my first and last Nikon camera!

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: matthew
Reviews.Content: started freezing up after 2 weeks of use. had to remove the battery to reset the freeze up. Returned through best buy and got a new one 2 months later. The new one started freezing up the same way that the old one did (when the zoom was used) within a few weeks of use. Sent it back through Best Buy to the "repair center" as it was under warranty. Just recieved after 6 weeks and it still freezes up. really regreting my purchase of this . plus I will never shop at best buy again

Reviews.Title: Awful in every way
Reviews.Author: Disappointing
Reviews.Content: Bad interface, slow, cannot focus unless perfect lighting. No does not work after little use. Go with canon for point and shoot. Unless you are buying professional series equipment - avoid Nikon all together.

Reviews.Title: Poor repair service from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Sharyn M. Sweeney
Reviews.Content: I loved using this camera until it started to over expose and take blurry shots after only 500 pictures.  I sent it to Nikon for repair and was initially told it would be about $100 to repair.  I convinced them that it was under warranty, but after the camera being in their hands for over 3 weeks, I still did not have a repaired camera.  I expected the camera to last longer and to have better customer service for the repair.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 9100 what you see is what you get.
Reviews.Author: Robert Grant
Reviews.Content: I found the S9100 Nikon to have more good points than bad.  The thing that gave me the biggest problem was the placement of the mic's on top.  While making a movie I would sometimes get my finger over one of the mic's causing problems with the sound. The other is the fuzzy focus on full zoom in movie mode.  The things I do like are the size and battery life.  I did carry a extra battery and bought the fastest memory I could find.  Some people said they had problems with focus but other than the one listed above I found no problems with the camera.  In the first link there are a number of pictures taken in Italy.  The flash was not used when taking pictures inside because almost all of the places forbid the use of any type flash. Most of the Cathedrals were very dark.  There are some pictures taken outside in full sun and some in low light.[....]As for the movie mode I am listing some links below.  One is a day link the other is a night link.  These were taken on a water taxi so there was a lot of movement.  These are not edited.Venice water Taxi ride by day:  [....]Venice water Taxi ride by night:  [....]Because the Nikon takes movies at a good FPS you can still get some good pictures while moving.  I have listed one more link.Leaning Tower of Pisa from inside to top: [....]Just remember to judge the camera and not the operator.

Reviews.Title: S9100 review
Reviews.Author: Sunrunner
Reviews.Content: We haven't had this camera very long but so far it meets all our expectations.It is compact enough to not be a burden but big enough to carry and take pix easily.The Auto feature & face recognition is a favorite and my wife likes the good image stabilization.We plan to take it on vacation soon and intend to use it extensively.

Reviews.Title: Nikon..what can I say?????
Reviews.Author: UD
Reviews.Content: I am truely a Nikon fan and have purchased several DSLRs.  Love them all.  I purchased this S9100 for my wife prior to our cruise to the Baltic in July last year.The S9100 performs above my original expectations (so I bought one for my son for X-Mas to use on the job in his land scape business).  It takes outstanding shots for a point and shoot camera.  Best telephoto (x18) and close up in a compact and rivals the pics I take with my semipro DSLR Nikon.  So simple "even a caveman can do it) ha,ha.  I am even thinking I want one to take when I go rock climbing, bike riding, jogging, skiing etc....something compact, light and takes great pics (zoom & closeup).  I will be buying another shortly.Amazon has provided the best customer service as I expect (and that is from a Quality Assurance Manager).  UD

Reviews.Title: Nikon Digital Cool Pix S9100
Reviews.Author: Sir David
Reviews.Content: I'm a senior & was hesitant about getting a digital camera. Lots of researching brought me to this model & then to Amazon. Love the camera & the service from ur operation.Its the 1st time I have used Amazon & it was a snap!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures/HD Video
Reviews.Author: djtimwalters
Reviews.Content: This camera for the price is awesome! The pictures turned out really good and the HD video is perfect for what I need it for!  I wish they had a feature that would wirelessly share your pictures to a computer or a one touch button to share but that's okay I can just plug it in, no biggie. Took pictures in low lighting and it almost looked as if I took it while it was some-what still sunny out (took some pictures at sunset). One of my best cameras i've had, ever. Perfect price!

Reviews.Title: great camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Stellmacher "book worm"
Reviews.Content: I am still learning about all of the functions on the camera. I think is a good buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value
Reviews.Author: thevelvetking
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have owned Minolta, Sony, Canon and Panasonic. This is my first Nikon and I am extremely impressed. The Nikon replaces a Panasonic Lumix purchased six years ago which still gives good service. The Nikon is so much better......almost 4 times the zoom.....easy to use......small and easy to carry......easy to use.....great photographs even in difficult conditions....video capability is superb. My only complaint is the record button location which is adjacent to the thumb/index finger grasp area. I typically activate the video record button accidently several times when I'm just taking photographs. Honestly, this camera is a value gold mine, so why should I complain about such a minor detail?

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Johnnyboixxxd
Reviews.Content: i was a bit worried that this camera wasnt gonna be as good as it seemed but it is. the fantastic zoom packed into such a small frame and all the little features it comes with this camera really make it a great buy. battery life is really good, i spend some weekends at car events with this camera and no matter what size pictures or what resolution i want to capture video in the battery in this thing just keeps going and going. future buyers should know that the zoom in is NOT available when shooting video in high speed 720p/60fp or when trying to use any of the slow mo features.. BUT you CAN zoom in while in picture taking mode THEN switch to filming mode to compensate which isnt all too bad ;p. its a great point and shoot and if it has what your looking for then you wont be disappointed.i Have owned this camera for a little over a month now.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100
Reviews.Author: MICHELLE
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my camera!  Out of the box, the snap shot I took of my kids were all a blurr, unless the sat perfectly still.  But when I put the owners manuel dvdrom in and did a little reading, I found out how to put the top dial on "scene" and then push the menu button, then select "sport" for outdoors or "party/indoor" for indoors.  Now I absolutely LOVE this camera.  The HD video is so rich and amazing!!!  Plus you can zoom, while recording video, which is also amazing!!  The price is definately unbeattable too!

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100
Reviews.Author: Justthefacts
Reviews.Content: When looking for a new camera, I leaned toward Nikon because of my experience with their other products.  After reading reviews, both pro and con, I decided on the S9100.  While the video portion of the camera is high quality, I am very dissapointed in the photograph capabilities.If the subject is very still, it takes a great shot but, the shutter speed is so slow that any movement by the subject results in very poor fuzzy quality.  I have tried all of the effects options and still had bad results.  This happens even if using a tripod to hold the camera steady.If there was a way to get my money back, I would certainly try.  For the price, or even if it were cheaper, it is not a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Big features in little package
Reviews.Author: discrepancys
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement camera when my Olympus quit working.  I went to the brick and mortar, did my research, and could not find a camera I liked.  I have always bought a canon, or Olympus, and was disappointed.  I finally ran across the Nikon.  Right in the store the zoom was great, pixels awesome, and small enough to fit in your pocket.  I ordered it and was amazed at all the different things i could do with it.  I took it recently on my trip to vegas and have fallen in love again.  I took panoramic pictures in the mountains, took awesome quick pos shots of the lights (my husband drives too fast).  I also liked the sepia and black and white photos we took.  As an owner of a lot of cameras I am very impressed with this one.  Nice job Nikon!

Reviews.Title: An amazing camera
Reviews.Author: mghanim
Reviews.Content: When compared to other compact digital cameras. Nikon Coolpix S9100 is head and shoulders above the rest.It is comparable to professional and SLR cameras. Has amazing features, excellent lens, a good software with a long battery life. All in all, this is a great deal for a less than 200 dollars camera.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: SlingBladen74
Reviews.Content: This camera was a huge disappointment.  I purchased it (the first time) as a gift for my wife in October, and was immediately unimpressed.  The pictures always seem to be blurry, the menu selections didn't seem to change the photos all that much, etc.  Just after Christmas, my wife informed me that the camera was "locked up."  The camera was so bad, to turn it off, you had to pull the battery.  It would lock up each time we turned it on.  I traded the camera, and only four days into ownership of the 2nd one, it started doing the same thing.  The only way to get the camera to function at all is to turn it on, then "twist" the base of the lens.  I should not have to twist anything on a four-day old camera to get it to work... especially one from a company with the reputation such as Nikon.  I have had Lumix, Sony, Kodak, Canon, etc... this is the first - AND LAST - Nikon I will own.P.S. - I HAD to give it one star, or it would be rated ZERO stars...

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to like it....
Reviews.Author: E. McDougall "Hoser lost in america"
Reviews.Content: I have been dreading writing this review..... I bought the Nikon S9100 with high hopes; the reviews were good, and I really wanted this one to be "the one". I had tried several cameras before this one; they all suffered from soft corners and other issues that made them impossible to live with. Initially it seemed to be working out - White balance and exposure looked very accurate, and the camera was easy to use. The photos on the 3" screen looked OK; sharpness in the corners was not ideal but at least it wasn't nearly as bad as the awful Fuji F505/550 EXR.HOWEVER..... once I got the photos into my computer, and started looking at them on a 24" monitor - they were all cr@p. No other word for it - I WASTED several days of shots, about 400 photos - almost nothing was useable. Focus was behind or in front of the subject; I had to check whether IS was on because everything was blurred even in good outdoor light. The dumb camera had chosen ISO 1600 for pretty much everything, and was choosing shutter speeds like 1/10, which it clearly could not handle. Noise reduction was so strong that I couldn't see a strand of hair; everyone looked like they were wearing plastic helmets like Lego characters. Panorama mode was poorly implemented, there were significant artifacts (ie, errors) in most. Videos were poor, IS was ineffective at all focal lengths.Overall, a very disappointing camera. I had high hopes, based on the reviews at DPReview and Snapsort - but I just can't reconcile the very poor photos I saw with their good reviews. I returned the Nikon, and picked up a Panasonic; the difference is night-and-day. I recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: A good replacement overall
Reviews.Author: MSUMindy
Reviews.Content: We like the size and facility of the Coolpix. However, we found on vacation that using it in sunlight is a problem since it does not have a viewfinder. This made our pics a guessing game, and we didn't take more than two  on that entire day of the vacation. We are a little disappointed by that.

Reviews.Title: Alot of camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Don L. Cook
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)The best pictures and easy to use,ive had a sony DSC-S75 for 6 years now and it served me will but the quality of the pictures i get with the nikon S9100 is so much better.Thanks Amazon

Reviews.Title: Blurry and washed out pictures
Reviews.Author: katrinkump
Reviews.Content: Problems:-- washed out pictures when flash is used-- blurry pictures-- slow focus-- camera tends to shoot using slow speeds like 1/30-- camera tends to use high ISOI have the camera for 3 months now. It's been back to NIKON for repair twice already, and I am about to send it for a third time. The outdoor pictures are OK although not as sharp as I would expect. The problem is mainly with indoor shots. Very often the pictures come out blurry. Even the slightest movement of the object can cause blurriness. Also, very often the pictures come out washed out when a flash is used. What I noticed is that the camera uses very slow speed shooting inside 1/30 which in my mind is the main reason for the blurry pictures. The problem with washing out I think is caused when all of a sudden the camera decides a high ISO needs to be used. The worst is you never know when it is going to misbehave. You can take several pictures one after another of the same subject in the same position and sometimes they may come out OK and then all of a sudden become blurry or washed out. Every time I send it back for repair, NIKON says they changed parts and the camera is fixed. It's been 3 weeks since the last repair and I already have a bunch of ruined pictures on different occasions. I am about to send it back to NIKON for a third time. The last time I asked them to just send me a new camera but they refused and said they were going to fix this one. At this point I am doubtful they are capable of repairing it. I have read a lot of reviews and quite a few people describe the same problems as mine. I am almost at the point where I am ready to give up and just go and buy Canon SX230 which seems to have good reviews from the users.

Reviews.Title: DO YOUR RESEARCH
Reviews.Author: Sterling J. Badon
Reviews.Content: I rated this camera a "3". It is harder to review than that. First I will state this camera was built very well. The quality and design was dead on. It was one of the easiest cameras to use and had functions that made a Point-and-Shoot camera one would love to own. I have never owned a Nikon but will say I really can respect the Tech and quality in design. I gave this camera a "5" in that regards. So here is why the rating was lower. This camera only took pictures that looked like an amateur using a manual camera would take. This is an automatic. I ran this camera through the paces several times. I also read the manual and reviewed as much info and feedback as possible about it. This camera gives pictures that most are calling Blurry. They are not blurred !!  They are FLAT!!!  They lack crisp edges and are not vibrant. They are also reddish!!!  For an automatic camera, it was not so easy to use.This is why I think this Camera should get a "1" in picture quality. The camera had reviews that bounced around telling you the flaws with the camera but the incredible speed, quality of design, and the Nikon name kept them from bashing it. I also had the same issues. I returned this camera after about 2000 pictures and bought a Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FH25. The quality and vibrance of the pictures was incredible. This is what one should expect in a point-and-shoot. It did not have the super zoom or 10 optical but sure gave me pictures of what I saw and that matters. The Nikon just failed. It isn't user error. People rating this Nikon camera poorly have good reason to. My mom bought the Nikon Coolpix with 8 optical and she complained about the reddish pictures!!  I just told her to return it. She had issues right out of the box. Same as me. The pictures look faded and flat like the color pictures in an old 1970's magazine. Nice effect if you are trying to get that. It might sound crazy but I almost kept this camera!!!  If money wasn't an issue I would of kept it to get effects and pictures it would produce. I returned it to the local store I got it from and hunted down the LUMIX. Which took great pictures. I needed a pocket camera for Disney World and wanted to leave my larger camera behind. I am not brand loyal. I am more interested in the output of the picture and how consistent the camera can achieve it. This Nikon failed to give the same picture twice in a row!!!  The duplicate shots had people asking if I changed settings or augmented the photos. I am advising you to not buy the camera unless you are a professional who is looking for a camera to get cool effects and different results. This is coming from someone who gets told their photos look like post cards. I am no professional but do try to get crisp vibrant shots. Rich color matters. This Nikon will not do that. Look at the sample photos online. You will see that none will look like incredible shots. They will look common and plain.

Reviews.Title: AWFUL! Do not buy if you want pictures in focus.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I only give this camera 1 star because it was as LOW as I could go. I was so excited about my new coolpix, but when I started snapping pictures EVERYTHING was out of focus. In auto mode 1 out of 10 photos was in focus. Flash on, flash off, it made no difference. So, I started to play with settings. Nothing improved things.I then decided it must be broken, so I sent it back to Nikon. They "repaired" it and sent it back to me. The repair didn't help. Very few photos are in focus. The camera is garbage. My cheap $99 Cannon takes better pictures.I should have listened to the reviews about the focus problems. Now I need to buy another point and shoot. What a waste.

Reviews.Title: Little goes a long way
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've always used Canon camera but when the last one died I did a lot - and I mean a lot - of research.  Besides the internet I talked to people who had a Nikon.  This one had the best reviews and I can see why - I've done photography for 30+ years and this little camera has a lot of bells and whistles.  It doesn't do RAW but that's what my big Canon is for.  Good deal for the $$$.

Reviews.Title: I should have heeded the naysayers
Reviews.Author: BG Ski
Reviews.Content: Bought the S9100 in early November because I was looking for a point and shoot super-zoom, the price was reduced to $199.95, Nikon's reputation and a quick look at positive professional reviews.  After buying it, I looked at many user reviews and too many were negative, but I decided to give the camera a try anyway.  It looked good and I wanted it to be my next camera.  Sure enough, after one month's use, the lens locked in an extended position, much like others warned.  Removing the battery corrected the problem, but I then worried about when it would happen again.  I guess I could have lived with that, but even after studying the user manual, which I had to print from the supplied CD, I never could get consistently focused pictures.  I read the user blogs and tried the techniques they suggested to get consistently proper focused photos and nothing worked.  If this is supposed to be a point and shoot camera, I expect it to get me shots without a lot of muss and fuss, and this camera won't do that. The last straw was this past weekend in a church at my grandson's christening.  I decided to shoot on the Scene setting, where supposedly the camera will decide which scene mode it should use based on its analysis of the setting.  Well, I shot several photos, most of which can never be duplicated again, and I got a smattering of results.  Sometimes the flash went off, other times it did not, even with identical lighting conditions.  Some shots were good, but others were simply out of focus and others had a very orange-red tinge.  All I did was point and shoot and I got all kinds of results, too many of which were totally unacceptable.  Thank goodness I had the foresight of asking my wife to use my old Canon PowerShot SD700 also, and between us we got enough good pictures of this event.  The seven year old Canon had no trouble with the lighting conditions, but the S9100 could never figure them out.  That convinced me that I would try to return this camera. Thank goodness for Costco.  90 day return policy with no quibbles.  They simply described the reason for the return being the purchaser's displeasure with the photo quality.  You can say that again.  I've never owned a camera that was so incapable of point and shoot photography.  Like others have said, you need to stay away from this camera.  Now if I can only find a good replacement camera.

Reviews.Title: Consider this a throw-away camera
Reviews.Author: A. Vane "engineerdude"
Reviews.Content: This travel zoom camera is most comparable to the Panasonic ZS8/10, Canon SX230 HS, and Sony HX9.  I did not consider the other similar cameras from Fuji, Pentax or Samsung when looking at what to purchase.  After reading reviews on dpreview.com, imagingresource.com and other sites and looking at comparison shots, I settled on the Nikon S9100.  Pricewise, it was in the middle of the pack with the Panasonic cheaper, the Canon comparable and the Sony more expensive.  I have used Panasonic cameras in the past (FZ18 and FH-20) and thought I'd try a different manufacturer.The 3 main problems discussed in the reviews of the S9100 from various web sites were 1) the zoom sticks open after some period of time and will not retract 2) there is a problem focusing at higher zooms and 3) the little cover does not close all the way when powering down the camera.  I have not had any problems with #1 as this does not seem to affect all cameras based on reviews but just a few isolated ones.  I have had some challenge focusing at higher zooms (#2).  I've solved this by powering down and back on the camera.  I think the "intelligence" of the camera tries to remember past focus points and adjust.  This has only happened a few times and restarting the camera did the trick both times.  Of the 20+ times I powered down the camera, the small lens cover stuck once or twice. A simple tap of my finger and it closed.This camera has a lot of features and scene modes.  Plus, while there is no manual focus, there are other manual settings like white balance, saturation, tinting, etc.  I find the manual focus of using buttons kind of strange in other similar cameras.  These features are great for the somewhat serious amateur photographer.  There is a lot packed into this camera.  I also truly enjoy the 18x zoom lens which exceeds the others, the sturdy build of the body, the quick startup, burst mode, and other features including an intelligent scene mode for those of us who don't want to think when shooting.  The size is a bit heavier and bulkier than my smaller cheaper 8x zoom camera but the feel is sturdy and higher quality.  I haven't tried the video yet.  I hope this camera lasts me a long time.  There is still room for improvement so I'm giving it 4 stars.1/4/12 Update:  I took it out for some planespotting and picture taking in the blue skies.  The photos show that there is vignetting issues at the edges.  Not sure if this is localized to my camera or a problem with all S9100's.  This showed up mostly at extreme zoom.  I'll have to take comparison shots.  Its not all that bad but perhaps shooting in the direct sunlight made the vignetting worse.  The camera still takes great pictures.  I shot mostly in manual mode with saturation up a notch (called clarity), white balance on sunlight, and exposure toned down a bit.  Battery life seems fine although I've purchased a cheap backup battery and charger port (the camera doesn't come with an external charger).*******UPDATE**********July 10, 2012Updating my review after 6 months usage.There seems to be some fringing on the edges that most reviews didn't notice, especially at zoomed in resolution.I had the camera on my wrist and it banged into something while I was carrying it.  No problems until 2 months later when the flash stopped working.  Sent it in for work and Nikon said there was impact damage, even though the flash worked for several months.  I'm disappointed that any visible marks on the camera have voided the warranty, especially after I purchased an extended warranty.  I suspect that if anything else stops working on it they'll blame it on the impact damage.  The service people were cold and wanted to charge me 1/2 the cost fo the camera to fix it.  I likely won't buy from Nikon again and this was my first purchase.  I have figured out how to use it but the manufacturer does not make these things to last very long, perhaps only long enough until the next version comes out.  Oh well.I won't buy from Nikon again unfortunately.*******UPDATE**********November 2013OK, so I've had the camera about 2 years now.  Image quality was maintained but dust appeared inside the lens between the lenses.  A quick shake managed to get it to drop but it does appear from time to time.  But, now the LCD powers on but there is no picture.  As I mentioned above, expect to get about 2 years out of this camera. With the S9300 and S9500 coming out I guess Nikon expects you to only need this for a year before upgrading.  Still disappointed and now I have a camera that's only good for parts.Mfr warranty was useless since they claim I dropped the camera (even though I didn't).  Still won't buy a Nikon again unfortunately and I've told all my friends this too. Successfully convinced a good friend to buy another brand so he wouldn't waste his money on a different Nikon. Disappointed is the word I associate with Nikon based on my experience with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Locked up, repaired and locked up again.
Reviews.Author: C. Byrne
Reviews.Content: Garbage. Absolute garbage. Repair under warranty lasted 100 pictures and now has locked up again. This time Nikon says it is going to cost $100 to fix. I'm going to tell them to put it where it belongs. In the trash.

Reviews.Title: There is a problem with this model!
Reviews.Author: A. Gaeta "kiwi"
Reviews.Content: I read great reviews in magazines regarding this camera.  Purchased it from Best Buy in August 2011.  Images were soft/out of focus.  I have been taking photos for years on many different digital cameras and never had an issue.  Then two days into my December 2011 holiday the lens froze so I could not use the camera at all.  I have since read a lot of people have had the same problem.  There is a serious issue with the design of this model.  Do not buy!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: J. Hewlett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over Christmas break.  It was a horrible investment.  The zoom pictures are too grainy and the light on the pictures tend to make the pictures either too bright or too dark.  I would never buy another Kodak or Nikon camera again.

Reviews.Title: 9100 equals LESS than 8000
Reviews.Author: Sammy Somekh
Reviews.Content: My headline says it all, doesn't it? Or maybe you think that I'm ignorant in mathematics? Not necessarily. It's simply that the Nikon Coolpix S8000 that I've been using for the past two years, yields great images in terms of resolution, contrast, color saturation etc. I put the two cameras to the test side-by-side and the 9100's images were noticeably soft compared to the S8000, while the colors looked dull even after I enhanced the "vividness" menue. I plan to sell it at a loss rather than keep a white elephant in my closet. With such products, Nikon is shooting itself in the leg. And you are hearing this from a Nikon man. From what I gleaned from other tech-savvy reviewers of various other makes and manufactueres, I gather that when you increase a camera's zoom reach as is the case with the 9100, you need to upgrade the sensor; if not, the pictures will come out grainy. In order to remedy this, the camera's program will "soften" the images. Result: the pictures will look out-of-focus.  Perhaps Nikon needed to upgrade the sensor for such a powerful zoom to solve the problem. But no camera programmer am I. Suffice it to say that Nikon users expect more, much more from this manufacturer who used to be known in the past for reliability and quality products. At any rate, glad that I've kept my S8000. Some owners of professional DSLR's are amazed (and at times frustrated) to see this mighty-mite produce images with a quality on a par with their cameras!

Reviews.Title: No more blurry photos!
Reviews.Author: D. Evans
Reviews.Content: I have had the same problems many users reported with blurry photos and I think I've found the problem.  Before taking your camera back, try popping up the flash.  On my old camera it wasn't a problem since the flash just fired when it was required.  That will happen on this camera also, but you have to pop up the flash first with the release button on the side of the camera.  Now that I've figured out the blurry photos I'm happy with the camera.  It is a nice pocket camera with a good screen, zoom and takes excellent videos.  Hopefully the next version of the camera will have a flash that doesn't need to be manually released to fire.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is going cheap
Reviews.Author: Howard Morris
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from an S6100.  I was surprised with the changes made by Nikon.No written manual.  The pdf is over 236 pages and try taking that out to the field with you. (can print it but the time/cost!).  No case that came with the 6100.  No SM CARD does have internal memory to get you going.  I hoped that it would have a Raw option (not in the specs).To get used to the controls am reading the pdf file but would have preferred a written manual.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100 from Amazon
Reviews.Author: M. K. Maynard
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera about a month and have not used it extensively yet; however, the optical zoom was great for family pictures at our Thanksgiving gathering. There was a problem with glare on the viewfinder in full sun, but the lighter weight and "pocketability" meet my needs for a good camera to use in the field. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: H. Palmer "booksscout"
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you, that I am so glad that I finally made the decision to purchase a digital camera. This particular product has so many different functions and features (I admit that I'm still experimenting.) I don't pretend to be a pro of any kind when it comes to digital photography, but am glad that Nikon has great software included to help with learning how to capture great pictures. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: I Tried!
Reviews.Author: sumerchuck "GB Gill"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera, beautiful screen, great features and controls, but I tried two of them and both were defective.On the first one, the auto ISO function would not work below about EV10. It would meter the light level correctly, lock down at ISO 200, and give very long shutter speed times on low light/indoor shots.  Probably why some folks are getting blurry photos with this camera. Then, after about 3 days of use the focus locked up. No more focus, even with a  re- start and pulling  the battery. Back it goes.The second one also had the auto ISO problem. But I liked everything else about the camera so much I was willing to keep it, work around that glitch by manually setting the ISO in the menu when necessary, and wait for a  firmware update.  Less than a week later it started freezing up, with the blue screen of death, about every 24 shots or so.It would re-boot by pulling the battery, but the shot was lost. Not good.Took that one back and traded it for the S8200 instead. So far it is behaving, but the controls (knob and control wheel are plastic) and `feel' of the camera  are not as nice as the 9100. Plus, the pop up flash on the 8200 is silly.

Reviews.Title: So Many Great Features
Reviews.Author: gfk
Reviews.Content: I own several cameras including two older superzoom Panasonics and two older DSLRs. I had been seeing how nice it was to use my smartphone camera but it had no zoom and few features.I started to look at compact travel cams. It boiled down to the Canon sx230hs and the nikon. This Nikon received several great reviews from the expert camera websites, like DPreview, and some individual reviews here that aren't so good.I decided on the Nikon. It had great features and a much lower price. I particularly liked the 18x zoom which has wide angle for people shots combined with the longest telephoto. I have taken over 3000 shots since early September with the S9100. This is the kind of camera that does most everything for you. It doesn't have many manual controls. I let it do the work and I get great pictures. There are many advanced features to explore at your leisure. I am having fun with the fast burst speeds for sports and even slow motion video. The HD video is good but gets shaky at long zooms so you need to rest it on something solid for that.My conclusion is that this camera has the most great fun features . Read the manual. (I downloaded it to my smartphone to learn all of its capabilities).It has the most zoom you can buy per dollar and per ounce. And yes picture quality is very good and the camera is trouble free.

Reviews.Title: Takes blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Sahar
Reviews.Content: This camera takes blurry pictures. I liked the zoom and display but when it can't take picture that is the main task for a camera then other features are useless.I returned the camera and will buy a SONY NEX instead. I hope that works well.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S 9100 bad choice
Reviews.Author: Craig Hillemeier
Reviews.Content: Purchased from Abt Electronics through Amazon and it worked well for about 5 weeks. Then the screen froze, since it was more than 30 days Abt's exchange/return policy was no longer in place and I was told to return it to Nikon. After about 4 weeks I called Nikon weekly requesting either my money back or a new camera. I finally received my repaired camera after about 8 weeks. Worked well for 2 days then began displaying "lens error" and now has frozen screen. I will probably return again to Nikon but I fear I have misplaced my trust in the companies that were involved in selling me this camera. I have certainly spent significant amounts of money with Nikon over 30 years and find it surprising they would be associated with a camera that seems to have so many quality defects.

Reviews.Title: Stay away !!! Lens error after 15 days
Reviews.Author: denali
Reviews.Content: This camera quit on my trip to Alaska, only 15 days after I purchased it. It has a "Lens Error" which none of the usual tricks fixed. It's not a good camera if you really need to get the shot....  I'm going back to Fuji Film or Cannon, Nikon has lost my confidence

Reviews.Title: DON"T BUY: Camera Freezes often
Reviews.Author: S. Lakhani
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera based on the good reviews and features... but after a month of use, it started locking up, where the shutter, zoom, etc wouldn't work but the screen would still be on.  This happens right after you turn on the camera and zoom in. When the camera freezes, the only thing to do is to take out the battery and reset the camera.  We're on vacation today and it happened 8 times today... It's been a total of two months since I purchased the camera from Amazon. Too late to return it to Amazon so I'm stuck contacting Nikon and the whole repair process!

Reviews.Title: S9100 nice camera small and compact
Reviews.Author: Gaurav
Reviews.Content: Carmera is really nice. very good optical zoom. it light weight and handy too.cleartity is very good. i feel good to have this camera. earlier i had cannon but thay was big and heavy.... so this one is light and compact..

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: The camera does not produce clear images in low light and closeups, when zoom is used. The pictures are blurry and out of focus. I tried all settings to improve the picture quality, but with little luck. Sent the camera back to the manufacturer to fix, but returned with  same problems.Avoid  headaches.. don't but this product. The problem, I think, is with the software. It needs to be fixed and Nikon is in no mood to do that..

Reviews.Title: Read the reviews before you buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sue Pitts "nonna60"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about 10 months now and have been terribly disappointed.  I have returned the camera to Nikon for repairs which didn't fix anything.  Nikon did not reveal to me what was done to the camera just that it was "repaired". I have never owned a camera where 8 out of 10 pictures are so blurred.  The purchase of the Coolpix S9100 has been a very costly mistake. I carefully researched cameras for months before making this purchase and the so called "expert" reviews were glowing.  This camera had everything I was looking for in a camera but when it isn't capable of shooting a decent picture it doesn't matter about the "features". My 9 year old Olympus never took blurry pictures.  Trying to get grandchildren to stand still while you try multiple times to get a decent picture is ridiculous.  Most times you only have one chance to get a great shot.  I have lost countless opportunities to get special photos at family gatherings. My grandchildren get better pictures from their really cheap point & shoot cameras. There are way too many great cameras out there so you don't have to settle for this camera.  Nikon should have a recall.  I will NEVER purchase another Nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous, could not be more pleased
Reviews.Author: Warren Abbott
Reviews.Content: Camera feel is excellent with the light rubberized coating on front, easy to operate and not at all heavy. Very sleek styling and its ability to take long range telephoto photos is exactly what i needed. Although battery compartment door could be heavier in design and manufacture, if one is gentle it should last for many years. When not in use, the ability to charge battery without its removal is a plus for me, but I also recommend having a minimum of a second battery and its own AC wall charger to go with this camera. Well pleased with this purchase for the price, and recommend that one put the 5 year Mack Warranty on it at time of purchase for cameras of less than 500 dollars.  Its ability to take HD movies I recommend a 32Gb memory card as well as they are not that expensive anymore. I plan for this camera to last me at least 10 years minimum by how it is built and its feel.

Reviews.Title: First Nikon
Reviews.Author: satoshi suzuki "Sasha"
Reviews.Content: This was my first Nikon camera. I have used Canon powershot, One SLR and DSLR. And Leica. All of them take good pictures but I was interested in Nikon cameras. I usually go to BestBuy to use them before any purchases and I tried several Point and Shoot cameras there and this Nikon Coolpix S9100 was the best. Speed and response were great. When I was deciding this purchase I was expecting our first baby so I needed some very responsive camera. As I and my wife use this camera, we noticed several annoying features as other reviewer mentioned. When you just take a picture the edges are all warped. If people are standing on the edge the head or body become strange. If the building is the object then it gets distorted. It doesn't focus when you zoom in. Sometimes the pictures get blurry. I did not want to give up on this camera and I tried to use different features for different situations. My conclusion and compromise are zoom in a little bit before you take and use scene mode and chose Portrait then you don't have the issues I mentioned above. This camera has interesting functions similar to Sony cyber shots or canon's powershot. I still like this camera and using Portrait mode I have been taking better pictures constantly now. As a product this Portrait mode should be the default setting though.Another good side of this camera is that it takes really nice Full HD 1080p video.And the battery lasts really long.

Reviews.Title: Can't focus in low light
Reviews.Author: nocalalan
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera specifically because of improved low light abilities over Panasonic ZS7.  I was surprised that after an afternoon and evening of shooting, there was a very poor ability to focus consistently.  Had a friend's  Canon SX230, and it was able to photograph the scene. I have returned it as there are certainly other choices that can take low light photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Zoom and clarity!
Reviews.Author: Ermer Twano

So far the camera has been running great.. Shots are awesome with clarity. I'm actually getting rid of my SLR set up and willing to just stay with this. So easy to use, versatile and no more having to lug things around in a backpack. All this can go into my pocket! The final shot is at full zoom... I was very impressed as to what I captured. I don't have a steady hand, and got this shot... WOW!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but it FREEZES UP
Reviews.Author: LK
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from a NYC shop this Spring. It worked great for a few weeks, then froze up. Went through tech assistance - ended up sending camera back & getting a replacement. I like this camera, it's so compact, easy to use, takes great photos & HD video, but now it's FROZEN UP again. Grrr. I need a camera for work that is reliable. I've treated this camera with kid gloves. Tomorrow I will return it for a full credit (I hope) & buy something else. Nikon is supposed to be the BEST, yet, they are apparently not standing behind this product, despite the many consumer complaints that the camera freezes up for no reason. I've had a lot of digital cameras & none have done this.

Reviews.Title: Best camer I have ever owned!!
Reviews.Author: FinWiz1969
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera vs. buying a $1,200 for a trip to Costa Rica.  I've been playing with it for days and just love the features.  I took a picture of alligators from over 50 meters away and it looks like I am right next to them.  The zoom lens is incredible.  Great Deal!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera overall
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I've only been able to use this camera recently for a friends wedding and landscape photos.  The pictures came out quite well, but I was most impressed with the 1080p video that this camera takes. Wow!On the nitpicking side, I did notice that the images for this camera were a little soft and had a bit of grain, even when the lighting for the photo was more than adequate (strong sunlight).  I was able to get approximately 300 photos out of the battery, and that included some video-mode operation for extended periods of time.Overall this camera performs very nicely and is a perfect companion for me on hikes and other general use tasks.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: R. A. Morris "comrades2008"
Reviews.Content: This feature laden camera will take some time and effort to get used to. In fairness I only gave it 3 stars on image quality because very few of my nearly 900 vacation images came out razor sharp, using auto almost entirely. But nearly all were fine for emailing. That said, most were probably taken with a fair amount of zoom, and hand held. But the anti-shake feature is the best of my limited variety of (mostly older) cameras. The zoom is great. It lets you reach way out there for a shot and nearly locks the scene in place when you depress the shutter button to shoot. I am sure if I had a tripod available it would have been close to perfect.  I got this camera too close to vacation time to really play with it much but hope to rectify that in the coming months. Also takes outstanding video. I like the fact that you open the flash via a switch on the top left hand side and for me is perfectly placed. Flash pictures were very good but the low light capabilities were absolutely awesome.

Reviews.Title: A edited version of a great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: Update 7/7/2011:So now I have used this camera for a couple months now.  I have put it through the gammit of uses, outdoors with lots of light, outdoors with no light.  Indoors with and without flash.  I will say the pictures have only got better as I have learned how to use the camera as it is a bit quirky out of the box.  At first I found it to have some blurriness to it, when I would zoom in, say on my daughter.  But I did not have the flash on at all, and I was trying to take pictures rapidly.  I now use it with the flash more often in these situations, and the pictures are gorgeous.  I try not to Zoom it in to much, digital zoom is off on the camera, as I set it.The flash is in an awkward place, but it is slim enough that is does not bother or interfere with my shots.  I do find that the pictures are of a much crisper quality when the flash is on.The manual functions on the camera are deep!  I have not dived into them to much, because I have not had to, and I own a SLR for those shots.  but when you want to play with it, it is quite good.If I was to give any negatives, and I need to think here, I guess it would be its inability to zoom in to far.  Now this is mainly because of my hand shaking, BUT when I actually put the picture on my computer and printed it, the picture was gorgeous.  I thought it was a ruined shot, but it was of a large lakes island, about 1/2 a mile away I would say, and the photo was so darn detailed and pretty, I was blown away.Lightweight, Small, 18x optical zoom(which blew my mind).  The cameras a great deal. at $299-$330 it is nice.I suggest this to anyone who like to take pictures, even if they are just messing around, the camera, toy, is just amazing!!Thanks!!---------------------------------------------------------------------------------OK so I will keep it simple, and if you want to go in depth with me just respond.  This camera is fairly new to market, and I found it and had to have it after all my research.  It beat out the Panasonic's, Sony's and Canons.  Reason is the CMOS sensor.  It makes it smooth and process pics and movies nice. As for the camera, lightweight, takes amazing photos in auto, so far not many opportunities for manual.Cool special effects, like removing color and having a black and white picture with say just the green showing.  Cook for outdoor photos ya know.One knock but not to bad is flash location. I have very large hands, and the flash has to go somewhere, and its placement does not both my hand position.
