I can see it being annoying, to some, but I do not have an issue.All in all, great for the dollar!  How can you go wrong with a 18X optical zoom.  I turn off digital zoom on all my cameras, because it never works (but in this camera you have the option to crop a digital zoom pic.)Enjoy, and if you have any questions, ask me, I will try to figure it out for you, but I think it is an amazing camera, and for the price, home run!Cases, I bought a TBC-304 and it is way to big.  So ended up wth a DCB-302 and it is snug and safe!Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: Memorize the User's Manual; you can't take it with you.
Reviews.Author: Karen McKim "Karen McKim"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera three days and am already disappointed. I purchased it as the backup camera for a trip to Africa. Imagine yourself out in the field wanting to take a type of photo you haven't taken before, seeing a display icon that you don't understand, or for some reason having the camera not doing what you want. You want to be able to pull out the user manual, right?Forget it. The user's manual comes ONLY as a pdf file. So, hope the sun holds still while you open up your laptop, insert your CD, load the pdf, and look up the instructions. Even at home, when I tried to practice with my new camera outside, I had to read the instruction at my desk, go outside to try it, come back in...ugh.I emailed customer "support" at Nikon to ask for a paper copy of the Users Manual. The told me to take the CD to a local print shop to pay them to print out the 237-page manual. Let's see...at 10 cents a page, that's $23.70 to enable myself to carry around a stack of paper six times the size of the camera itself.The thing does come with a hard-copy 'Quick Start' guide which--ironically--includes basic instructions for only the things you can do at your desk (charging the battery, etc.)Come on, Nikon. Get real and give us a user's manual we can stick in a backpack. Sheesh.

Reviews.Title: Same Problem Camera Freezes and Will Not Work
Reviews.Author: Ben "Ben"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the zoom capabilites with a small camera. Ideal for my camping trips. After just two weeks of pictures when I turn on the camera the lens is stuck out and clicks. No way to fix it. Nice two hundred dollar paper weight!!

Reviews.Title: If this is the last point and shoot available, then grab a pen and paper...
Reviews.Author: M. Cline
Reviews.Content: ...and just draw the picture you want to capture.  Terrible.  Just freaking terrible.  I've owned point and shoot cameras from Canon, Nikon, Kodak, and Olympus, and this is easily the worst I've ever owned.  The specs on the camera would of course make you think otherwise, but the pictures are just poor quality.  The auto focus feels like it is constantly working, and even when it locks in, the end result is rarely in focus.  One of the features I read about this camera was how great it does in low light situations.  HA!  I have no idea what the reviewers who wrote that were thinking or what they were shooting, but based on my experience with this camera I can assure you that it was not in low light.  This camera rarely takes a crisp, clear picture in perfect lighting outside on a sunny day.Perhaps I am unlucky to have just gotten my hands on a bad camera and others do not have these issues, but again the images are not what you would expect from a camera at this price range, and also with 12MP "quality".Nikon customer/technical "support" has also been awful.  I have long heard the Canon vs Nikon argument, and never given it much thought.  After this camera, I will never again own a Nikon product.  Proceed with caution if thinking about this camera.  Good luck, and I hope others do not share this same experience

Reviews.Title: Returning it - defective - Nikon quality control out of control.
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: This camera has great features and takes excellent photos in daylight and very good ones in low light.  The panorama feature works perfectly.  However, there are two issues with this unit that caused me to return it.  Amazon did not offer an exchange for some reason (out of stock maybe??).Defects:1.  There is a small bubble near the center of every photo in every zoom range.  Cleaning the lens did not fix this, so it could either be a defect in the lens glass or the sensor itself.2.  Auto-focus is very poor in Auto mode, as has been mentioned in many other reviews.  In order to get good focus, one of the Scene modes must be used.Update 2/29/2012:I was able to exchange instead of returning.  The replacement camera had the same issues - a small lens bubble, albeit in a different spot, and poor focus.  I even went to a local store and looked at their display model - same problems.  The bubble was in yet a different spot, but it was there.  None of the other Nikon models in the store had these problems.I even contacted Nikon's tech support.  Worthless!  Their email response was "Please try a different lens with your camera".  Really?  On a point-n-shoot?I wound up returning this.  It's a shame, because this camera is capable of taking great photos and has nice features and great design.  Shame on Nikon for messing up a good product!.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is discontinuing S9100
Reviews.Author: T.O. mom "isment2b"
Reviews.Content: When I was researching this camera on other websites I noticed that this camera is being discontinued.  It is being replaced with the S9300 which comes with GPS.  I'm not sure if Nikon has changed anything else about the camera.

Reviews.Title: Aggravating auto-focus and lens lock-up ! Over and Over.
Reviews.Author: molde music
Reviews.Content: The specs all look very good for the Nikon S9100. Before I purchased I read many reviews and yes, there were a few bad reviews, but I thot really nothing of it. Most were good. So I bought the camera and put it through its paces; extensively, for a couple of months. Well I can tell you now, after I returned the S9100 (twice), that all the bad reviews are pretty much dead-on, especially about focusing and lens lock-up. The biggest and main complaint I have is that: all the features and great specs on the camera will not do you any good at all if the camera can not even consistently auto-focus. Very, very disappointing to download the pictures on your computer and find out that over half of them are out-of-focus ! Not one time, not two, but over and over again. VERY inconsistent and disappointing. I even tried to focus to forefront solid objects but to no avail. Still out of focus. Even when the focus set ( depressing the shutter release half-way down ) showed the objects in focus, they still downloaded out of focus. I even returned the first S9100 I got a second one, in hopes that it was a fluke thing. But no, the second camera did the very same thing. No consistent auto-focusing. I had always expected better of Nikon, since I own four Nikon SLR's. HOWEVER, Nikon apparently still has some very big things to work-out on their P&S; cameras, especially the S9100. They need to perfect auto-focusing !The other issue, which you can work-around (but should not have to ) is that the lens will lock-up. I mean just plain will not move from close-up to telephoto or vice versa. The work-around is simply that you have to turn the camera off. Then the lens will retract. A very big nuisance to say the least but at least solve-able. However, the lack of  consistent auto-focusing is a much bigger issue and is totally unacceptable for any camera at any price. Period.If you buy this Nikon S9100 camera anyway after reading this review, make sure you get the extended, and I mean extended warranty. You are going to need it.I will say this about Amazon. They took the cameras back, both times, Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)without any problem and really no issues whatsoever. That makes shopping at Amazon great !

Reviews.Title: Frozen and can't reset
Reviews.Author: Janice Casey
Reviews.Content: I've had the Coolpix S9100 for about 6 months and have been very pleased with the photos.  However, I went out on this beautiful day to take photos only to find that the only thing I could do was turn the camera on. Nothing else worked.  I had to remove the battery to get the lens to retract.  Now have the battery and SD card out.  Hope it will reset itself by tomorrow.  Not much help on the internet - looks like you have to send it to Nikon or throw it out.  I'm not happy.

Reviews.Title: Flawed camera Cool features and Weak quality
Reviews.Author: SoBeTraveler
Reviews.Content: When your memories are on the line that's when the Nikon S9100 can let you down. Using a 4 gig sd card is enough for a day, only. Guess what, when the card is full it then corrupts! All photos gone! Card unusable until you reformat it. Card reader in computer doesn't recognize it either. The battery has a meter and the only way you can check the cards memory is with the computer. My canon tells me card full, but, doesn't corrupt the card like this Nikon. If you are sold on all the bells and whistles of this camera get large cards and download often.The other point about this Nikon was the noise made when the camera was turned on. You also hear it when the zoom is operated. It lacks the smooth operation my last Nikon had and I waited for it to lock up any time. It did not happen to us because we returned the camera after losing so many memories. Most frustrating as I have plenty of backup cards. Broke first rule, know your tools.As to the features the camera delivers.

Reviews.Title: Frustrating Camera
Reviews.Author: Wade Tom "Wade"
Reviews.Content: Most camera reviews I see are techy and long winded.  I will be brief and to the point.  The image quality of this camera is atrocious.  I've read the manual, other's reviews and attempted all varieties of settings and indoor images are always (and I mean always) blurred.  It's really infuriating.  What is perplexing, however, is that the video quality couldn't be better.  Indoor/outdoor, it doesn't matter, videos are crisp, sound is clear, and always exceed my expectations.  My recommendation.....look elsewhere for a camera/video camera combo.  1 star for image quality, 4 star for video quality....I give an overall 2 star for ruining family photos/memories.Update to 1 star:  The POS froze up while we were on vacation.  Stay away, far away!  Honestly, it's not worth it to me to go through the hassle of the warranty process with Nikon.  We'll be looking for another brand next time.

Reviews.Title: Terrible, and I'm not sure who is actually writing these reviews
Reviews.Author: Arnaud Jammaers "ajamer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an all purpose shooter for a European trip with my family.Fortunately I also brought a Nikon D50 and Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS.I can say that this camera is really honestly terrible, it has serious flaws in focusing, color, light.the pictures this camera took were by far the blurriest, and worst images of the trip. I am a decent photographerand can take a good solid picture, Not 1 image from this camera is good.I am extremely disappointed by this camera, I do not expect this kind of crap from Nikon.Its not worth buying at all. The small canon took far better pics for 1/3  the price.I love my Nikon d50 and hope that the quality issues are just in the newest smaller cameras.I really am starting to wonder about companies stacking reviews. Because had these reviews beenhonest it would have had 1 star at best.

Reviews.Title: Poorest digital camera ever owned
Reviews.Author: morkins
Reviews.Content: Received this camera, pressed the menu button and nothing happened.  Called Nikon and they wanted me to return so they could fix it (I had only had the camera for 2 hours).  Contacted Amazon and they immediately replaced.  The second camera produced out of focus pictures many of the times and others produced very grainy sections in the pictures.  I have owned probably a dozen digital cameras over the last 7 years, so I do know how to use one.  Returned this camera for a full refund - Amazon is an amazing company to deal with.

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: Ann R Pole
Reviews.Content: Since I dropped my camera in the sand, I had considered buying a whole new system, but I liked my Coolpix and I knew how to use the features on it. When this camera was listed as 'Good' I thought, 'OK my camera was in good condition, I can handle a few scratches.' So I was surprised to find it in 'Almost New' condition. It works better than my old one did before I dropped it in the sand. And I was happy to buy the camera only, and not all the batteries and cords, etc. since I already had those. Yes. I am a happy customer

Reviews.Title: Trusted what I read on expert reviews  dot uk and it paid off
Reviews.Author: shaftngears
Reviews.Content: An Outstanding camera . Powerful Flash and sensitive ISO . Brilliant and Vivid images. Among  the  few cameras  that still give the manual focus option.

Reviews.Title: I regret this purchase
Reviews.Author: LiveLearnGrow
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about two years. The 18 power zoom is great if you want to take sports pictures. Unfortunately my camera has trouble focusing. If you press the button too quickly it doesn't focus correctly, possibly because it is such a big zoom lens. Consequently appx. 1/3 of my pictures come out blurry. My old Canon Powershot SD700IS took every picture crystal clear, no matter how fast I took the picture.  Also the flash in this camera is too powerful. You must back up about 20 feet or the flash overpowers everything in the picture - especially faces. I may be able to correct this with a special setting but in a hurry you don't have time to make setting changes. Again my Canon Powershot SD700 always gave me perfect flash pictures. I will probably be going back to Canon for my next camera purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellen!!!
Reviews.Author: AEntertain
Reviews.Content: Familiar with camera so when I lost mine I wanted another.This seller was excellent.  Very quick shipment.  Eveything as advertisedSuperb camera, I did research and also found great reports.

Reviews.Title: Future photographer
Reviews.Author: TonyP
Reviews.Content: My son is 12 now and he has been using this camera for a few years and loves it.  He takes pics of everything.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: David C. Korten "David"
Reviews.Content: It worked satisfactorily for about a year of light use. Then the focus became unreliable. Most pictures are badly blurred. The camera is useless, which the reviews suggest is a typical experience for this camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: susan d badger
Reviews.Content: Directions for camera use drive me crazy but those on this particular camera are very user friendly for a novice and my pictures are fantastic. I really do love it!

Reviews.Title: Lousy camera
Reviews.Author: John M Brown
Reviews.Content: The camera is difficult to use. I have read many different articleson how to take good pictures. They still come out blurry. My oldermodel worked much better and easier. I  wouldn't recommend thiscamera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: Seattle architect
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a special family trip. I trusted the Nikon name. I liked the size and the features of the camera. It looked like a quality product. The camera began malfunctioning on the trip and was unusable most of the time. Like previous reviewers the lens would freeze, 'Lens Error' would appear, and finally I just got a blank screen. Nikon offered no help at all. I've had a Nikon SLR with good results but based on my experience with the S9100 I will never purchase a Nikon again. I could never again trust the company to stand behind a product. I replaced this camera with a Panasonic Lumix and I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: KBF
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  It is just the right size to fit in my purse andit takes great pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100
Reviews.Author: Debra Parsons
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera as a gift.  It has never taken good pictures.  If you make enough adjustments, you can get a decent picture out of it, but most are either blurred or yellow tinted.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Best camera ever! It is small and light, but very user friendly. I went to Europe this summer in a few different countries, have an amaizing pictures from that trip thanks to this little camera!!! No matter what weather it was, or how dark or bright it was outside, all pictures turned out perfect (even in a moving bus) :-)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: suzq
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great zoom on it, but doesn't zoom easily on video mode.  My Panasonic did better.  Nice red color, medium size camera takes excellent pics.  Is easy to use.  The telescoping lense is nice but beware on sandy beaches.  I got sand in the lense on a windy day on a sand dune.  Cleaned it, but some sand still in there so the lense doesn't telescope easily.  Will cost too much to have someone fix it, so I just live with it.  When it completely dies, I will buy a new one, maybe with dust protection instead.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Meng Vang
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures. The flash isn't automatic which I like because that way I can control when I want the flash to come on.

Reviews.Title: Not the camera I was hoping for
Reviews.Author: Barb B. "vgimlet"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an alternative to my DSLR camera.  I needed a decent, small camera as I take photographs for several websites, but I wanted more than the camera in my phone. While I love the available features, this camera has had many issues in the 2 years I've had it. Picture quality is often an issue, with shots turning out grainy or off-color.  However, I will say it has taken some excellent night shots. It freezes often, and I have to take the battery and the card out frequently to reset it.  While I understand it may be partially my issue as it's not always in a case, it's definitely not the easy, durable point and shoot I was hoping for.  I will be choosing a different brand when it finally freezes and can't be reset, or I finally lose my patience with the ongoing issues.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Angeles
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!!!  Is the best digital camera.I already have a year of using the camera and still works like the first day.

Reviews.Title: Took great pictures when it worked, which was not long.
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it simple, since this camera has been reviewed extensively and it getting to be an older model.  It gets two stars since it took great photos when it worked.  I feel that I am being generous with those two stars.  This $300 camera functioned properly for less than a year, now it is a paperweight.  It has some obvious design issues that others have noted as well.  First, the camera started freezing after about six months.  It was still powered on, but would not accept any inputs.  Removing the battery and replacing solved this problem at first.  However, it became more problematic later.  Now it does not work at all.  I emailed Nikon after I had the camera for almost exactly a year, and described the problem that many other people have had with the exact same camera.  They said "sorry, can't help you."  Oh, and the shutter sticks open at times as others have noted. I owned three relatively inexpensive Kodak digital cameras prior to this for about 10 years and never had any issues with them. I expected more from a $300 camera. It basically cost me $1 per day, since its service life was so short.  It's really a design and/or quality control issues, since this camera did take good pictures when it worked.

Reviews.Title: damaged charging port
Reviews.Author: ma
Reviews.Content: It is not good.the charging socket has been damaged and I couldn't use the recharging from the camera.I should use external charger

Reviews.Title: Beyond disappointing
Reviews.Author: Billses
Reviews.Content: I got my Nikon S9100 because I'd used Canon for so long and wanted to try something different. It functioned OK for a couple of days and then I took it outdoors, where it froze up almost every time I turned it on. I couldn't do anything with it until I removed and replaced the battery. Then it would turn off, but still freeze up the next time I turned it on. I called Nikon Service who told me it was a "weather issue" because I had taken it, in my pocket, from the 70 degree house to the 48 degree outdoors. They told me they could not warranty their product and now I am stuck with a worthless camera which is only a week or two old. I will never, never, never, never buy anything Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Not exactly the quality I expected
Reviews.Author: darrell
Reviews.Content: Nicely made camera but the photos just are not as clear as my other, less expensive, cameras.  I was hoping for a higher quality result but the quality of images just does not come through with this camera.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for the traveler.
Reviews.Author: Erick B.
Reviews.Content: This little camera has made wonders for us. Every single mode works very good and can't stop using the sport mode.  We took over 2000 pictures in our trip to Perú and most of them came out very cool.  Even the shots of the flying condor's were possible thanks to the sport mode.

Reviews.Title: nikon cool pix camera
Reviews.Author: james pfeifer
Reviews.Content: i love the 18x zoom.When battery goes....it's quick  nothing to replace it with.settings  when taking pictures in a banquet room with lighting on walls  sometimes tough to find the right setting.overall like it.

Reviews.Title: The best brand in camera
Reviews.Author: Marjorie Caroli
Reviews.Content: Totally delighted with the camera. The resolution of the images is amazing. People are amazed with the quality of the photos. Simply the best camera I ever had.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: JIMBO
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera a year and a half ago and after reading the reviews I guess we were lucky. Our camera did not start freezing up until just a month ago!! Thankfully, someone who reviewed this item explained how to remedy this problem, but when you spend this much on a camera you should not have to fiddle with the lense to make it work.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera.
Reviews.Author: Charles H. Vogt
Reviews.Content: Great quality pictures.  Excellent for travel.  The zoom is great.Found it very convient when hiking in the mountains of Switzerland.

Reviews.Title: great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: aadavidallen
Reviews.Content: What can I say that a thousand other satisfied people have said about a cool camera that always works. Great

Reviews.Title: Nikon quality
Reviews.Author: W. Land "New Seattlite"
Reviews.Content: I had a much-lesser Nikon point-and-shoot, and decided to move up-market into a better camera, with more traditional Nikon-esque qualities.  This camera did not disappoint, built with Nikon quality feel.  It's big and heavy for a point-and-shoot, but miniscule compared to a DSLR.  Small cameras are a compromise, and you have to consider where you want the quality and features versus the weight and size compromise to fall.  Me, I wanted more features and build-quality than the smallest and lightest available . . . although that's a drag sometimes.  Many cameras are the same "under the skin" these days (I have a Samsung that almost certainly is built on the same chassis), so the differentiators become mostly the lens and firmware.  Although this market segment is dying, killed by cell phones, there seems to be considerable innovation in this segment.  Things are getting smaller, lighter, and higher quality.  This camera may be a dinosaur soon.  Remember the Sony Mavica?

Reviews.Title: Selling one for 160
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Anyone living in Corpus Christi Texas I am selling this camera for only 160 great camera but I dont need one at the time

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: We love this camera!  We like it so much we are now considering upgrading to the S9500.  The images in low light is what steered us to this camera.  They come out superb even with no flash.

Reviews.Title: Better than a whole old fashioned darkroom I once had.
Reviews.Author: bobsound
Reviews.Content: It's wonderful. I need more time to learn how to move from my old film and chemicals process- and love doing it

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: BriansJoe
Reviews.Content: But the low light res makes for some slow shutter speeds...Excellent features and very good camera for the size and price...

Reviews.Title: High Quality
Reviews.Author: The Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year and it still takes great pictures. These days, mobile phones take those everyday picture and for the most part, that's good enough. However, no mobile phone can take a better picture than this Nikon (at least not yet). There are still inherent limitations with mobile phones and for those images that you may wish to send of to have enlarged, or photos that are very important, you want something more- this Nikon delivers. Prices have come way down and you can buy it for cheaper than I did. Despite being over a year old, it serves my purposes great.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but didn't last long
Reviews.Author: Dani
Reviews.Content: The camera has arrived in time with all the cables, battery...so all good there, the camera was good nice pictures and I liked the options for the panoramic pictures. I was very happy with this camera. But after 6 months of using it while I was in Brazil on vacation it just stopped working, I would turn it on and after that nothing, it would freeze in that position and no way to make it move, change settings or anything. To turn it off the only way is to take out the battery and put it back in. I'm very disappointed with this camera, I'm trying to get it fix but my vacation is now finished and with no many pictures from the place.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Kan
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute best small camera I've ever purchased.  Zoom is awesome, easy to use, great size for pocket, amazing picture quaility.  I would recommend for anyone!

Reviews.Title: CoolPix S9100
Reviews.Author: Ronald Newman
Reviews.Content: Very much like the CoolPix S8000, the S9100 should perform even better with the additional features.  First testing has proven quite comparable to the older S8000.  Though familiar with the general software of the camera, I expect it to be an improvement, but have yet to use the camera extensively.  At current prices, this camera is a great buy and should serve you well.  The 18 times wide angle will give you improved versatility. I wish Amazon offered a Nikon brand soft leather case with belt attachment for this camera like they have for the older S8000 series.  The Nikon brand case Amazon has offered for the S9100 is, unfortunately, a hard leather and has no belt attachment capability.

Reviews.Title: Great Refurbished Camera
Reviews.Author: steph
Reviews.Content: This camera came promptly and with all the books and chargers. Looking at it and using it, you cannot tell it has been refurbished, and I have had no problems with it since it has arrived!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I use it for work and for play. This thing is a beast and takes great pictures. I give it 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Wife loves this camera
Reviews.Author: Martin A. Pesek
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the wife's purse and takes great pictures while still being easy to use. She is not a tecky but likes this camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Michel
Reviews.Content: This Camera takes very good pics. Couldn't of made a better deal for that price. Very compact. The zoom is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Seems to do all we wish it to.  But, I really resent having to supply words that are unnecessary.  In the future, I'll just ignore these feedback emails.

Reviews.Title: LENS FREEZES ON ZOOM, after about a year :-(
Reviews.Author: mallione
Reviews.Content: Have 2 of these, and both are intermittently failing after just over a year.THIS IS A COMMON PROBLEM, VISIBLE ON THE INTERNETopened a case with Nikon, but they refuse to come clean ...  all the customer support agents probably know what is going on but steadfastly stick to the party line, and blow a steady stream of steam up your back end.  The official Nikon answer, is we do not know, so send it in for repair.I talked to a Nikon repair shop.  the lens is sealed unit.  it is the only moving part.  there is no diagnostic.  $105 to replace, $25 shipping (round trip)... so $130 to repair a $150 camera ... he agrees, not worth it.so we use it until it gives up completely, or becomes more frustrating than worthwhile, (you have to remove the battery to get it working again after a freeze up) and think seriously about buying any more Nikon.  imo, a major failure in just over a year, is not acceptable.BTW, if not for this inherent defect, the camera would be 5 stars.it performs very well for its size and price.too bad Nikon will not stand behind what is clearly a manufacturing defect.

Reviews.Title: Super zoom....
Reviews.Author: jame r meys
Reviews.Content: We took this camera to Glacier National Park this fall and were able to get wonderful photos very easily. We did buy a hard cover for it because we were worried about the hiking taking a toll on the camera.  This also protected the screen. Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good travel zoom
Reviews.Author: Davorin Duranovic "Muflonizacija"
Reviews.Content: I am DSLR shooter and this is my pocket camera. I was amazed with zoom on this camera it is mind blowing. Sensor is good and is is super easy yo use. I would want more manual control but modes Nikon have on this camera are clever I must say. Auto focus is fast and accurate and I like video

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: cdf
Reviews.Content: Great fishing camera.  Fits in pocket and has long zoom lens.  Recommend it to anyone who wants a small pocket size large zoom lens.

Reviews.Title: not a bad camera
Reviews.Author: S. Knowlton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in March of 2012. I love the zoom options. Never had a problem with the camera yet. It is very easy to use. It is great at taking photos outside with natural lighting, but not so much inside without a flash. I like the fact that you can zoom in while video recording, something my previous camera could not do. I take this camera everywhere with me and love taking photos when I can.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my mother.  She loves how easy it is to use and the small compact design on it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED...
Reviews.Author: Jiraphan
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED...It's a very good camera, I love it.However, lens makes noise when you start zooming, especially at night. Nikon customer service is very nice. I sent for a repair ( paid for shipping myself) , they cleaned my camera, fixed the problem. Sent it back, but it still makes noise when zooming. Other than that, I love this camera !

Reviews.Title: easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why I cant just give the item a star rating and eave it at that.  sometimes you dont have anything more to add than the other users have already typed.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: StJim
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to anyone interested in photography or taking a lot of pictures. While many will argue that there are better cameras, this is a great pick to start off with and to immerse yourself into photography and video is of okay value. The part that I love most is how the lens pics up the whole scene without distorting it, of course, on higher zooms, it starts to refract the light on the outer edges of the picture, but of course that is normal and can barely be seen. The best part, technically you can't really put it into your pocket like say a Bloggie or Flipcam, but you could buy a carrying case and look there, you have a great point and shoot camera and camcorder at your side. As for taking continuous pictures or HD video, get a good class 6+ SD card, that way your camera can capture more without having to take time to read and write on to the SD card. As for the rest, you'll just have to do some research and try it out.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this
Reviews.Author: lorp
Reviews.Content: For day lighting this camera is fine. If you are wanting to take any pictures with even slightly dim lighting, this camera is terrible!!! Taking pictures in door is a joke and they turn out terrible. The zoom works well, but lighting is such a big issue that I can not recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, BUT it wont last
Reviews.Author: MaraP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a little less than a year ago. I must say I loved the pictures, zoom and overall quality. The problem? It just went black on me one day, simply DIED. Funny enough I had seen some reviews with the same warning, but decided to roll the dice anyway since it had great features. So, all in all a great camera, if you want one that will only last 10 months...

Reviews.Title: Little more complicated than I anticipated.  Also somewhat awkward to hold, esp with the pop up flash (when needed)
Reviews.Author: David Lavender
Reviews.Content: Bought this for one of my grand daughters, who is 14 yrs of age.  was disappointed that a regular paper book did not come with it.  Received a "book" in form of a CD.  Other than that, and comments above, it takes great pictures.  Hoping she will learn all the "in's & outs" of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Can't focus, horrible in low light
Reviews.Author: M.B.
Reviews.Content: Unless you have optimal photo conditions, this camera is surprisingly worthless for the price. Only 30% of my pictures from my recent vacation to the Outer Banks came out with any kind of clear or crisp quality. It looks like a great camera, but its focus and low light performance are extremely disappointing. Buying a Canon and never buying a Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing a new camera for myself, and this one had great reviews and a good price. I'm not interested in owning a DSLR even though they're the trendy camera right now; I don't need to take "professional quality" photos. This one does everything an average person needs it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Terry Engel
Reviews.Content: Great little camera and like almost all Amazon deals costs less than the big box stores and is not to be in their limited stock.  This camera does all pictures well and does great videos too.

Reviews.Title: good camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Dibad
Reviews.Content: Got it some months ago. I'm no camera expert but overall I can say the camera works well. My first complain is when connecting the camera to the PC through USB. On my Windows 7 pc I was unable to copy some pictures from the camera to the pc. On my 2nd PC (running different Linux distros) the camera doesn't even gets detected.This issue can be solved by removing the sd-card from the camera and inserting it directly on the pc but still is a very annoying issue. My second complain is that there hasn't been any firmware update since the camera came out to market. I would rate this camera a 3.8 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Not an Indoor Camera
Reviews.Author: Chinmoy Goswami
Reviews.Content: Great outdoor picturesOK pictures indoorsHorrible pics if you want to take pictures of kids or anything else that moves.I am not sure why the "Sports" mode is even there. I havent been able to tak eone good picture with the sports mode.Indoor pics usually turn out grainy and kind of blurred. If you force the flash, the pics are totally washed out.Overall I am disappointed and not happy with Nikon's response of "hold the button half way down and than press" as if I didnt know that.I will get rid of it and buy a Sony.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9100
Reviews.Author: Paula
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my purse  I don't go anywhere without a camera.  I am very impressed with the quality of photos, speed from one photo to next, and the 18x zoom is great.  The only item missing was a regular charger so that I can charge one battery while still using the camera.  I was able to pick up 2nd battery and charger at a very good price with Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Everthing It Claims To Be
Reviews.Author: Moosey
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a "point and shoot" that had good telephoto capabilities and good video.  I know my needs and since I'm not a "shutter bug" a $400+ camera would be a waste.  However, I would like some of the features $400 buys.  Since my needs center around telephoto and video the Nikon CoolPix S9100 has proven to be a perfect choice.  It lives up to its reputation/reviews.  All the pluses and a few negatives ( auto focus while zooming MAY blur ) still leaves me way ahead on the technical front.  Some of my previous cameras did not even possess some features of this Nikon and if they did they could not approach the performance levels of the S9100...and certainly NOT for the price I paid.  All in all I am very pleased with my choice.  I have been using this model for 3 months.

Reviews.Title: Camera has freezing problem
Reviews.Author: wally
Reviews.Content: Had camera for 6 months before it quit working. Camera was not abused. I am in a remote area of afghanistan so will be hard to return or exchange. I have used canon for years and wish I had my old camera.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: PHT
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera less than a year. After about six months it stopped working and we had to send it in for repairs (covered by the warranty). Now, six months later, it's not working again.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 10 months...
Reviews.Author: CaptRick
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera however after 10 months of use I now have the dreaded zoom lock up. I have sent it to Nikon for warranty repair and I will post a follow up once I see what Nikon does......

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Johnny
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price...I highly recommend it so far I'm happy with the camera.  Easy to use and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Beware the Coolpix S9100!!
Reviews.Author: lalondeseattle
Reviews.Content: Oh how I wish I had read the negative reviews about this camera here on Amazon before I bought this S9100 -- which has proven to be defective in design or software. Which I cannot say, due to the incredibly bad service help from Nikon. Denial in fact by them that there is a problem with this camera. In short, I bought the camera and took it on a 90 day trip abroad. I bought it on Amazon through Cameta Camera. It had stabilization and focus problems which I at first thought was my problem. It took some amazing still photos, but then a series would be out of focus. Night shots were nearly impossible to capture. I have essentially given up trying to take pictures with it as is completely unreliable.No matter the settings, many pictures(simple shots) are simply out of focus. I am a semi-professional photographer. After my return, I contacted Nikon spent 5 hours -- talking with their help on the phone, going through their incredibly bad web help site an then also through the test processes they asked me to try and downloading problem photos. In the end I got no help just denial -- they said reset the camera. And mysteriously, put up the flash!" Neither of which had any effect. The lack of stabilization and or other problems robbed me of a vacation of photos!!! Nikon has been beyond unresponsive. I would not buy another Nikon product based on their service response alone. (They did send me a nifty Customer Survey very promptly, asking me to rate their service.) I have owned a Coolpix before (the first) and used a Nikon SLR as a journalist. These problems extend even to the download software process with their accompanying software. There seems to be some relationship between the 'bad' photos and the software installed on my Mac. All these problems occur with maddening random basis, depending on the various settings -- INCLUDING AUTO!I wanted to return the camera for a full refund, but Amazon replied that since 90 days had passed (while I was out of the country) their buyer guarantee did not apply. I even purchased an extended warranty, which now seems worthless. I have tried to solve this problem with Nikon. Now I am now trying to send the camera back to Nikon for a refund - not likely -- and seeking redress from the vender. Read the other negative reviews here and the problems become clear. Beware at least this line of Coolix. By the way, I also own a Sony CyberShot and it is stupendous and superior in all regards. Highly recommended. Caveat Emporum CoolPix!

Reviews.Title: Not Dependable
Reviews.Author: P. Haddad
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful long-distance pictures.  But it's not versatile or dependable enough to capture candid shots, many of which were blurry, especially if there is any movement.  If I had realized within 30 days of purchase, I would have returned it.  It will go to our local thrift shop.

Reviews.Title: Regret........
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I love Nikon, usually.  I have a Sony Cybershot that was given to me as a gift several years ago (that has been fantastic)I decided I wanted more out of my pocket camera. I waited for this model to come out and really excited about the 18X zoom.  The zoom & other features that are more like my DSLR seemed too good to be true. The first few pictures turned out ok,fuzzy color slightly off.  I attributed it to user error.  The more I used it the more pronounced it was, especially the zoom and I had several instances of the "locked up". It got to the point it couldn't zoom beyond about 5X and then was unable to focus on Macro at all I took it back to Best Buy, they sent it to Nikon.  I got it back two weeks later, they said it was fixed but it hasn't been. I am not a pro but am comfortable with my DLSR in full manual and can produce exactly what I am looking for most of the time. Huge disappointment, I wish I would have stayed with a Cybershot and sacrificed some features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, when it works...
Reviews.Author: Christoph
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nikon S9100 (from Bestbuy) for each of my kids (2) last Christmas.  The freezing problem I see reported appears to be systemic.  One of ours has already been back to Nikon for repair, and now both are doing it again.  Sometimes you turn it on and all you get is a black screen (remove battery).  Other times, the LCD turns on and you can see the view finder but the buttons don't function (remove the battery).  Very frustrating when you're trying to enjoy a vacation to say the least.Myself, I purchased a S8100 and have been pretty satisfied but will likely go back to Cannon for my next point & shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing but with potential
Reviews.Author: North Country Artisans (Linda)
Reviews.Content: I owned the Nikon S9100 for about six months and finally, when the cons outweighed the pros, I sold it. Note that for the most part, I carry a small camera in my bag every day and it goes everywhere I go for that unexpected nature or street shot. This camera was meant to be an upgrade for my Canon Elph SD1000 because of the Nikon's much higher zoom and wider angle. Unfortunately, in many but not all ways, the S9100 was a disappointment. I am by no means a professional or even an advanced amateur photographer. I do, however, feel that I have the ability to get the most out of these small cameras, hence my very non-technical review.Both the pros and cons of the S9100 come with caveats. Below are some thoughts on the Nikon S9100:First, I cannot comment on the video function since I never use it.Lots of cool artistic features including selective color and panorama (though poorly executed compared to SONY). Selective color works very well.Easy to use with fairly intuitive menus but no real manual controls.Powerful zoom but you'll need a tripod to get that extreme close-up.Nikon claims this is a low light gem. It is not. I took the S9100 to a small concert venue that had definite lighting issues and every shot was blurry. Even an ISO adjustment didn't do the trick. I brought out my iPhone 4 and every shot was sharp and perfectly exposed.Though technically not a "pocket camera," the S9100 is small enough to slip into a travel bag or cargo pants pocket.Wide angle is one of the best in this class of camera.I compared the same shot in Photoshop Elements taken with my Canon SD100, the Nikon S9100 and the Lumix DMZ-ZS8 that I purchased to replace the Nikon. In clarity, the Lumix with its great glass came in first followed by the Canon. The Nikon was noticeably softer. However, color rendition was clearly better in the Nikon.I really wanted to like this camera. Nikon has created a camera series that has great potential. After extensively researching the S9100 and reading reviews here on Amazon and elsewhere, I knew there would be compromises. As it turned out, with a good amount of hands on time, there were too many mediocre results that made continuing to depend on it unacceptable and out of the question for getting the great shots that had made me so satisfied with my Canon (and now with the Lumix).

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here I was reluctant to buy this camera. It isn't that often you see an almost equal number of good and bad ratings. However, the so-called pro review sites won the day.Have been using or attempting to use this camera since October. I have owned several compact digital cameras over the years from Canon, Olympus, Panasonic and now Nikon. Whatever happened to the good name of Nikon? Trying to get this to focus on close up and/or zoomed out very much is nearly impossible or at least so difficult as to make it not worth the effort.Then about three weeks ago it started freezing requiring that you remove and re-insert the battery in order to get it to work again.It has now been returned for warranty repair and frankly I don't really want it back. Based on what I have read here and elsewhere I don't see how the focusing issue will be resolved and suspect that it will only be a matter of time before it fails mechanically again. So, at this point I assume I will keep dealing with it and sending it back until the warranty runs out and then can put it in the trash.I owned Nikon over 20 years ago when they made quality equipment. I had my eye on another Nikon but won't take the chance with them again.Update: 12/20/12. Sent this camera in again for same lens and focusing problem this past October. They supposedly replaced the lens the last time.

Reviews.Title: elaine
Reviews.Author: cold and sinus
Reviews.Content: would like a hard copy of the manual-it is only available if I download 200+ pages.The camera is great - but I dont know how to work everything.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: Bearberry
Reviews.Content: I'm 100% disappointed in this camera.After a week of trying to figure out some combination of settings that will produce a usable image, I'm going back to my old camera.This isn't my first Nikon camera. In fact, I've been using Nikon Coolpix cameras for nearly 10 years and been very happy with them up until now. The specs for this camera looked like just what I needed but so far the photos are pretty much worthless. My primary subjects are nature close-ups, but I'm getting at best 1 in 10 photos in focus. My Coolpix L560 gets much better results.I wish I had read more reviews of the S9100 instead of rushing to purchase. It's an awful camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera Freezes up
Reviews.Author: Baron von Smoogle
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a Christmas Present.  Today, 4/13/2012(Spooky, huh?), it froze up and would not work.  Had to remove the battery to get the camera to shut off.  The lens would not retract until battery was reinserted.  Camera will turn on but nothing else.  All buttons are frozen.While researching this camera I did not see any issues about this. Today, after searching for a reset feature, I found that this is a common problem.  Nikon seems to be very reluctant to fix the problem.This is the first Nikon product I have purchased.  I think I will go back to purchasing Canon products.

Reviews.Title: Awesome telephoto, great features
Reviews.Author: Hounddog87
Reviews.Content: Only used the camera few times so I am still getting the hang of it. Worked great outdoors at an Easter Egg hunt with lots of moving kids. Took pictures inside with lousy lighting and any movement did blur the people a majority of the time. Has plenty of scene adjustments for those not interested in too much control. Telephoto is wonderful so it makes up for a few other drawbacks.Would still recommend the camera just be careful of what you intend to use it for.

Reviews.Title: A waste of money
Reviews.Author: usafpj
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera when it was new a little over a year ago. It has been garbage since the first time I took a picture. I wish I had returned it but I was in Afghanistan and just put it to the side. When I got back stateside I sent it in to Nikon for repairs. Today is the third time I have gotten it back from the service center and it is still the exact same. The pictures are blurry. The VR is extremely noisy and doesn't seem to do anything. The camera itself rattles like something is loose inside when being lightly shaken. I took comparison pictures with my 10 year old Canon Point and Shoot and the Canon takes better pictures. I took it to professional photographers and the camera shop in my town and they all say it is broken. Nikons service techs are either incompetent or refuse to replace my camera. It is a piece of junk and they say it is fine. Biggest waste of $350 in my life. Do not buy this! Hopefully their new version is better because the S9100 is a lemon and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Average camera, below average low-light photos
Reviews.Author: Frank Bertola
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nikon S9100 as a compact point-and-shoot to supplement my Nikon D3100 14.2MP Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens. I already own a Canon PowerShot SD4000IS 10 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 3.8x Optical Zoom and f/2.0 Lens (Red), which takes fine photos, but my wife wanted a camera with longer zoom. This camera was intended to replace the Canon. I used the Nikon for about a week and wound up returning it. Here is a little more detail about my experience with this camera:- The camera is bigger than most point-and-shoots I've tried, probably due to the larger screen. I needed to step up to a larger case than the one I currently use for the Canon.- Despite the size, there's no grip for your left hand to make it easy to hold. I notice many cameras in this class lack it, so no points deducted. However my left index finger naturally went to the top left corner, but since the flash resides there, I needed to find a different location.- The just-mentioned flash is manually operated, meaning the camera will tell you when it's needed but then you need to press the open button. If you happen to frame the perfect shot but it requires the flash, you need to pop it, refocus, and hope that the shot is still available.- There is no external charger -- you simply connect the power supply to the camera and the battery charges. That means you cannot charge one battery while using another.Now to the big reason why I returned it: all pictures looked pretty soft, even outdoors with sufficient light. In low-light interiors, which is where I take the majority of my photos, the quality was downright poor. It felt like a huge step down from the Canon, so I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Same Flaw
Reviews.Author: will stevenson
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these and used it for a couple of months, until the same lens lock-up issue happened to me. It's really too bad because it did a good job taking pictures and the 18x zoom was just amazing. But I no longer have this camera, and don't look at Nikon the same way I used to. It's hard to understand how Nikon would go about damaging its own iconic name. They were always one of the very best cameras, and you knew you could rely on them. Not anymore. If they do it with this camera, what other cameras of theirs are also unreliable?

Reviews.Title: Poor autofocus, poor color
Reviews.Author: sean o'rourke
Reviews.Content: I read the professional reviews, and while they warned that the camera had image stabilization problems when shooting video, and so-so performance in low light or indoor shots, I didn't think that would be a problem.  I use a camera to take stills on hikes and runs, so I want a wide angle plus telephoto, and only shoot in relatively bright settings.  The S9100 should be fine for this, right?Wrong.  Most importantly, the autofocus is finicky and often gets things wrong, for example blowing the focus on a zoomed-in shot of a distant mountain in full sunlight.  Neither of my previous cameras -- a Panasonic ZS-1 and an old Canon PowerShot -- ever screwed up something this easy.  The built-in HDR -- which I thought would be useful for bright skies and snow -- was not only incredibly slow, but not nearly as effective as HDR software I have used on my PC.  Finally, the colors were wacky, ranging from washed-out to unrealistically vibrant.  After three days of shooting, I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality pics
Reviews.Author: CS
Reviews.Content: We did our homework, so we thought. Bought this camera and find the quality of theImages quite inferior. Far less expensive cameras deliver sharper images. In good conscience I wouldn't sell this shoddy camera. This is the first time Nikon has disappointed us.

Reviews.Title: bad purchase
Reviews.Author: Marthac43
Reviews.Content: This is Sunday evening.  I purchased this camera Friday afternoon. Fully charged and it has frozen up on us 2 times.  Each time, I have to recharge the battery in order for the lense to retract and finally turn off.  The camera has not been in use for more than an hour or 1 1/2 hours total while just learning to use it.  Tried the video mode a couple of times for bout 9 or 10 seconds each time.  What a disappointment. I will be returning this camera in the morning.

Reviews.Title: BLURRY PICTURES
Reviews.Author: ImEven2
Reviews.Content: Blurry pictures about half of the time.  Not a good point & shoot camera in auto mode. My Canon SD 780 IS under the same conditions takes perfect pictures.  Would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with 9100
Reviews.Author: Frogkarma
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 9100 in December of 2011 and in January took it on a 2 week vacation to Norway.  I was very disappointed with the picture quality in general, and about 1 week into the trip, I developed a dust particle on the sensor.  Nikon says this is nearly impossible but I have the ruined images to prove it.  I debated long and hard between the Nikon and the update to my trusty Canon SX200 IS (SX230 IS).  I followed all of the glowing reviews for the 9100 so that is what I opted for.  My mistake.  Should have gone with my gut and stayed with the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointing camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement for our Sony H55.  We looked at CNet reviews, and the S9100 seemed great, and after checking out other large optical zoom cameras, we thought we'd try a Nikon since I have many friends who rave about Nikon.  Well, I think we should have paid more attention to the Amazon user reviews.  People here kept stating that it was difficult to get a clean picture.  We figured we had plenty of experience and were good enough photographers to get past that.  Evidently we're not.  While we're not pros, we are pretty good.  We certainly know how to focus, center, and snap a good looking picture.  This camera just doesn't let you do that.  We fiddled with ISO settings, white balance, scene settings, pretty much everything until I was at the point where the camera was going to get thrown through a window and be unreturnable.  It's simply a frustrating camera.  You'll line up on your subject, half-click the shutter to focus, and it will grind until the moment is gone and not be able to focus.  This happens if you're 3", 3', or 30' away.  Then you can tilt the angle just a smidge and it will focus.  It's maddening.  It performed horribly in low light, and if your hand wobbles the slightest bit, or if the cat or kid moves at all (when does a cat or kid NOT move when you are trying to take a picture?) the picture is totally ruined.  I'm not talking about huge movements...a kid moving an inch, or you hand wobbling just a little will wreak havoc on your shot.  Now, when it takes a good picture, it looks great.  In bright sunlight with the subject perfectly still, it looks great.  Unfortunately to get that one shot you'll shoot at least 5 others because something went wrong. In the end, I would tell anyone considering this camera to look elsewhere unless you have nerves of steel and are only shooting still life subjects with a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my purpose
Reviews.Author: rca
Reviews.Content: Haven't really had opportunity to use all this much as of yet.  Only used around the house getting familiar with controls & settings. For now I find the "Auto Setting" works best for me being quick & easy. Small enough to carry just about everywhere I go, although not a shirt pocket model still handy to take along.Make no mistake; this camera is not a DSLR, but then not as large & bulky neither. So it's about perfect for my purpose. The zoom is fantastic, but you need a steady hand for maximum zoom. All in all, a great grab & go camera that gives good results if used for what it's designed for.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Sakith
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good.Pictures come good in low light.Handling is convenient.Still photo zoom is good.Video zoom not that great.

Reviews.Title: Exceltent
Reviews.Author: gabriela
Reviews.Content: this product is excelent, the 18x soom is the better caracteristics ot it. the other funtion are very weel. is a recomended camera

Reviews.Title: A really great compact camera
Reviews.Author: James Tabor "jimtab"
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything one could want in a compact.  Great optics, and every feature I can imagine, and some I still haven't figured out how to "employ."  The 18X zoom is like having a 400MM lens "built in."

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Alferher
Reviews.Content: I used to be a Nikon fan, but this little camera is about to change my mind. I chose this camera based on its features and in an attractive price. I was looking for a camera that would fit in my pocket AND give pretty good pictures. It turned out to be disappointing. The focus is very bad causing me to lose ALL the pictures I took in my granddaughter's party. Please note that I'm not a novice. I have been using DSLR's for a long time. I tried different settings but the results were always bad. I returned this product and will order a Canon instead.

Reviews.Title: Large spot on lens or sensor
Reviews.Author: RB
Reviews.Content: I am extremely unhappy with a recent purchase of a camera for my wife for a Valentine's gift.  Purchased in January, a Nikon, Coolpix sS9100, 12.1 Miga-pixels.  Upon opening, and taking her first photo, we noticed a large blemish / spot in/on the lens, which may be from a lens sensor or something else.  Unfortunately, she opened the package/gift a few days past the 30 day exchange/returnable date.Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)

Reviews.Title: Had issues right out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I had gotten the Nikon S9100 at Target, they had it for sale for $199. I LOVED this camera for the week that I had it except there were two issues I was unable to live with, 1-I think there was an issue with the dial, a few time I turned it to auto mode, but the camera would be in scene mode, it would take a few more back and forth rotation before it actually would get to the auto mode, a few time, the mode would be stuck in a mode for a few seconds, then the delay reaction of my rotations would show up on the LCD. 2-there may have been a speck of dust on the sensor because when I zoom in, you would see a blurred area that would not move when you move the camera.The s9100 has a backside illuminated CMOS sensor which was AWESOME in low light, there was never shutter lag, not even in a dim room, you press the shutter and it takes a picture right away, with no flash, I can seek each hair on a head when zoomed in. Sadly reading the reviews showed that it had many issues and I didn't want to risk getting another dud through Nikon warranty or even a exchange at target. So I returned it and went with a Canon SX130IS....which had it's own issue and low light was definitely nothing compared to the S9100! give and take I guess!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera - very sharp, vibrant images
Reviews.Author: NYCSteeler
Reviews.Content: I needed a good P&S; camera to replace my aging Sony Cybershot P200 and came across a deal for the Nikon S9100 that was too good to pass up. I've read many of the reviews for this camera and it seems a number of people have had problems with it, so I was somewhat hesitant about getting it. I ultimately decided to go with the majority opinion and purchased it and I must say I'm glad I did. I needed a good, simple (no manual settings) P&S; for those occasions where I did not want to take my bulky (and heavy) Nikon DSLR such as the playground, family get-togethers, impromptu trips, etc. The S9100 takes remarkably sharp, vibrant, color-rich photos greatly aided by a large, bright display panel with accurate color rendition. To top it all off, it has a very powerful zoom lens - very uncommon for a camera of this size and price range. I conducted a side-by-side comparison of the S9100 and the Sony P200 and the differences were like night and day. The S9100's colors were extremely vibrant and true whereas the P200's were somewhat muted and a little off. The big differences between the two were when I used the flash or shot a subject under fluorescent lighting.  When I used the flash, I noticed the Sony had a tendency to either wash out the subject - most of the images were super bright, or if the subject was somewhat distant, provided a very dark image as the flash range is not very good. The S9100 in some cases did not even require the use of flash - when it did, its images were simply stunning - very sharp, vibrant, well detailed with excellent saturation levels and good range. When I shot the subjects under fluorescent lighting, the S9100 beat the pants off the P200. Whereas the P200's colors leaned towards a bluish/greenish tint, the S9100's colors were dead center spot-on. It's simply amazing at how well the S9100 records its images. The same can be said for the video mode; the colors are excellent - extremely sharp, vibrant and bright. It also records well in low-light situations. It has a full-size HDMI connector and for some reason, the A/V output connector is located on the bottom which will require the camera to be laid down in order to make the connection. FYI, the A/V connector is proprietary: it doesn't use the standard 3-ringed mini stereo connector widely used by many other cameras, so if you lose/break it, you're out of luck as you won't be able to swap out the connector with one you may have from another camera. There's not much more I can add about this little gem other than I highly recommend it, especially if you find a really great deal on it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Chip
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I am extremely satisified with the quality of pictures and video! The zoom qualities are good for what I am using them for as well. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a solid camera the is not a DSLR but still wants high quality pictures/video.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S9100
Reviews.Author: Lauri in Hamilton
Reviews.Content: love the camera - ease of use  camera looks nice, takes great pictures.  accessories that enhance the whole picture taking experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: ScienceGeek "BLACKJACK"
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures is really amazing. Another thing - it is extremely light; making traveling with it a pleasure. The zoom is excellent and the amount of features is impressive. I bought this camera to replace a Canon Selphy and there is no comparison, really.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but zoom blurs when taking movies
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Long
Reviews.Content: I don't need to add anything to the last review; it pretty much sums it all up.  This is a great camera and the HD movies are awesome.  The sound is great, too.  BUT, there is one thing about this camera that I don't like.  If I'm shooting a movie and zoom in, the zoom loses pinpoint sharpness.  If I switch to picture mode, the zoom has no problem focusing.  If I switch back to movie, the image will still be clear and I can zoom out just fine.  But if I zoom in again, the camera can't find the target and blurs.  I thought this was a problem with all of these cameras, but now I'm not sure.Anyone else have this problem?

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix 9100
Reviews.Author: texas aggie
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this camera. The zoom is phenominal.  I found it easy to learn to use the features of this camera.

Reviews.Title: nikon s9100
Reviews.Author: Elmer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the s9100 about a month ago and so far I am pleased with it. When I first used it I took a lot of pictures that were blurred but I was moving the camera too much. I love the pictures it takes in low light situations.

Reviews.Title: I returned it
Reviews.Author: ~joy~
Reviews.Content: I was buying this one to replace an older, bulkier digital camera.  Purchased at Fred Meyer for $250, the model on display didn't have power, so we were unable to test it (which should have been a hint), but the salesman was convincing.  We'd bought electronics from him before and had always been happy.  I was severely disappointed.  What I wanted (and I explained this to him clearly) was a camera that could not only zoom in on images in the distance, but also was able to zoom in (I learned this is called macro-zoom) close enough to get details cleanly.  Nikon has a recognizable name, and with his persuasion regarding the camera's abilities, I bought it untested.  I wish I had posted sample pictures of the zooming/macro-zooming before I returned it.  It was disappointing.  The traditional zoom wasn't horrible, but it certainly wasn't worth writing home about, and the macro-zoom was a joke.  I couldn't get any closer/clearer with the macro than I could with just the standard point and shoot/automatic feature.  In fact, every time I attempted to get a close-up, things became blurry, even after attempting to refocus.  Oh!  That's another thing!  It has an annoying delay when attempting to take pictures.  With other digital cameras, when you depress the "take picture" button, there's a hesitancy as this is also the focus button, however with this one, there is that delay and an additional delay, so taking pictures of objects that are moving, you know, like people or pets, produces a blurred vision.  It was all very frustrating, even after reading the manual and attempting to play with it some more.  I returned it and was told by a different rep. that she had the exact same problems with the one she had purchased (which she also returned).  She thought it might have just been a glitch with her camera, but after comparing notes, we both came to the conclusion Nikon attempted to put too many features in too small a camera.  I have since purchased the Canon Elf 300HS and am INCREDIBLY impressed with it (see that review for sample pictures).  Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full 1080p HD Video (Red)

Reviews.Title: Returned it!
Reviews.Author: WR
Reviews.Content: I couldn't take one clear picture with this camera... I returned it for the Sony DSC-HX7V and couldn't be more happy!!!

Reviews.Title: So far, so great, especially HD movies
Reviews.Author: GFP Books "GFP Books"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much research.  I was well aware of the negatives that people have repeated in their reviews, but took the leap anyway.  So far it is a great camera.  I was mainly interested in the HD movie feature and that has been superb. Crisp, clear, good sound. I mainly use a DSL for stills, but this produces excellent photos for a point and shoot. Zoom is a wow, too. For the price and with the outstanding HD movie mode, get it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix S9100
Reviews.Author: avg joe
Reviews.Content: great camera with even better zoom. any amateur would be pleased with this camera. megapixels is only good for making large prints. when you're looking for a good camera you want aperture and zoom. this camera definitely fills that slot with more megapixel than necessary.

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: S. Erikson
Reviews.Content: Took me a long time to replace my Sony camera.  Needed something with speedy reflexes to catch my 5 year old grandson.  also a good zoom to take pics of him ice skating, playin t-ball , etc.  And wanted easy and good video.  So far this Nikon s9100 does all of that and more.  And it's alot more user friendly.  So I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 9100
Reviews.Author: Babs
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  The zoom is great at 18x for the small digital you want to carry in your pocket.  My favorite featre is the color select.  You take a black & white pictue and "highligh" the color you want to POP!  This camera was about $100.0 less through Amazon than it is in stores!

Reviews.Title: just an okay camera
Reviews.Author: KenyonFam5
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for months looking for a camera to replace my Fuji s1000. I wanted to go with another Fuji but I was nervous about the on/off switch which is what broke on mine. I finally came across this camera and was very excited that I finally found a camera that had all the features I wanted. I am mostly happy with this camera but I have yet to get a good picture of my kids or any other person for that matter. I have gotten GREAT scenic photos but when it comes to pictures of my kids, 99% are blurry. I have used every setting possible and unless the flash is on, they ALL are blurry. Because I have been through so many cameras since mine broke, I am stuck with this one and am now looking for someone to trade with. I would not suggest buying this camera if you take motion photos of anything...they dont turn out good at all!

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: D M Ost
Reviews.Content: The first one I received wouldn't focus, took terrible pictures.  I returned it and got another.  The second had a different problem, every time I turned it on in the auto mode it displayed an error message and I had to turn the dial to another mode and then back to use the auto mode.  It did seem to be taking better pictures, although not focusing in every situation.  2 bad ones was enough for me, I'm returning it and getting an olympus sz30.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: William J. Ingram
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of Nikon for the last fifteen years or so and I've had four CoolPix cameras in that time. I have used each one until I dropped it or scratched it or whatever. And then I went out and bought the latest and greatest Nikon on the market.But I got a real dog with this S9100. Its major problem is that it just can't focus properly. I bought the thing a few weeks before Christmas and took about 50 pictures with it over the holidays. About 40 of them are blurry and out of focus. Once I looked at the first few batches of photos I tried to compensate by taking 2-3 pictures of each scene and hoping that one of them would turn out well. That kind of worked but that's not the way I want to use my camera.I did read other reviews that indicated a constant problem with out-of-focus photos, but I figured those were complaints from people who just didn't know how to use a camera. Now I see that that's not true. I am a very experienced camera user and almost every photo I took was out-of-focus.I'm not going to fool around and try to get Nikon to fix it because it sounds like this is a design flaw in the camera itself. I am sending it back to Amazon for a refund. I've heard good things about the Cannon line of cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera..well it was.
Reviews.Author: Eric Stanley
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and takes amazing pictures.  You can select scene settings and picture modes or you can let the camera select them automatically.  The macro feature takes great close up shots.  Even low light shots turn out great without using the flash.  The optical zoom is awesome.  My only issue was that when you try to get creative with shots..it gets a little tricky since there isnt a manual focus.  Overall, this is a great hassle free camera.Update: 10/10/12So, I had purchased this camera at a popular electronics store almost exactly a year ago.  Took it on my vacation and it worked great..took great pictures and infact, my earlier review was when I purchased the same camera for my mom for christmas.  That was then...but now however my camera is already on the fritz.  I have only used it on 3 occasions and the lens has frozen up twice, it will no longer focus properly.  It works until you touch the zoom button and then it won't focus on anything and makes a gravely, grinding sound.  I have seen many other reviewers are now mentioning the same issues.  Several have even mentioned sending the camera back for repair only to have it act up again.  I have already ordered a new camera from a different manufacturer.  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: ken camera ready "ken camera ready"
Reviews.Content: so far so good in my expections of this camera have been good ive only had it for a couple of months and wanted to have this camera prior to a nascar event at talladega got some great photos with the 18times zoom feature and the battery  seems to be sufficent but i did buy an extra battery just in case so far the only thing i dont like about it is  when you are recharging the camera is when  you need to take off the small tab that is held on by a very slim band  to plug in the usb recharge cabe i can sense that the tab wil break off someday and then it will fall off at some point loosing it, if your not careful each time, unlike the camera before which was the very slim konica/minolta x1 dimage which is still a good camera has its own seperate charging dock which made it very easy and convient to charge it just needed to push it in the dock and thats it . if they could make a charging dock to fit this camera i would be very satisfied

Reviews.Title: Not Good
Reviews.Author: Gotcha!
Reviews.Content: Camera have focus issues when surrounding is not still. It doesn't have the stability feature of a typical camera. I return it and purchased a different brand camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix S9100
Reviews.Author: Mary Majette
Reviews.Content: We've had the camera for a little over a week and so far we love it.  The rechargable battery is a big plus and it seems to hold a good charge!  We've been taking pictures to test the close up and zoom features.  It captured the woodgrain of a steering wheel in our classic Mustang - which our old camera would not.  And taking a picture across a field using the zoom showed red flowers we didn't see with the naked eye.  We bought the camera on a recommendation from friends who just got back from a driving trip to Alaska and their pictures turned out very well. We do wish it had a neck strap instead of just a wrist strap.

Reviews.Title: The best Compact Digital Camera on the Market - NIKON S9100
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jil "princzz"
Reviews.Content: I received a gift of a  Nikon S9100 in November from a local store and it is the best!!!!  The reviews that this camera is not good, has "lens error" messages, clicks and breaks ARE FALSE AND LIES!!!  Not only is there NOT a problem with the camera, if you go on NIKON USA you will see that:1.  There is NO recall, either small or large; and2.  There is no software updates based on errors!If you add up the negative reviews to the positive, the positive reviews STILL OUTWEIGH the negative.  But be subjective.  Go to CNET, Consumer Reports, B&H;, and other sites and you will see the Nikon S9100 is rated high! There has been no problems with mine and everything it touts is correct!  From the zoom to the low light performance that is so great you don't need a flash!As far as the low light performance.  That is what I was skeptical on.  So I went out at 12 midnight, and took a shot of a skyscraper!  WOW!  It looks like it was in the daytime and I DIDNT USE A FLASH!!!!!This camera sends pride to Nikon, USA and does what it stated!  I don't know if people are running a scam or trying to get their money back to buy a cheaper camera, but the lies about this camera are NOT FOUNDED!  Of course, erratically there may be problems, but this is NOT common AT ALL!!Go out and buy this camera which is the best in the market and you will CONTINUE to see commercials about this outstanding camera!  Take the time to learn about the camera!I fully agree with the review of "BTideRoll" on April 26, 2011 and May 26, 2011!!!  He has the most accurate and complete review!Finally, CHECK YOUR MICRO SD CARD!!! If you bought a CHEAP one or less than a CLASS 6, you WILL HAVE PROBLEMS!!!  It is best to get a CLASS 10 card!!!  Remember this camera shoots in 1080p!!!  So it needs a fast card!!!  Or it will be blurry!Do you homework and STOP dissing this camera because you want a refund or are too cheap!

Reviews.Title: Several steps closer to my perfect camera
Reviews.Author: target'
Reviews.Content: This camera is replacing a 3 year old Panasonic DMC-TZ5.  Improved image quality, versatility, useful features, ergonomics and intuitive operation. I compared it to others at retail stores for months before buying here. (I know the stores hate hearing that). As with any pocket camera, there are minor gives and takes between models/brands. I just kept coming back to this one.
