I can't wait to use it in Italy and on a Med cruise next month!Update 8/41/11Returned from 21 days travel with 1400 photos and a few videos and I still love this camera. It froze once and I popped out the battery, put it back and I had no more problems. It is a huge step up from my previous camera and I got great results on many challenging shoots using a variety of useful and easily accessible settings.

Reviews.Title: Took bad photos, didn't last
Reviews.Author: Eks
Reviews.Content: We bought this shortly before a family trip to Disney World.  It had a lot of good-looking specs and some decent reviews, and we had always hear good things about Nikon cameras.  Well, from the get-go this camera was difficult to use.  Photos came out fuzzy and out-of-focus more often than not. The photos that did come out clearly were very good, but there was a lot of frustration and many multiple shots involved to get a good photo. Seemed like we always had to have the flash on, even if it was outside and sunny, or else the pic would be blurry.  We took some videos too and were happy with the video quality.  After a little more than a year of occasional use, we one day turned the camera on to find that the monitor did not work.  Look online for solutions but found no good one, so checked with Nikon about fixing it.  The estimate was $97, which we probably wouldn't spend even on a camera we really liked, but definitely will not spend on this camera. So we will be camera shopping again very soon.  Definitely not going to buy a Nikon....the Sony we had before this one lasted longer and was easier to use, and the quality was as good.  This Nikon was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: The Worst P & S I every owned
Reviews.Author: K9WHF
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the excellent specs claimed by the manufacturer. I had tried several other Nikon P & S compact cameras with poor results but hoped for better results based on professional reviewers.Pros:Large ZoomClaimed low-light performance (not true)Small SizeClever features for special effects and shooting circumstances (most are not as advertized)Cons:As others have said, getting acceptable focus is a challenge except in high light conditionsLens/Sensor speed is much slower than statedImpossible to get focus except under bright lightSensor shift IS is a jokeConstruction is terrible (battery/photo card door is flimsy and lock doesn't snap as it should)Flash is purely manual and almost ALWAYS needed insideOverall:There are so many better P & S cameras in this price category, the S9300 is no better. Try a Canon SX260 (superb) or a Pany ZS series, both very good.If you can find one, the Sony HX9V (older revision from the HX20V) is on sale now and is superb as well.Don't buy this piece of junk, its awful!!!

Reviews.Title: Lens problems!
Reviews.Author: David Hendrick "~Dave"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Best Buy.  The features are great, but what good are features that don't work because of a "Lens error?"  I sent the camera back to Nikon, after weeks of waiting, they told me it is covered under warranty to fix, but it still took over a month to get my camera back, which left me without a camera.  A month after I got my camera back from Nikon, the same problem has rendered it useless again.  The only option I have now is to go through this lengthy process again and I am leaving for a big family trip in a week, now I don't have a camera!  This model is very light and does not have a "premium" feel to it.  I'm really hoping for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I have owned
Reviews.Author: Ricks72
Reviews.Content: I would give this camera 1/2 star and that only because it does exactly what it says it will do. It takes fine pictures... period. What you may not know is that the camera freezes frequently when the zoom is used. The only way to turn the camera off and then back on again is to drop the battery. I have read several other reviews across the internet and understand they have the same problem with their Nikon S9100. Secondly the lens began freezing up when turning the camera on. No image would appear on the monitor  It appears that the lens does not open all the way. When that started happening I had had the camera for a little over a year. Now it is out of its 1 year warranty and neither Costco (with their 90 day electronics return policy) nor Nikon will help. I can have it serviced at Nikon but it costs me out of pocket and they refuse to stand by their product. Currently you can get the camera for about $170 but when I bought it at Costco a year ago in April 2011, I paid $319 for it before tax (another $30).A camera should last more than 14 months, particularly when one takes care of their electronics like I do.I have learned two things from this experience:  1. I will not buy another Nikon camera, and  2. I will not buy any electronics at Costco because of their short sighted 90 day return policy on electronics.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix s9100 retuned to sender
Reviews.Author: David N. Kelsey
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a good camera with many good features. But, I determined I really like a camera with a view finder.The screen on this camera was big and adequate.  However, like so many screens the image was difficult to see in any amount of sunlight.So, I returned it.  Good assistance from Amazon in expediting the return.

Reviews.Title: Rubbish - Unable to focus, grainey in low light, video button a bad idea
Reviews.Author: Scott Golby
Reviews.Content: What a shameful product, it should have never been allowed on sale.Firstly mine was defective, videos come up with a red dot in the mid-right side.- No Firmware UpdatesWhen it arrived I went to download a firmware update, the model had been out for about a year, but no update was available, only v1.0.0.0 was online for download.  This is now on my list for any camera, does the manufacturer actually fix issues and provide updates ?  Nikon apparently does not.- Can't Focus on anythingOnce I downloaded my first batch of photos I noticed 80%+ of them were out of focus.  I tried many things, different modes, setting adjustments, 2second timer while resting on a solid surface.  With a LOT of effort I managed to get 50% in focus, this is dreadful on such a high end point and shoot.- Nikon CMOS not good in low lightI was under the impression the CMOS sensor would be a significant step up from my 3+ year old Panasonic TZ5.  All low light photos are awful, 100% failure, no matter the mode.  I was taking 4-6 of every indoor shot attempting in vein to get something decent.  Large amounts of grain, even on 12MP highest quality they look like JPGs set at 70% compression, really really bad.- The unit comes with no charger as well!  I had to pay $15 extra to get a charger.- Thumb video button isn't practicalI take tons of videos on my other digital cameras (I carry my Canon SD780 everywhere), so I thought a dedicated button for the video was a great idea.  It isn't.  Think about it for a second & try it on an existing camera if you have one.  I hold the camera with my right thumb and fingers, so to move my thumb I have to let go of my grip.  This meant in reality two things happened- I had to grab the camera with my other hand, allowing my thumb to move to stop or start a video- The last 5 seconds of the video was swaying all over the place as I attempted to move my thumbThe good ?  At high zoom, in very bright sunshine it's better than my 10x zoom TZ5.Avoid this product and think very carefully about the Nikon 9300 as it has a near identical thumb video button setup.

Reviews.Title: Faulty camera?
Reviews.Author: CMK
Reviews.Content: I received my camera yesterday with great anticipation. Aesthetically, it looks beautiful. I was disappointed with the picture quality, and the focusing. The camera takes a lot of effort to focus, and the pictures did not turn out great. The focusing is very noisy despite I turned off the sound function. I sent the camera back to Amzaon, and reading from many good reviews, it is my sheer back luck to receive a possible "faulty" camera.

Reviews.Title: Good images and features, but the camera will freeze from time to time
Reviews.Author: Wai Kai Wong
Reviews.Content: Images taken from this camera were great. It has a great zoom range starting from 25mm and good features all packed in a nice camera body.  Handling is very good too.  Unfortunately, it happened from time to time (about 4 times a day) that the camera will freeze and lock up.  The only way to fix it was to take out the battery and put it back again.  I tried different memory cards, including the SanDisk Extreme Pro (~45MB/s read/write), but the issue exists.  There is no new firmeware I can upgrade either.At the end, even I am a big fan of Nikon products (I own the film camera Nikon FE2, D70, D200 and D7000, and other Nikon compact cameras and lens), I have to return this product.  Amazon did a great job on that.  Return is easy and I got full refund.I really want this camera to work...but I could not.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Porter
Reviews.Content: I as looking to step up from my previous camera because of poor low-light pictures and a flash that washed everything out (with no possibility of adjustment).  This camera does an excellent job with both of my problems.  The fact that it also shoots passable video is a plus.  Do understand that the camera ships without a card.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera.
Reviews.Author: David Stevenson
Reviews.Content: This camera replaces a Panasonic Lumix that my wife lost while on vacation.  The camera is simpler to use and has a much longer zoom.  The Lumix has since been found (one way to get a new camera) but the Nikon is still a newer and much improved camera.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my fiance.  She is an avid photographer and very artsy.  Well, this camera is perfect for her.  It takes great panoramic photos and the zoom on this lens is fantastic.  It has a feature where only certain colors will show.  For example,you set it to black and white but all green colors show.  Its really cool. Very easy to handle and operate.  Even me who is not the most tech knowledgeable person can handle this camera with ease. Its a great product.

Reviews.Title: Must have steady hands
Reviews.Author: Steven Lippert
Reviews.Content: Have had camera for a month and it is a very good product.  But I feel the default lens focus is too far away from your subjects.  So you are always in zoom mode.  And the zoom capability is phenomenal.  The challenge is being able to hold the camera steady enough.  Likewise, this camera has tremendous low lite capabilities.  But holding the camera steady is again the challenge.  If you do, you are rewarded with great pics.  If not, you have disappointing blurred photos.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s9100
Reviews.Author: Maurice N. Leibman
Reviews.Content: All the new point and shoot cameras are really good , but one of the most important features , and to me, the most important, is the lag time between taking the shot and the shutter closing. IT IS TOO SLOW !! Of all the reviews I read , only one mentioned this and I did not pay attention. I would not buy this camera for that alone. Too many other great choices available . Check out the Sony Cybershot, a better buy.

Reviews.Title: Fragile
Reviews.Author: A Reader
Reviews.Content: This was my first step away from the point-and-shoot ghetto.  I took some great pictures with it, ones I continue to enjoy.  The zoom feature allowed me to take photojournalist style pictures of my kids--they had no idea they were being photographed, and continued to play as though I wasn't there.  However, within a few days major problems started to crop up.  I got the dreaded "lens error" message on my third day of serious shooting with the camera (although there were no other ill effects apparent).  By the end of the second way, though, the zoom would routinely stall and fail to retract properly.  Ultimately I gave up and returned it to the manufacturer.  I've since bought a micro four thirds camera--yet a further step away from the ease (and low price) of the point-and-shoot world, but a more robust and satisfying choice.  The valley between pocket cameras and "real" cameras (i.e. interchangeable lenses, RAW capability) is an uneasy place, full of unfortunate compromises.  I don't know if this camera was better or worse than most in the class.  I just know that it failed spectacularly to deliver on its early promise.Use your camera phone for quick snaps and save up for more robust, heavier, bulkier machine for more formal occasions.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CollPix S9100 Red
Reviews.Author: Sampath Kumar Singamsetty
Reviews.Content: This is another super gadget from Nikon. Nikon has been consistently producing some great products and of late and this one is no exception. Its a great Travel camera and packs a lot of power in its tiny body and the quality of pictures are excellent though you cannot compare them with a high end DSLR. The biggest attraction is its Mega Zoom of 18X. I was able to get take some good shots while traveling in a train and the high speed photography is quite well handled by this Camera. You cannot call it  pocket camera as this one has a bit weight and its a bit thicker which can be attributed to its lens setup. The battery backup is quite good and its better to buy a second one if you travel a lot. Nikon included 2 CD's with this camera. One is a manual in pdf form and the other CD contained ViewNX2 which is a photo editing software. I could not use the software is its windows only version and I run Linux on my laptop. All in all its a very good and fast camera specifically meant for travel shooting.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THISNEW CAMERA
Reviews.Author: goodbones
Reviews.Content: It was quick and easy to learn the basics but annoying to have to refer to the online guide for any advanced information.  Takes great pictures but be sure to order an SD card when ordering camera. None is included. An extra battery would also be helpful if planning on a lot of picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: R. Perry Jr.
Reviews.Content: My first Nikon. Outdoor pictures of Granddaughter ,dogs,trees,grass ,flowers,sky is absolutely incredible.Very nice handling and ease of use.Be careful taking indoor pictures not to shake camera as you depress the shutter button.Just the slightest movememnt makes blurry pictures .If you remain steady it does take excellent photos indoors.The video is very good.I only shoot short clips ,maybe 1-2 minutes ,but I take lots of short video clips ,very nice results.The camera is a very solid camera and I am not sorry I bought it .I would recommend it to any one .

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix 9100
Reviews.Author: Choister
Reviews.Content: This is a great Camera for anyone with the desire for quality photos but not ready for a SLR. Easy to use but advanced enough to get some very nice art photos. Plus the full 1080 HD video feature is awesome!

Reviews.Title: NIKON REPAIRS TAKE TOO LONG
Reviews.Author: SUSAN
Reviews.Content: My husband bought my Nikon camera from you in December 2011. Since then I had to send the first one back to you (Amazon) because I couldn't take the pictures off and you sent me a new one. When I got that one I could take the pictures off once, then again, couldn't take the pictures off and also the camera wouldn't take a charge. My husband called you (Amazon) and you told him this time he would have to send it to the Nikon company to be repaired.The Nikon company has had my camera since 4/19/12 and every time my husband or I call to find out the status on it they keep telling us they are waiting for an answer about the part that has nothing to do with the problem I sent it out for. They told my husband that they are waiting for a new lens. I called on 6/5/12 between 5:00 and 5:30PM, I asked him again what was going on with my camera and he told me he was waiting on an answer about the part and that it was from Japan. I then asked him to talk to a manager or supervisor. He transferd me to Edgar, a supervisor. I told him they had my camera for over 1 1/2 months, but in ten days it will be 2 months. He told me he is still waiting for them to call about the part. Then I asked why it was taking so long and he told me he didn't know. I told him I missed out on a lot of My granchildren's school functions, concerts, parades, science fairs, field days, just to name a few. I have my grandson's graduation this month, two granddaughters recitals and gymnastic classes. All I keep getting is, I am sorry but there isn't anything they can do but wait. I asked if I can get my warranty extended and he said that was a good question. I thought by buying Nikon that I was getting a good camera, but apparantly not. Edgar told me to give him 24 more hours and he would call them again and try to get me an answer. I called him in 24 hrs and he told me he said 24 to 48 hrs. I told him ok I will wait for his call, he never called me back yesterday so I called at about 10:50 Am this morning and asked to talk to Edgar and the woman told me he was doing something and he would call me back in 30 to 45 minutes and I told her he wouldn't call because he never called me the day before but I would wait. I waited an hour and a half, no call as ususal so I called back and when I asked to talk to Edgar They told me he was busy and he would call me back in 20 minutes. I told them he  never calls back and that all I wanted was my camera and didn't know what I was suppose to do about getting it back. They never get an answer from Japan about the part, so how long to I have to wait for this? The Place that has my camera is from Mellville NY, so why can't they get parts here in the US? This is Edgar's first email to us. I needed him to call, but wouldn't" SubjectRepair Inquiry,Coolpix S9100 Discussion Thread Response Via Email (Edgar A.) 06/07/2012 12:47 PMHello Mrs. Switzer,Thank you for contacting Nikon Service and Support.We are writing to inform you that your request has been escalated to our Upper Management. However, we have not received any answers. As soon as we have any updates, we will contact you to let you know.If you have any questions or want to follow up, please feel free to call us back, ANY of our agents will be more than glad to assist you.Regards,Thanks for using Nikon products!

Reviews.Title: Love/Hate Valid camera/service warning, if I don't say so myself.
Reviews.Author: skidancin "skidancin"
Reviews.Content: I sent my S-9100 in for repair under warranty for the 2nd time since my purchase in August.  On this 2nd occasion, Nikon sent me pics of damage they found on my lens barrel, which I wrongly thought didn't exist when I sent the camera to them.  I'd indicated my suspicions to their phone rep., and have apologized to them in writing as I now honestly recall causing this damage.  However, my camera did not fail when the visible damage occurred, and customer service is sorely lacking!  The failure occurred later and was associated with the lens meeting light resistance against a window while I operated the zoom.  I believe, given two experiences of my own and the many other internet findable "lens error" complaints which cause this camera to be unusable until serviced, that this camera is far too sensitive to total failure due to even the slightest resistance against lens extension when operating the zoom. As for the poor service I mentioned, I have to report that Nikon failed to notify me of their change of service status from covered under warranty to not covered (definitely caused a delay in getting my camera returned to me as they won't work on it until charges are approved, but they indicated there would be no charges, then left me unaware they had changed their mind while sitting on my camera doing nothing).  I've written to them of all my concerns on Sunday the 22nd of Jan., and they actually responded Sunday, with an obviously personalized "thank-you" note indicating that they will be considering all I've said, and re-evaluating my case.  More later....Jan 24th, 2012:  My case has been re-evaluated!  In lieu of re-writing all the detail that once was here, I offer the following note I sent to Nikon concerning my repair.  Mind you, I do love this camera when it works.  Keeping my fingers CROSSED however:"Thank-you for the re-evaluation and 25% discount, resulting I can only GUESS from the failure to notify me of the change in my repair status from free to a charge, which caused an unnecessary delay in the repair process.  I have approved the repair.I do think I'm right to feel the discount is inadequate, and that Nikon is wrong to fail to adequately address the issue of what I'm necessarily left to believe is the extreme sensitivity of your lens systems to even light resistance against extension, often causing immediate total camera failure.  Nikon is aware that the nick seen on my lens did not cause the lens error failure, and you have not confirmed nor denied the suspicion I offered that the nick COULD have made the lens more sensitive to a light tap on glass much later.  I believe this is because Nikon knows that the light tap on glass likely would/could easily cause this lens error failure in any event, all by itself.  I believe Nikon probably understands that a moderate glancing sideways blow against a table (no fall) such as caused the nick on my lens barrel, easily could leave the camera functioning properly, as I've informed you was indeed the case.  I suspect Nikon is between a developmental rock (egg shell?) and a sales hard place with this issue, is denying too many warranty repairs as a result, and is being harmed by its choice to sell some of these coolpix models at all.  My warranty extends another 2.5 years, I've had too much downtime as a result of two repairs already, and hopefully should I get another lens error failure, you'll be unable to find anything to blame it on, as was the case in the first instance this camera failed and you fixed it free.  I suppose I should take photos of my camera to document its condition and functionality on a regular basis.I'm left feeling confident Nikon is well aware of and unwilling to suffer the consequences of the fact that it is an unacceptably weak design rather than unreasonable user abuse which is causing the vast bulk of these lens error failures.  After all, again, I KNOW the impact nick seen on my camera did not cause a failure, but rather, in both instances my S-9100 has failed (only one covered by you under warranty), minor resistance against lens extension - which itself caused no visible damage at all either time - was surely the culprit!  It really is unacceptable to be selling such fragile cameras, in my opinion (and certainly not without a stern and specific warning concerning this weakness).Thanks again for the 25% discount just the same, I'm sure I'm not writing to anyone who really has the power to correct Nikons real problem here, so really, thanks for what you could do."So, there you go, warranty denied, discount offered and accepted!UPDATE 01/31/2012:  More DELAY of note (a week), all on Nikon!  Here is the gist of a note I sent to Nikon today (follow-up on their response to a note I sent yesterday wondering why the repair page itself didn't show any sign that my approved repair was proceeding), which should speak for itself:"via Web 01/31/2012 02:43 PMATTN: Dear (NIKON), Per your note, I've accepted the re-estimate with the discount a 2ND TIME, this time via phone. So, per your special request I'm letting you know separately here of this fact, so that you can "expedite" my repair. Again, I've provided payment information via the phone this time, which you have today informed me for the FIRST TIME, is the ONLY way to do so, and THE INTERNET SYSTEM FAILED TO INFORM ME OF THIS APPARENT FACT EARLIER TOO!! INSTEAD, YOUR WEBSITE BOTH REFLECTED THE DISCOUNT YOU OFFERED AND ACCEPTED MY PAYMENT INFORMATION, A WEEK AGO!!!!!! UPON CHECKING IN THE MEANTIME TO SEE IF MY PAYMENT DIDN'T GO THROUGH FOR SOME REASON, YOUR INTERNET SYSTEM INFORMED ME THAT MY ESTIMATE/PAYMENT INFO WAS ALREADY ACCEPTED, ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS!!!! Yes, of course I'm very angry to have LOST ANOTHER WEEK with my camera DUE TO the INCOMPETENCE of Nikon.May I suggest that in the future you do NOT write to customers in my position saying "You MAY approve via our 800-number" but instead say "You MUST approve via our 800 number, as we will not get your information through the website acceptance form DESPITE the fact that your offered discount will be reflected on the estimate and acceptance pages, and our systems will both take your payment information and claim to have accepted it and your estimate approval"I think THIS IS UNBELIEVABLE gross incompetence!, I must say! Especially after the delay I've already been through for the failure to inform me of the re-estimate to a charge in the first place! PLEASE pass all of this on to someone who just MIGHT have the authority and inclination to spend the money to fix the absolutely horrible procedures and software Nikon has in place for service functions. For what it's worth, If I were in your shoes, I'd be BEGGING for improvements to the systems at this point."There is no sign that I'll get any further discount on my repair for this week-long unnecessary delay of Nikon's doing.  I'll be back here to inform....

Reviews.Title: BEST camera ever
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Irizarry Rivas
Reviews.Content: Shipping was impressively FAST. this Nikon 9100 is a PRO camera in super small size camera. Perfect pics every time. HD video. Amazing quality. And at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: WORST CAMERA EVER!
Reviews.Author: Anne-Britt Ostlund
Reviews.Content: This camera is horrible.  I bought it as a higher end point and shoot option for those few times we don't use our phones to take pictures.  We rarely use it and it's in mint condition, it cannot take a picture in focus to save it's life!!!  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!  I tried contacting Nikon customer service about it (via internet only, don't have time to call), but no option to complain about it, they just wanted to charge me $97 to 'fix' it, there shouldn't be anything wrong, it has never been dropped or mistreated.  I will be looking back at Olympus, loved my original old point and shoot it still works MUCH better than this POS.

Reviews.Title: S9100
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: Wanted new but got show case model. Seems ok. Called for 2sd cards,still waiting.gave me extended warranty for free,that Was very nice.thanks

Reviews.Title: Lens error lock up
Reviews.Author: E. C. Johnson "E. C. J."
Reviews.Content: Bought a few weeks ago for vacation. On my 1st day of use the lens won't retract & it says lens error. For the price & brand I expect a lot better from Nikon. This will be returned to Amazon! Bummer no vacation pics this year!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Elia
Reviews.Content: I'm still playing with it, but so far so good, good quality on the pictures and lots of different functions to play with, I'm taking it to a concert so for me that will be the greatest test of all

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Todd M. Coughlin
Reviews.Content: I had one of these for 3 days before I lost and all i have to say is AWESOME VALUE!! This thing takes great pictures. Especially in Low light. Indoor picture without a flash are no problem. Also has all the advanced features you could need to get that special shot.

Reviews.Title: A GOOG BUY
Reviews.Author: chinger
Reviews.Content: HAVE TAKEN A FEW PICTURES & DONE A COUPLE OF VIDEOS. BOTH CAME OUT AS EXPECTED. A GOOD POINT & SHOOT CAMERA FOR SOMEONE WHO WANTS A LITTLE CONTROL OVER WHAT THEY SHOT AND FAIRLY SIMPLE TO USE. IF HAD USED MORE WITH NO PROBLEMS WOULD HAVE GIVEN IT A 5.

Reviews.Title: A+ Product.
Reviews.Author: Danny L. Coulter Jr. "ZephyrInSky"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Although I am still getting used to owning a digital camera, I have to say this is the one to buy. I have had A LOT of compliments on the photos taken with this camera

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Eliza
Reviews.Content: I found the camera very easy to use & the instructions comprehensive.I also find the pictures of good quality. It performs very well for a compact cameraI have not had it long enough (only one month) to assess reliability & customer service.I would recommend this camera to a friend

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100- Outstanding Advanced Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Carl Phillips
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delighted with the image quality of this camera.  We bought this as a more travel-friendly alternative to our Nikon DSLR based on the following four criteria; excellent image quality in low light, long zoom range, compact size and HD video.  The S-9100 really delivered on all fronts and I am especially impressed with the image quality at long focal lengths (450mm max, equivalent I as I recall.)  Much sharper than I ever would have imaged at such a focal length.The camera also has a lot of creative options to choose from and the ability for a great deal of manual control if so desired.I've only had it for a couple weeks so too soon to tell on reliability but I can say the battery life has been impressive so far.I doubt there is a better camera available in the $300 range.  Seems one would have to spend around $600 or more on a micro 4/3's to get better image quality (which we considered) but then the compact size for travel is given-up.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S9100 with 18X zoom
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Very clear, crisp pictures, even with full zoom. Fastest recovery time between shots of any point and shoot that I have used. Makes it a great camera for athletic events and catching the best, most candid shots of active grandkids.Its size and weight will also make it a great travel camera.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Pepe Comanche
Reviews.Content: Estuve evaluando varias máquinas para comprar, y al final me decidí por esta, la compre desde el extranjero y un amigo me lo traía a mi tierra natal. Por lo tanto servicio post venta no puedo evaluar, pero como siempre Nikon mantuvo el nivel de su marca y cero problema. Para el costo/prestaciones que tiene, está espectacular, la batería una durabilidad de mas de 180 fotos.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: T. Cramer
Reviews.Content: The features in this little camera are wonderful. I am an avid photographer and own the Nikon D7000 as my main camera but sometimes I just dont want to carry the larger camera with me. This little thing is so wonderful and with the 18x zoom, you can capture just about any scene you would with a larger camera and various lenses. One feature I love is the selective color. You can shoot black and white and keep one color of your choice left in the shot. Fun feature!! There are many other features that makes this camera just a lot of fun and its size is convenient. You wont go wrong with this purchase. I researched a lot of cameras before selecting this one as my pocket camera. You'll love it, too!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie Abbott
Reviews.Content: After much researching and contiplating on which camera I should buy I decided on the Nikon S9100. I almost went with a bigger camera but thenI realized I could not put it in my pocket or backpack as easily.  This camera is super easy to use and the pictures are wonderful. For just asimple point and shoot it does the job impressively!  Small and light weight to carry around anywhere.  I am pleased with the camera for what I want.  Justtaking simple pictures easily and having excellent photos to print for scrapbooking.  Now my hubby on the other hand has a Nikon 7000.  That isjust a bit more involved than I want to be when photographing.  I like simplicity.  There are several options for shooting scenery, portraits, nightphotos etc.  I still have to experiment more with my settings but all in all,,,,,this camera is perfect for me.  (it even got 2 thumbs up from myphoto geek hubby!)

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: Dr. Roger L. Mccarthy "The Fe Duke"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the load of features and the Nikon reputation for optical quality.  Unfortunately it is highly disappointing.  The soft and fuzzy pictures and the poor image stablization have been commented on by others, and those observations all appear true in my experience.  In addition, the white balance feature is very challenged in trade show situations, where there is a mix of lighting depending on the situation.  Manually forcing the white balance didn't seem to help much.  Save your money.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: This camera is the most faulty annoying piece of crap I have ever owned.  The button to take pictures works sometimes, and other times you have to press it in really hard.  I have missed countless pictures of my daughters because the camera ends up taking the picture 3 seconds later after I mash the button down.  Random pictures will be blurry and out of focus, no matter what settings I have tried.  It's supposed to work well without the flash, almost everytime I've tried this, the pictures come out blurry.  Nikon has yet to release any firmware updates that might remedy this problem.  I have read about many other people having problems with the button as well, and when they send it back, it takes months to get it back because Nikon says that parts are out of stock.  Go figure, they must be replacing everyone's buttons.  Today was the last straw, I finally got my 2 year old daughter to sit still and smile for the picture and the camera just did nothing as I pressed in the button.  I'm getting another Canon, I should have never bought this piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Focus Issues - Returning
Reviews.Author: D. Hannan "David"
Reviews.Content: Very poor focus issues, and the ISO range is pathetic.  Returned for full refund.  Couldn't take a clear shot in daylight it couldn't focus in low light even with the focus sensor.I expected more from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: A 9100 for les than an 8100
Reviews.Author: tom gunn
Reviews.Content: The only draw back to this purchase was that it is silver and not red or plum.I was in the market for and 8000 or an 8100 when this 9100 popped up in my in box for less than the older model.I'm an old film camera buff and this camera allows me to control so much more.

Reviews.Title: just one small thing, a printed manual
Reviews.Author: steve naegele
Reviews.Content: I have been a Nikon user since 1960s. The original Nikon F is still my favorite-- heavy and a loud click. But the Nikon Coolpix s9100 does not come with a printed.  Digital cameras are increasingly more complicated and its a lot of work to memorize everything and having the manual in a pocket has been very important to me.Instead its a pdf manual on a cd and guess what, mine was secured, could not print it out although even if I did I cannot carry around a bunch of letter size pages in my backpocket.I guess if I am somewhere and I want to take a photograph but it requires some special knowledge about the camera I will have to go back home, crank up the Mac, read the manual and  then go back to take the photograph.This might seem like a small thing, but over the past twenty years many MBAs have figured out the easiest way to create more profit is not by making a better product or better service but by taking  something away from the customer in product or service.  It  looks like Nikon is going that path and this will be the last Nikon I ever buy.I am adding this on April 16,  2012..The shutter button broke off. As I explained before I have been using NIkon cameras since the F which is still my favorite.I take REAL good care of my cameras, always in a container of some sort when not being used, not out in the rain, I always have a strap around my neck or my wrist, depending on what kind of camera. I own a D70 and a D80 as well as some other models  of the film F and other point and other Nikon point and shot. Nikon refuses to  fix it under warranty. They are saying its my fault. I am always careful of my cameras. What ever happened is the fault of Nikon.At this point my reply  to them is to "Throw it in the garbage.  I will never buy another NIkon again. "

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Whaley
Reviews.Content: The zoom on this camera is unbelievable. You can zoom in on flowers from 150 feet away using the 18x optical zoom, while using the 4x digital zoom. I have taken pictures that appear to be from around 50 feet  of people from aprox. 1000 feet. At full zoom it is a little difficult to remain stable though but the auto stabilization and anti shake features work well. The 360 degree panorama is really cool as well. It has too many features to list. The hd video is truly hd. Get a fast flash card though. Mine is 30m\s. Sandisk makes a good one. Otherwise you will miss out on the multi frame capabilities. I can take around 5 frames a second on continuous mode. Also without the fast memory card I imagine the video would look choppy.

Reviews.Title: best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Shellee J. Bruckman
Reviews.Content: i did a lot of research before i chose this camera.  i already had a more expensive s10 nikon digital camera that i loved, but it was only 6 megapixels and didn't have hd video and using the video was complicated (for me).  one touch hd video is awesome, especially when you have grandchildren that won't stand still to wait for gramma to figure out how to use her camera.  easy panorama is a very handy feature as well.  i like that i can use the auto feature if i don't have time to choose scenes or effects.  i still have a lot to learn, but it's easier than my s10 and smaller, but not too small.

Reviews.Title: Very fast, good quality.
Reviews.Author: Ffs
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and the pictures are o a very good quality pictures.It's very fast charging the flash.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9100
Reviews.Author: J. NIEMEYER
Reviews.Content: The first evening I used this camera I about freaked. Grainy shots etc.. Then I found out that the flash is locked down, not sure if I am going to like that. After unlocking the flash the shots were fine. The outdoor zoom shots are great. Much more playing to do. So far I think this will be the right choice for me.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Moopaloop
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera brand new from Costco for an upcoming vacation. Played around with it before going and was pleased with the photo quality/ease of use, etc. Two days into our vacation, it kept freezing up, not allowing you to take photos unless you removed the bettery to 'reset' it.  It seemed to occur every time we tried to use the 'zoom' feature. We made due with it and researched the issue online after returning home.  I quickly found that by doing a simple google search for 'freezing up' with this camera model, and it's clear this is a known issue that Nikon appears to be ignoring and calling a 'software' problem, or some other silliness.  What a piece of junk.  I cannot believe this model has not been recalled by Nikon. I have returned it, and will never purchase another Nikon product again based on this experience.  Save yourself the hassle, DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera, Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Lingerfelt
Reviews.Content: If anything in your shot is moving, this camera takes nothing but blurry pictures no matter what settings you may use.  Buyer beware!  This camera stinks!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Natalya
Reviews.Content: It froze soon after I bought it, but a call to tech support solved that problem. It's been working wonderfully for the past year, and everyone is always happy with the quality of the pictures I take

Reviews.Title: Avoid
Reviews.Author: ds
Reviews.Content: Pictures are soft. Noisy at higher ISO.Dumb feature: battery must be charged inside the camera via USB and AC adaptor. Dumber feature: USB port is on the bottom of the camera.This one went back the day after I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Horrible quality pictures; iPad does better job.
Reviews.Author: X. L. Simon "Venice lover"
Reviews.Content: I own a number of cameras, Canon, Sony, Lumix, Minolta and another Nikon.  I bought this one for the long zoom thinking that I couldn't go wrong with Nikon.  What a big mistake.  I just downloaded over 300 pictures and there wasn't a single one, yes not a single one that was both sharp and did not have a washed out face.  I've never been so disappointed. I would give it zero stars if it were possible.  There are far better point-and-shoots out there; I know, I have a couple.  It may just be that for a long zoom the compromises are just too large but some reviewers had said it was better than it turned out.  And I did see a Lumix owned by a friend with a darn good long zoom, so the compromises are possible. Quality wise the bottom line is that I can take better pictures with my iPad; the Nikon 9100 goes into a drawer.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for your loved one
Reviews.Author: Garciajd7
Reviews.Content: The perfect gift for her, you can't go wrong, she'll absolutlty love it, the great quality and color will mesmerize her, having her embracing you tight with love and joy with her beautiful new Coolpix toy...

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Pamela J Velasco
Reviews.Content: nice price and shipping was timely and perfectly wsrapped.  Camera was a gift so not sure what the photos look like yet but was impressed by TV commercials so am hoping all is well.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: brie "brie"
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera after much research and i love it. the flash location takes a bit of getting used to, but that's the only flaw i see (though i wish there was a written instruction book instead of a disc). the pictures are amazing, and i find it easy to use. we bought it for a trip to the northwest and i am very happy with my purchase. i wanted a nice camera, with a long zoom, that wasn't too big; this fits all those criteria. i love it. price was reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Eaves
Reviews.Content: This is amazing for its size.  Does everything as advertised and more.Just enough automatic positions, and yet able to use some manual settings.The pictures are bright and clear..... great optics.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Brian Jones
Reviews.Content: Fast shutter speed.  Menus are simple. Telephoto low distortion.  My 4x SD card seems to work just fine. Price was great!  Can be charged anywhere with AC or USB.

Reviews.Title: faulty door for battery & flash card
Reviews.Author: judyfs
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera ( Nikon coolpix d9100 )  But, the door covering (at the bottom of the camera) doesn'tstay closed.  Just pulling the camera out of the bag or from my pocket the door flops open.  Not a good system.I had to use a piece of tape to hold it shut on a $300 camera, thats not good.  Paul Simpson

Reviews.Title: What a Joke.
Reviews.Author: A. Dorsey
Reviews.Content: This camera is abysmal.  After switching from Sony I had to switch back quicker than Amazon's two day shipping. I couldn't believe I had paid so much money for a camera whose images came out discolored and dreary and whose mega-zoom did not (and would not) focus. What is this? A joke? This camera was bulky and uncomfortable.It had very few features and it's UI looked like it was from the 90's. And did I mention that it took poor pictures? Maybe this camera isn't for me. I just want to point and click. I'm sure there are some pros out there who can get this thing to work, but if you're like me, and you just want to snap photos for your vacation or at a party, look elsewhere. Search well, and be sure to return anything you're not satisfied with. You did pay for it.

Reviews.Title: Garbage product
Reviews.Author: Al m
Reviews.Content: This cam is no good. iPhone 4s takes better pics.Get the canon s100 that camera is amazing.I was not impressed from this camera from the moment it came out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Worse camera ever
Reviews.Author: Exhausted
Reviews.Content: This camera failed after one day.  Nothing went right with this camera.  First thing I noticed was it charges up the battery in the camera.  This means you need to tie up your camera just to charge up the battery.  The cable was fitted so that you can either charge it up on a USB port or connect it to a plug adapter.  Unwittingly I guess the plug was not all the way in so after 4 hours of charging I turned it on and noticed the batter was still low.  This makes the cable suspect in getting it to work.  Anyway I wanted to test it out a bit to see how it performs.  The first thing it ask you to do is to set the language.  Not reading the instructions I pressed the wrong button and it switched to a non English language and I did not know how to switch it back.  Luckily turning it off and on did not save that setting,  whew!!  Anyway I took the camera outside and took some pictures.  I noticed it took a long time after you take a flash picture.  I don't know if this is because the battery was low.  Anyway without warning the camera blanked out without even retracting the lens.  I could not turn it on anymore to retract the lens.  Luckily I was at home where I can charge it up but what if I was on the go, how can I put it in a case again with the lens open and zoomed out?  So I plugged it in to charge.  After a half hour it turned on automatically and retracted the lens.  So I let it charge up over night.  The next morning I turned it on and the when in the mode to take a picture, the display was entire black.  I could not see anything through the lens.  I could see menu options but not what the camera is aiming at.  For those who think I left the lens cap on it was not on.  In fact there is no lens cap.  I could plainly see the glass lens.  After turning it on and off, taking some pictures and noticing the pictures were black I decided to return it to Costco where I bought it.  This is the worse camera I ever owned.  I next bought the Canon PowerShot SX230HS which worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Wish I Had Never Bought It
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: within 24 hours had card read error. product only lasted a week on vacation. returned for service and warranty denied. discussed with management which I felt did not care.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: vin234
Reviews.Content: The image which is taken from this camera is not good. Image are really blurred.However video from this camera is very good.

Reviews.Title: a point and shoot that does everthing
Reviews.Author: Leslie B. Mix
Reviews.Content: a great camera. it does everthing i need in small camera; stills and hd movies,so don't need a camcorder. love it

Reviews.Title: false start
Reviews.Author: cd
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. However, it broke on the airplane ride to my vacation. Not happy! Got a "lens error" message. I ran to Best Buy and bought the same one -- for less money, actually. The new one was great -- and still works.

Reviews.Title: Stuck in Ordering System
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When is the camera coming? I ordered it a couple of weeks ago, and it shows that it still hasn't shipped. Luckily, I did get the case immediately, so it can sit on my desk while I wait for the camera - NOT! The product page shows that you can still order the camera - for $20 more than I paid on the Daily Deal. So are they holding up my order while they fulfill more lucrative orders? Hmmm.

Reviews.Title: I'm Pleased with camera, But disopoined in the last shipment
Reviews.Author: Larry Chapman Jr.
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the Nikon coolpix camera. My last order is taking too long. What is the reason for this.  Larry Chapman

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera
Reviews.Author: EweyBA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera despite the negative reviews because it had features that I wanted.  I took a gamble an lost BIG time.  This is literally the worst purchase I have ever made.  The pictures are blurry if not bright light and half the time I have to turn the camera on and off over and over again to even get it to focus.Please trust the negative reviews and do not buy!

Reviews.Title: Wolves and TC
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Godzilla"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera if you are planning on taking pictures of Wolves and TC.  TC is elusive character and only this camera provides the proper timing to take his picture.  Occupy TC!!

Reviews.Title: full disclosure would be a good thing
Reviews.Author: adrian
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nikon s9100.  I bought it used, I like the camera, and it was a good price, however, the merchant might have mentioned that it did not come with a manual, that the body had been scratched on a tripod.  All the notes said was that it had just come out of the box.  I sort of assumed that I would be getting everything that had been in the box, if not the box itself.I am not returning the product.  I'm not disappointed with the purchase, however, I don't feel that the supplier gave a complete description of what I was going to be getting.  I will probably avoid purchases from this source in the future.

Reviews.Title: Watch pricing on Amazon website
Reviews.Author: stfurr "stfurr"
Reviews.Content: Watch the pricing on Amazon's website. Initially this camera is priced at $319. Within 48 hours you could get it for $296. Amazon's excuse was that they were doing it through a reseller. Not confident you can never get the lowest price with Amazon. I think you only get the lowest price when you go several times and they don't think you're going to buy. Otherwise you're always stuck with the highest price.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Ayman Ibrahim
Reviews.Content: In simple words, I never advise anyone to buy this cam.I regret buying it as its the worst camera ever I bought and I changed my complete idea about nikon after using it.You will have taking photos specially with the zoon in this cam. as it will be the worst ever...

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera ever
Reviews.Author: Diego Aldana Rivas
Reviews.Content: The shipping of these product was great, it came two days before the date.And the camera is great has more features than it says on Amazon so I was really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Focus issues
Reviews.Author: Dale J. Haakenson "dale"
Reviews.Content: I have noted reviews here that talk about initial happiness with their camera and after a week or so, they realize it doesn't work as expected as in getting blurry pictures, blaming the image stabilizer, etc. I don't have this camera--YET, but on my S8000, I have to clean the lens often to get a good focus function. This is especially when water spots get on the lens or a finger smudge. I discovered this on a big trip last summer and I just used my eyeglass cleaner on a lens wipe. After cleaning, my focus worked perfectly again.So I suspect focus issues noted here are just due to a dirty lens.

18x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom-NIKKOR ED Glass Lens.
12.1-megapixel CMOS sensor for high-speed operation and exceptional low-light performance.
3-inch Ultra-High Resolution VGA (921,000-dot) Clear Color Display
Capture 5 shots per second at full resolution
5-way VR Image Stabilization System
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)
